, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-N4U2YdpEctY/VKq9wNHcw8I/AAAAAAAA0Wk/rviJs2wlGhc/s1600/175px-deKrishnamacharya_scorpion.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"397\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-N4U2YdpEctY/VKq9wNHcw8I/AAAAAAAA0Wk/rviJs2wlGhc/s1600/175px-deKrishnamacharya_scorpion.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vagus\nnerve is the longest nerve in the human body.&nbsp;\nIt extends from within the brain on a winding road throughout the body\ndown through the intestine.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vagus nerve also,\njust so happens, to be the only nerve in the body that is present through each\none of the 7 Chakras. Besides output to the various organs in the body, the\nvagus nerve conveys sensory information about the state of the body's organs to\nthe central nervous system.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vagus nerve\nregulates the chemical levels in the digestive system so that the intestines\ncan process food and keep track of what types of nutrients are being gained\nfrom the food that is taken in. It&nbsp; keeps\nthe digestive tract in working order, contracting the muscles of the stomach\nand intestines to help process food, and sending back information about what is\nbeing digested and what the body is getting out of it.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Stems cells are directly\nconnected to the vagus nerve.&nbsp; Activating\nthe vagus nerve can stimulate stem cells to produce new cells and repair and\nrebuild your own organs.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By activating the vagus\nnerve, you can control your immune cells, reduce inflammation, and even prevent\ndisease and aging! Vagus Nerve can be activated and stimulated by Yoga -- and\nworked with energetically through chanting mantras, divine geometry like Sri\nYantra and longitudinal wave frequency.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vagus nerve acts as the\nmind-body connection, and it is the cabling behind your heart\u2019s emotions and\ngut instincts. Without the functions of the vagus nerve, you would find it\ndifficult to speak, breathe, or eat, and your heartbeat would become extremely\nirregular.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An underactive vagus\nnerve can lead to a condition called gasteroparesis. This condition leads to\nnausea, heartburn, stomach pains, spasms in the stomach and weight loss due to\nthe digestive system having too little of the chemicals it needs to break down\nfood. An underactive vagus nerve can also lead to a dropping heart rate.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Scientists have\ndiscovered that artificial Vagus Nerve Stimulation (VNS), through electrical\nimpulses via a surgically implanted pacemaker like device, shows promising\nresults in reducing depression, anxieties and conditions such as epilepsy and\nobesity.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We are just scratching the tip of the iceberg here, as vagus nerve in\nconjunction with amygdala stimulation can do wonders.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vagus nerve is stimulated\nwhen we feel empathy.&nbsp; When we connect\nwith someone else's emotions and feel for them, the Vagus nerve gets\nstimulated.&nbsp; Vagus nerve is attached to\nemotions, and hence the right lobe of our brain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/04/rape-of-subconscious-mind-capt-ajit.html</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The parasympathetic\nsystem is pretty automatic and not within that \"conscious\" control.\nSometimes you need to step back and \"allow\" intelligent conscious\nmorphogenetic energy to flow the way it normally would if you didn't put up a\nfight or flight.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Human Beings have an\nAutonomic Nervous System (ANS) that is the body\u2019s automatic regulatory system\nof nerves and controls that do all the background tasks that keep the body\noperating. The ANS is comprised of three separate subsystems, the\nParasympathetic Nervous System (PNS), the Sympathetic Nervous System (SNS) and\nthe Enteric Nervous System (ENS).</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Parasympathetic\nNervous System is responsible for many of our resting functions such as\nlowering heart rate, increasing digestive &amp; gland activity and sexual\narousal, the Sympathetic Nervous System is mainly associated with modulation of\nhormones and neurotransmitters relating to \u201cflight or fight\u201d responses.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When things in our life\nbecome \u2018second nature\u2019, like driving, typing etc they are effectively processed\nthrough our ENS rather than our CNS. The cerebrospinal system is the organ of\nthe conscious mind and is the channel through which we receive conscious\nperception from the physical senses, and exercise control over the movements of\nthe body. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While the cerebrospinal\nor central nervous system (CNS)&nbsp; has the\nbrain as its control center, the ENS has a ganglionic mass in the belly known\nas the Solar Plexus, often referred to as our second brain, as its central\nprocessing unit and it is in this coprocessor that most of our everyday tasks\nget executed from.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The vagus nerve is the\nmost important element of the parasympathetic nervous system (the one that\ncalms you down by controlling your relaxation response).</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When an athlete is said\nto be \u2018in the zone\u2019 and performing at near perfect levels, it is because they\nare practically and literally almost unconscious and functioning entirely\nthrough their ENS.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vagus nerve is\nresponsible for speech, swallowing, keeping the larynx open for breathing, slowing\nheart rate, monitoring and initiating digestive processes, and modulating\ninflammation, among other actions.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-rwW14kGcnOw/VKq_Sx-QiQI/AAAAAAAA0Ww/Hwyn0UX_1Z0/s1600/F1.larfrge.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-rwW14kGcnOw/VKq_Sx-QiQI/AAAAAAAA0Ww/Hwyn0UX_1Z0/s1600/F1.larfrge.jpg\" width=\"536\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The vagus rerve arises\nfrom the medulla in the brain and passes through the skull down within the\nchest cavity where it branches off in multiple directions to innervate organs\nand muscles. 85% of the nerve fibers are devoted to sending information from\nthe organs/gut back to the brain. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vagus nerve also\nrelays information to the brain from what is known as the Enteric Nervous\nSystem (ENS).&nbsp; The ENS is our\n\"second brain\" controlling the digestive process; it is made up of\nover 500 million neurons that surround the digestive tract. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Like I said before , it\nis called a second brain because it can function independently from the brain\nif the Vagus nerve is severed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Different postures that\nare adopted during Ashtanga yoga exercise helps in releasing pressure from the\ndelicate nerve fibers. Vagus nerve stimulation (VNS) activates\nanti-inflammatory pathways that work in the digestive tract.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">VNS to be a possible\ntreatment for chronic depression in people that didn't respond to any other\ntreatments . Defects in the normal functioning of Vagus nerve may impair the\nnormal control mechanisms that modulate the gastric acid secretion.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By deep\nbreathing, you activate the vagus nerve and bring balance between your\nparasympathetic and sympathetic nervous system rn, nausea and weight loss.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All this was known to\nAyurveda more than 6000 years ago. &nbsp;The\n108 marma points of&nbsp; Kalari and Ayurveda\nwere mostly to stimulate the Vagus nerve and the Amydgala.. &nbsp;Pranayama affects the amygdala. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The amygdala is the\nmost sensitive structure and most active structures in the brain. It uses more\nblood than any other part of the brain. We humans are conscious creatures\nbecause we have more amygdala nuclei.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-6P_z0VGuVW0/VKq_axPsYpI/AAAAAAAA0W4/h9AO_PlrYeA/s1600/amygdala_and_medial_prefro5ntal_cortex_vmpfc.jpeg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-6P_z0VGuVW0/VKq_axPsYpI/AAAAAAAA0W4/h9AO_PlrYeA/s1600/amygdala_and_medial_prefro5ntal_cortex_vmpfc.jpeg\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The amygdala has in\nturn been implicated in nearly every psychiatric disorder. We don\u2019t have\nanimals with mood swings, and OCD , right?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The amygdala has a\nsubstantial role in mental states, and is related to many psychological\ndisorders. Children with anxiety disorders tend to have a smaller left\namygdala.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Larger amygdalae allow\nfor greater emotional intelligence, enabling greater societal integration and\ncooperation with others.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are functional\ndifferences between the right and left amygdala.&nbsp; Electrical stimulations of the right amygdala\ninduce negative emotions, especially fear and sadness.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In contrast,\nstimulation of the left amygdala&nbsp; mostly\ninduces happiness.&nbsp; The left amygdala\nplays a role in the brain's reward system. The amygdala is the seat of emotion.\nPsychopaths lack emotion. They lack empathy, remorse, guilt. Brain scans of\npsychopaths show a deformation in the amygdala compared to non-psychopaths.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;It\nis the amygdala which jolts our bodies in fear,&nbsp;\nform emotional memories,&nbsp; helps us\nfeel our dreams and can shape the effects of certain stress disorders and\nphobias.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The two amygdale sit on\nthe horn-like tips of the hippocampus. They work with our sympathetic nervous\nsystem to put the body in a state of \u201cfight-or-flight\u201d. The amygdala has an\nimportant role in memory.&nbsp; It reminds us,\nfor better or worse, of past situations.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since it is so emotional, the amygdala\nis responsible for those persistent thoughts and extra mental baggage we wish\nwe would forget.&nbsp; It nags us with\nrecollections of painful or shocking events. So when a woman jumps out of her\nskin with a terrible shriek at the sight of a rat \u2013 its is just an example of\nher amygdala in action!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Stimulating the\namygdala by meditation and Pranayama&nbsp; can\nhelp you enter a psychological state of flow. Activating the amygdala in a\npositive way stimulates higher order mental processes. This can improve\ncreativity and intelligence while elevating positive emotion. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are also links (\nwhich can be modified ) between homosexuality and the connectivity of the\namygdala to the rest of the brain. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Homosexuality depends\non hormonal factors operating during fetal life and NOT genetics. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No baby is born a\nhomosexual. While the amygdala is almost fully developed at birth, the\nprefrontal cortex does not mature until early adulthood.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Damage to the amygdala\ncan thus result in behavioral deficits such as autism, post traumatic stress\nsyndrome, child abuse, alcoholism, etc. The amygdala is not only sensitive to\nphysical hurt but also to emotional hurt.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So it is involved in both the basic emotions\nsuch as pain, pleasure, fear, disgust, surprise, and anger but also in social\nemotions, viz., shame, guilt, love, embarrassment, envy, jealousy, and pride.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In this state you can\neasily overcome problems and disregard distractions. Being in flow on\nauto-pilot results in single-minded focus and joy that comes from losing\nyourself in productive activity. Trivial issues don't slow you down when you\nare actively engaged and living creatively.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The amygdala plays a\ncentral role in generating fear in response to external threats. The amygdala\nreceives sensory information from two separate pathways: a short route and a\nlong route.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Like all sensory\ninformation, the message is first routed to the thalamus. Then information is\nsent directly to the amygdala (short route), which produces a fast reaction to\nthe situation. Other information travels from the thalamus through the cortex\n(visual, auditory, prefrontal, etc.) and then to the amygdala (long route).&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\ncortex evaluates the situation, assigns it a meaning, and if the meaning is\nthreatening, then the amygdala is informed and produces the appropriate\nresponse.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gay women and gay men\nare more likely to be left-handed. The right amygdala is also linked with\ntaking action as well as being linked to negative emotions, which may help\nexplain why males tend to respond to emotionally stressful stimuli\nphysically.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The left amygdala allows for\nthe recall of details, but it also results in more thought rather than action\nin response to emotionally stressful stimuli, which may explain the lack of\nphysical response in women.&nbsp; Gamma-Amino\nButyric acid (GABA) is an amino acid which acts as a neurotransmitter in the\ncentral nervous system.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Astanga Yoga\nincreases</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">our GABA levels , which\nreduces stress.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">GABA levels and mood are\npositively affected by yoga practice. Low levels of GABA are linked to\ndepression and anxiety. GABA is the major neurotransmitters in the central\nnervous system, and especially in the cerebral cortex, which is where thinking\noccurs and sensations are interpreted.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://ytimg.googleusercontent.com/vi/8Ow5tAp6IyQ/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/8Ow5tAp6IyQ&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/8Ow5tAp6IyQ&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">GABA is made in brain cells from\nglutamate, and functions as an inhibitory neurotransmitter \u2013 meaning that it\nblocks nerve impulses.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Glutamate acts as\nan excitatory neurotransmitter and when bound to adjacent cells encourages them\nto \u201cfire\u201d and send a nerve impulse. GABA does the opposite and tells the\nadjoining cells not to \u201cfire\u201d, not to send an impulse.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Without GABA, nerve\ncells fire too often and too easily.&nbsp;\nAnxiety disorders such as panic attacks, seizure disorders, and numerous\nother conditions including addiction, headaches, Parkinson's syndrome, and\ncognitive impairment are all related to low GABA activity.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The less GABA, the more\nnerve transmissions occur. Depressed and bipolar patients to have lower levels\nof GABA in their blood plasma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 115%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/12/in-zone-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 115%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 115%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"font-size: large; line-height: 24px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/02/in-flow-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"font-size: large; line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"font-size: large; line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large; line-height: 24px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/12/gut-feeling-and-intuition-capt-ajit.html</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201c<i>The lower knowledge is\nthe knowledge of the phenomenal world. In reality it is ignorance, for it does\nnot lead to the Highest Good. The seer of the Upanishads asks the aspirant to\nacquire both the knowledge of the relative world and the Knowledge of Ultimate\nReality. When by the pursuit of the former he fails to attain true freedom and\nimmortality, he cultivates the latter.</i>\u201d <b>Mundaka Upanishad Mantra, 2.2.11, 5000\nBC</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Modern medicine has\nnever looked on the human body as a whole like a Ayurvedic physician.&nbsp; Allopathic has divided up the body into several\npart s \u2013 the cardiovascular system, the respiratory system, the cellular\nsystem, the digestive system, the endocrine system, etc. They do NOT understand\nthe concept of body mind and spirit, which the ancient maharishis envisaged in\nall their wisdom.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Meditation is an\nexercise of the mind and is a part of yoga . &nbsp;What physical\nexercise is to the body, meditation is to the mind.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Silencing the body is easy,\nbut silencing the mind is difficult in this modern age. &nbsp;Silencing is about grace, harmony and\ntranquility. &nbsp;Exhaustion is NOT\ntranquility.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the modern age\npeople get stressed, and they need to still the mind--the chattering monkey,\nwhich remains entangled in the past and the imagined future, but never in the\npresent.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meditation is about\nholding your mind to the present. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\naim of every form of meditation is to still the mind, or you cant purify it and\nget rid of deep rooted negativities , which affect your health and even give\nyou severe migraines.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meditation is a\nsurgical operation of your subconscious mind to remove and discard negativity /\nego and improve tolerance, grace and kindness.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For a layman-- you are\nstressed when your hands feel cold, your heart rate, breathing, and muscle\ntension increases. The result is that your immune system goes for a toss and\nyou get depressed or burnt out.. Depression is a weird feeling of loss .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meditation </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">teaches you to look inwards, with awareness ,\nwithin yourself and know the true nature of all sensations, and loosen the\nstranglehold of habits and vices.. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">He\nscans his own body and sees where the stress and tension is.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He just witnesses , he\ndoes not react. &nbsp;His mind does not\ncontrol him, rather he controls his mind. &nbsp;It is a universal remedy for all universal\nills.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let me talk about\nVipasana Meditation-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Find a quiet place to\nsit for 15 minutes. place where you can sit comfortably, undisturbed, for at\nleast 20 minutes. Background noises like the sound of a car horn or a ticking\nclock should not be considered hindrances, and in fact can be legitimate objects\nof mindfulness.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Don't wear earplugs .&nbsp;\nWear loose clothing&nbsp; and be bare\nfeet. Sit with your back and head held straight. You may sit on the floor or in\na chair. Keep your eyes closed. If you must move, notice how and why you are\nmoving. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Simply be mindful of\nin-and-out breathing. You may feel that your breathing is too short, too long,\ntoo gentle or too heavy. Do not try to control it. Stop judging. Just let it\nbe, let it settle by itself as you watch.&nbsp;\nIt is the process of watching which is the meditation, not what you are\nwatching. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you become\ndistracted, gently refocus your attention on your breathing. Keep watching.\nJust breathe... As the abdomen rises, observe the motion from beginning to end\nwith your mind. When the abdomen falls, do the same. That's it. Just keep\nwatching the rising-falling movements. You don't have to do anything to them.\nJust know the movements without judging or describing them.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Restrict your attention\nto what is occurring in the immediate present moment. Don't think about the\npast or future\u2014 don't think about anything at all. Let go of worries, concerns,\nand memories. Empty your mind of everything except the movements occurring\nright now. But don't think about the motions; just know them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In insight meditation\nthe aim is not to think, but only to know. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As the abdomen expands,\nsay the word \"rising\" in your mind. When it contracts, say\n\"falling.\" Continue to note rising, falling, rising, falling, from\none moment to the next. Ninety-percent of your attention should be on the\nactual movement instead of on the label. The aim in Vipassana is to know the\nobject itself, not the word.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The abdomen should not\nbe visualized. You only have to know the movements. Be sure to breathe\nnaturally; don't try to control the breath in any way. A mental note identifies\nthe object in general but not in detail. For example, when a sound pulls your\nattention away, label it \"hearing\" instead of car horn,\"\n\"voices\" or \"barking dog.\" <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If an unpleasant\nsensation arises, note \"pain \" or \"feeling\" instead of\n\"knee pain\" or \"my back pain.\" Then return your attention\nto the primary object. When aware of a fragrance, say the mental note\n\"smelling\" for a moment or two. You don't have to identify the scent.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The motto is:\n\"Focus and forget it,\" or \"know and let go.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Healing is NOT a\nphysical process, rather it is mental. Mind can wipe mistakes off the DNA\nblueprint and destroy any disease that has disturbed the design. DNA's ability\nto repair itself is affected adversely when a person is in depression. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meditation experiences\nsilence, and is devoid of drives, wishes, fears , thoughts and emotions.\nAfterwards when the mind returns to its usual level of consciousness, it has\nacquired some freedom to move.. Grace and peace are the hallmarks of a healthy\nnon-delusional mind in a healthy body.. The happiness is stable.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We have 5 senses \u2013 sight,\nhearing, smell, taste and feel.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; God\nhas given us narrow bandwidths which became even more narrow as our original 12\nstrand DNA , NIL junk, became degraded to 2 strand , 97% junk.&nbsp;&nbsp; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many Christians and\nMuslims think that prayer can substitute for&nbsp;\nmeditation. &nbsp;Sorry ! &nbsp;The former is a petition to&nbsp; God, and the other is a detached observation\nof one's own mind, and its processes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the modern world, ancient\nVedic meditation is used as a non-religious technique for relaxation and stress\nreduction for long-term psychological improvements. &nbsp;&nbsp;Meditation is done to purify the mind and\ngain insight.&nbsp; It abstracts the self from\nconscious thought, and frees the mind from feelings that cause stress and\nsuffering.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It fosters creative\nintelligence, raise consciousness, and enables fuller use to be made of mental\npotential. &nbsp;The spiritual aims are peace\nof mind, wisdom, and, ultimately, a state of enlightenment or\nself-realization.&nbsp; It is a&nbsp; form of natural healing, and helps people\ncope with&nbsp; anxiety, depression, and drug\ndependence.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The attention is\nfocused on monitoring the breath, and noting thoughts crossing the mind,\nwithout any judgement or attempt at control, but as a silent and detached\nwitness.&nbsp; &nbsp;If the mind throws up distractions, the\nmeditator returns to simply observing the breath each time the distraction\nhappens.&nbsp; &nbsp;A relaxed and unhurried attitude is important,\nsince slowing down and observing the mind to see how it works is central to the\nphilosophy behind meditation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Using the mantra\ntechnique, the meditator concentrates on a mantra&nbsp; to banish intrusive thoughts and thus achieve\nprogressively quieter levels of thinking until thought itself is transcended.\nMantras are essentially in Sanskrit being a divine language.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The subtle vitalizing\nfrequencies of mantras activate psychic energies and awaken our intuitive\nfaculties. &nbsp;&nbsp;The purpose of meditation in\nmodern times is to destress, to stop the destructive mind chatter, for some\ntime in a day--&nbsp; to STILL THE MIND.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHEN YOU STILL YOUR\nMIND,&nbsp; NO CHEMICALS ARE PRODUCED. &nbsp;The brain must not be allowed to pump in\ndestructive F&amp;F ( fight &amp; flight ) chemicals into your body, which will\nshorten your life.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The reason why people\nremain mired in negativity is because of the beliefs they have inherited over\ntime. &nbsp;Beliefs are subconscious .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We can use our\nconscious mind to observe ,to introspect and dip into the subconscious where\nour beliefs are embedded , in order to eliminate it. &nbsp;You can meditate, to rewrite these negative\nprogrammes that cause you misery.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During meditation\nthinking is separated from perceiving, so that the individual can stand apart\nfrom the emotional self. Indians use meditation to purify the mind and gain\ninsight. &nbsp;&nbsp;Meditation again, is a detached\nobservation of one's own mind, and its processes, after squelching the 5\nsenses.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the modern world,\nmeditation is used as a non-religious technique for relaxation and stress\nreduction. The spiritual aims are peace of mind, wisdom, and, ultimately, a\nstate of enlightenment or self-realization. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chanting mantras have an effect of banishing\nintrusive thoughts . It does a fantastic job of stopping hyperventilating, and\nslowing &nbsp;down your breathing. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">~ </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0918\u0947\u0930\u0902\u0921</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u0902\u0939\u093f\u0924\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By\nassuming the position of Shambhavi Mudra a Yogi should see the self.&nbsp; When the Brahma is seen in the form of a dot\nhe should fix his mind on it and nowhere else.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nA Yogi who knows the science of Shambhavi he himself becomes Brahma&nbsp; and none else.&nbsp;&nbsp; I, Lord Maheshwara (Shiva), am telling this\nagain and again that this is truth</span></i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">.-&nbsp;&nbsp; <b>Gherand\nSamhita ( Hatha Yoga ) 5000 BC <o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The white invader has\nkicked forward Gherand Samhita by an amazing 6600 years --thank god that they\ndid NOT claim to have written it like our Vedas .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As per the 7000 year\nold Vedas,&nbsp; perception occurs in the gap\nof alert attention. This is the inner space.&nbsp;\nThere are many methods to create this gap.&nbsp; Shambhavi Mudra is the most potent and\neasiest method.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Negative thoughts&nbsp; create negative feelings and hence stress and\nillness.&nbsp; Our inner voice evaluates,\njudges, compares and worries.&nbsp;&nbsp; Most\npeople live with such a tormentor in their head draining them of energy. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is an awful burden\nnot to be able to stop thinking.&nbsp; Up to\n90 % of most people\u2019s thoughts are meaningless playbacks of old broken\n\u201crecords\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Silencing the body is\neasy, but silencing the mind is difficult in this modern age.&nbsp; Silencing is about grace, harmony and\ntranquility. Exhaustion or being drugged out of your mind is NOT tranquility. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the modern age\npeople get stressed, and they need to still the mind--the chattering monkey,\nwhich remains entangled in the past and the imagined future, but never in the\npresent.&nbsp; A person stops thinking either\nwhen he is dead or when he has realised.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When your ego powered\nmind is chattering like a monkey or the angry sea, you miss the truth.&nbsp; Truth can be communicated only in silence.\nFor this deep silence you need to have harmony between the mind, body and spirit.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Shambhavi Mudra synchronizes the 2 brain lobes to create inner balance.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Skeletal muscles can\nperform extreme feats of strength for a few seconds but are much less capable\nduring prolonged activity. &nbsp;Most of the\nextra energy required during &nbsp;bursts of\nactivity ( like a short sprint ) cannot come from the oxidative processes\nbecause they are too slow to respond. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Instead, the extra\nenergy comes from anaerobic sources: (1) ATP already present in the muscle\ncells, (2) phosphocreatine in the cells, and (3) anaerobic energy released by\nglycolytic breakdown of glycogen to lactic acid.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Skeletal muscle\ncontraction enables our joints to move and allows us to engage in physical\nactivity and exercise. &nbsp;&nbsp;Glycolysis is a\nform of anaerobic metabolism. &nbsp;Glucose,\nobtained mainly from intramuscular glycogen stores, is metabolized to lactic\nacid under conditions of short duration, high intensity exercise when oxygen\nsupply is limited. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Glycolysis provides ATP\nmore rapidly than oxidative metabolism. &nbsp;Hydrolysis of adenosine triphosphate (ATP)\nprovides chemical energy required for the mechanical work of skeletal muscle\ncontraction. Mind you, ATP was discovered by an Indian named Yellapragada.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/08/yellapragada-subbarow-nobel-prize-and.html\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/08/yellapragada-subbarow-nobel-prize-and.html</span></a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because the supply of\nATP within muscles is small, metabolic pathways that lead to resynthesis of ATP\nmust be activated to keep pace with demands for continued muscle contraction. &nbsp;These pathways are either anaerobic (without oxygen)\nor aerobic (oxygen required). &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ATP is\nsynthesized from adenosine diphosphate (ADP) with energy provided by\nphosphagens, anaerobic glycolysis, or oxidative metabolism.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If aerobic is Brahma (\nTamas ) &nbsp;, anaerobic is Shiva ( Rajas ) ,\nwith Vishnu ( Sattva ) acting as a mediator . &nbsp;&nbsp;Dance\nof the opposites with a mediator is DVAITA Vedanta.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/05/dvaita-vedanta-of-sanatana-dharma-or.html</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are two anaerobic\npower systems available to the body:---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Adenosine\nTriphosphate-Creatine Phosphate (ATP-CP) system,&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">and<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The anaerobic\nglycolysis/lactic acid system.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ATP-CP system is\nused for efforts lasting less than 10 seconds; while the anaerobic glycolysis\nsystem powers efforts longer than 10 seconds, lasting up to a few minutes<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Anaerobic training is\nachieved through: speed and power training<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Anaerobic training\nincreases athlete's lactate tolerance the size of the fast twitch muscle\nfibres.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A higher anaerobic\ncapacity enables an athlete to: &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Perform at a higher\nintensity over a specific distance\u2014and, when required maintain a high intensity\nfor a longer period of time</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Usain Bolt is a 100\nmetres world champion because he does<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"> ANaerobic </span>training - the Adenosine\nTriphosphate-Creatine Phosphate (ATP-CP) system.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While running 400\nmetres his body switches to the anaerobic glycolysis/lactic acid system.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A marathon runner\u2014after\nbreasting the tape takes his victory lap in a totally different mode.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\">Both the ANaerobic and\naerobic systems are utilized during training and athletic performance. </span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><b>Below: Usain Bolt and the ALSO RANS !</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://ytimg.googleusercontent.com/vi/yGVgKJTJkQo/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/yGVgKJTJkQo&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/yGVgKJTJkQo&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Both the anaerobic and\naerobic power systems are important to the athlete and each needs to be trained\nto optimize their athletic performance. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">All muscle work is\npowered by ATP.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Muscles use ATP as an\nenergy source.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">ATP is created in\nessentially two ways. One is by aerobic metabolism using oxygen carried in the\nbloodstream. This is a sure and steady way to create virtually unlimited\nsources of energy; however, it has a limit on how fast it can work.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The athlete has to\nensure that they train both power systems to maximize their athletic\nperformance. The anaerobic system is utilized in all-out efforts of exercise\nlasting up to 50 seconds.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The aerobic system,\nalso known as aerobic glycolysis, powers continuous steady state exercise for\nlonger time. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aerobic training\nincreases aerobic capacity through adaptations to the athlete's oxygen\ntransport and utilization systems. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aerobic glycolysis is\ndependent upon the athlete's aerobic capacity, which is their functional\ncapacity for oxygen transport (i.e. distribution of oxygen rich blood to body\ntissues) and utilization (i.e. ability of muscle to use available oxygen to\nproduce energy.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Trained marathon\nrunners have a greater ability to quickly deliver oxygen to the working muscles\nwhich increases the ability to use aerobic metabolism at a higher exercise\nintensity. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During intense power\nexercise, such as fast 100 metres sprinting or lifting heavy weights, muscles\nrely on anaerobic metabolism, which can only produce a certain amount of energy\nat a time, unlike the aerobic metabolism system, which can produce energy over\nhours like for a marathon runner .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A good sports coach is\nNOT a rustic CHOOT who gets Dronacharya awards without knowing the science\nbehind athelete training. &nbsp;&nbsp;He would have NEVER heard of VO2 max and how\nto increase athletic performance. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-YPgayJXET1U/VKw9pA9SjGI/AAAAAAAA0Zw/hXTNYZ1oK1E/s1600/downl9L7oad.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the aerobic system\nenergy (ATP) is produced through Pyruvic Acid and Lipid/Protein fragments\nentering the Kreb Cycle and the Electron Transport Cycle.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Creatine phosphate (CP)\nis stored in larger amounts than ATP and can rapidly resynthesis ATP\nanaerobically. Breakdown of CP within skeletal muscle occurs quickly during\nhigh intensity exercise.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-oBdw2fAkOPA/VKw8ly_fixI/AAAAAAAA0ZU/YsZQfQytRDU/s1600/downlO8oad.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Glycolysis is a form of\nanaerobic metabolism. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Glucose, obtained\nmainly from intramuscular glycogen stores, is metabolized to lactic acid under\nconditions of short duration, high intensity exercise when oxygen supply is\nlimited. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Glycolysis provides ATP more\nrapidly than oxidative metabolism.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-oVdXTLbm8cY/VKw8xp0k2EI/AAAAAAAA0Zc/IF3MpAVsICk/s1600/i8I3Bmages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em;
