, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In this blogsite along\nthere are several technical posts on Nitrogen \u2014&nbsp;\nCapt Ajit Vadakayil is professionally qualified and certified to talk\nabout Nitrogen, Oxyegan and Carbon dioxide . .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/11/cpr-ambu-bag-and-oxygen-resuscitation.html</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##################################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">This is what B.K.S.\nIyengar wrote in his book \u201c<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Light on Pranayama</span>\u201d.&nbsp;<b>&nbsp; </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He has told the truth\neven though he does NOT have a technical mind .&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE :&nbsp; Bhastrika means bellows: the air is forced to\ncome in and out of the lungs, similar to the work of the bellows. In other\ntypes of pranayama an inhalation influences the length, quality and rhythm of\nan exhalation, but in bhastrika it is an exhalation that dictates force and\ntiempo.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In bhastrika an inhalation and an exhalation are done with an effort.\nSound produced during this pranayama is similar to the sound of the bellows.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Both these pramayamas\n(kapalabhati and bhastrika) activate and strengthen liver, spleen, pancreas and\nstomach muscles, as well as improve digestion. They dry up sinuses and stop a\nrunny nose. They cause a sense of happiness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Notes and warnings:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1. Bhastrika generates\nprana that in its turn activates the whole body. As too quick kindling blows up\nan engine or a boiler, as too prolonged bhastrika endangers the lungs and\nexhausts respiratory system because the process of breathing is too intensive. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2. As the sound\ndecreases, stop and start again, or lessen number of blow-throughs and cycles,\nor make a pause in a practice for one day.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3. Make a pause in your\npractice when you feel irritation or tension.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4. Stop the practice\nwhen the sound of an exhalation is incorrect or blows-through do not go\nproperly. Any forced action leads to injury or nose bleeding.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People with weak body\nconstitution or limited capacities of the lungs should not try to practice\nbhastrika or kapalabhati, as their blood vessels and brain may run risks.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The following people\nshould not practice pranayamas:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0430) women, as forced\nblows-through can lead to prolapce of abdominal organs and the uterus, and\nbreasts may get weak and get flabby;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">b) people suffering\nfrom deseases of eyes and ears (for example, pus in the ears, retinal\ndetachement, glaucoma);<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">c) people with high or\nlow blood pressure;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">d) people suffering\nfrom nasal bleeding, intensive pulsation or pain in the ears.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;If anything of the mentioned above happened to\nyou, stop the practice immediately for several days. &nbsp;Then try again, if the symptoms persist, it\nmeans that the practice does not suit you.&nbsp;\n&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many people have a\nwrong understanding thinking that bhastrika pranayama awakens\nkundalini-shakti.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Authoritative books\naffirm the same concerning many pranayamas and asanas, but it is far from the\ntruth.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is no doubt that bhastrika\nand kapalabhati refresh the mind and agitate it for activity, but if people think\nthat by that they awaken their kundalini, in a result thay can damage their\nbody, nerves and brains.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#################################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Let me break a bombshell\ntoday.</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Many old people while\ndoing hyperventilation on their beds have died and their deaths have been\npronounced natural.</span></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hypoxia (also known as\nHypoxiation or Anoxemia) is a condition in which the body or a region of the\nbody is deprived of adequate oxygen supply <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hypoxia is an insidious\nkiller. &nbsp;There is a tendency for euphoria\nto develop while motor skills and reasoning abilities deteriorate. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hyperventilation may be\ndescribed as a respiratory rate excessive for the body's oxygen requirements.\nIt may be voluntary or involuntary and can occur in relation to many different\nactivities.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hyperventilation may be\nobvious, as in the case of children preparing to compete in underwater\nswimming, or it may be covert as for example when the respiratory rate\nincreases from a required 12 per minute to an excessive 15 per minute and\nremains elevated for a prolonged time. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-aiiglWI0Uak/VK4e-c3vQ7I/AAAAAAAA0gU/aVQ3gxPol1Q/s1600/human-perforK8K67Kmance-and-limitation-revised-28-728.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-aiiglWI0Uak/VK4e-c3vQ7I/AAAAAAAA0gU/aVQ3gxPol1Q/s1600/human-perforK8K67Kmance-and-limitation-revised-28-728.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Whatever the cause the\nresults are the same. &nbsp;Carbon dioxide,\nthe most potent stimulus to respiration, is blown off in excessive amounts. &nbsp;The PACO2 falls and respiratory alkalosis\ndevelops. &nbsp;The cerebral vessels become\nconstricted . <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-8TG9UNSShrM/VK4el2E8SpI/AAAAAAAA0gM/UaznSTmNwt8/s1600/7-1390032-c0b452e3-0221-4962-9d806YU-f754cf0716a4.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"338\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-8TG9UNSShrM/VK4el2E8SpI/AAAAAAAA0gM/UaznSTmNwt8/s1600/7-1390032-c0b452e3-0221-4962-9d806YU-f754cf0716a4.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You feel drunken dizzy,\na coldness and tingling around the lips and a feeling as though there was a\nband around the head. &nbsp;Nausea may be\npresent. &nbsp;Peripherally there is\nvasodilatation and stimulation of sensory nerves causing a sensation of pins\nand needles in the hands and in the feet. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-IUbhYHUbC1s/VK4d7Y-S6nI/AAAAAAAA0f8/EPEEOtsiTg8/s1600/oxygen3GSation-23-728.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"300\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-IUbhYHUbC1s/VK4d7Y-S6nI/AAAAAAAA0f8/EPEEOtsiTg8/s1600/oxygen3GSation-23-728.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If hyperventilation\ncontinues carpopedal spasm develops and the subject may become unconscious and\ndevelop frank tetany. &nbsp;With the breath\nheld the carbon dioxide levels build up once more and the symptoms disappear in\nreverse order.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-1EUCPsv42Aw/VK4c3WdkVgI/AAAAAAAA0fk/tO6NYNFg_ME/s1600/highaltitudephysi87Fology-19-728.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"300\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-1EUCPsv42Aw/VK4c3WdkVgI/AAAAAAAA0fk/tO6NYNFg_ME/s1600/highaltitudephysi87Fology-19-728.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Obviously such a chain\nof events can lead to an accident. This has been documented in some incidents\nin young fighter pilots or untrained private pilots who have inadvertently\nflown into bad weather and have kept the microphone button depressed,\nbroadcasting their breath patterns up to their final moment.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-0-bBhxDENrE/VK4dHpYMbkI/AAAAAAAA0fs/b_L64JxSqCk/s1600/lungs-carb04n-dioxide.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-0-bBhxDENrE/VK4dHpYMbkI/AAAAAAAA0fs/b_L64JxSqCk/s1600/lungs-carb04n-dioxide.gif\" width=\"590\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hyperventilation is\nexcessive ventilation of the lungs, beyond what is required to achieve normal\narterial blood gases. Hyperventilation has little effect on arterial pO2 and\nalmost no effect on oxygen saturation which is nearly 100% under normal\ncircumstances. Its main effect is to lower pCO2 and produce a respiratory\nalkalosis.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0T9XXYAguQY/VK4cW9GAtRI/AAAAAAAA0fU/86uYvnuU_sw/s1600/O2-norm86al.bmp\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"452\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0T9XXYAguQY/VK4cW9GAtRI/AAAAAAAA0fU/86uYvnuU_sw/s1600/O2-norm86al.bmp\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A secondary hypocalcaemia also occurs as calcium dissociation is\nshifted towards the unionised, bound form. In the lungs, oxygen from inhaled\nair is exchanged for carbon dioxide from the blood. This process takes place\nbetween the alveoli (tiny air pockets in the lungs) and the blood vessels that\nconnect to them.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-uDJqjxMsts0/VK4dh-PZCdI/AAAAAAAA0f0/0JdsYjZcZvc/s1600/imagH74es.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-uDJqjxMsts0/VK4dh-PZCdI/AAAAAAAA0f0/0JdsYjZcZvc/s1600/imagH74es.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a person hyperventilates, this exchange of oxygen for\ncarbon dioxide is speeded up, and the person exhales too much carbon dioxide.\nThis lowered level of carbon dioxide causes the pH of the blood to increase,\nleading to alkalosis.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hyperventilation\nis the cause in unexplained accidents. &nbsp;If\none considers the symptoms of hypoxia and hyperventilation it will be seen that\nthey are very similar. &nbsp;As it is\nimperative in the air that no mistake be made, the treatment for both is to\nbreathe 100% oxygen and to reduce the rate of respiration.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">I WANT TO SEE THE FACES OF ALL MEDICAL EXPERTS ( CHOOTS ) WHO PRAISED TRIPLE SRIs HYPERVENTILATION &nbsp;. &nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"color: blue;\">Below: Yoga of Shukracharya does NOT allow chest breathing which happens during hyperventilation ( </b><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">propagated by FAKE gurus having hundreds of branches all over the world and who are darlings of R controlled media</span></i><b style=\"color: blue;\"> ) --&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">YOGA AND PRANAYAMA , ALLOWS ONLY DEEP DIAPHRAGMATIC BREATHING .</span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The diaphragm is a\nlarge, dome-shaped muscle located at the base of the lungs. &nbsp;Your abdominal muscles help move the diaphragm\nand give you more power to empty your lungs. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://ytimg.googleusercontent.com/vi/_TUZiiMy1iI/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/_TUZiiMy1iI&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/_TUZiiMy1iI&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Diaphragmatic breathing &nbsp;decreases the work of breathing by slowing\nyour breathing rate. It uses less effort and energy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Diaphragmatic Breathing\nis a way of interrupting the \"Fight or Flight\" response and triggering\nthe body's normal relaxation response.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the diaphragm\ncontracts, in conjunction with the intercostal muscles, it lowers the pressure\nin the thoracic cavity. This enables air to enter the lungs.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When breathing\nout, the diaphragm relaxes along with the intercostal muscles, allowing air to\nleave. Air may be forced out faster by increasing abdominal pressure using the\ntranverse abdominis muscle.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">75% of the people on\nthis planet do wrong type of breathing- their chest rises as the intercostal\nmuscles contract. Yet, the stomach is drawn in by activation of the tranverse\nabdominis muscle and the diaphragm is not engaged.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Whilst this might present a\nmore pleasing profile in a mirror, it reduces the volume of oxygen available by\nonly partially expanding the lungs. These people die faster.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Due to rapid more\nshallow breathing, the chest does not expand as much as it would with slower\ndeeper breaths and much of the air exchange occurs at the top of the lung\ntissue towards the head. This results in \"chest\" breathing.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You can\nsee if you are a chest breather by placing your right hand on your chest and\nyour left hand on your abdomen. As you breathe, see which hand rises more. If\nyour right hand rises more, you are a chest breather. If your left hand rises\nmore, you are an abdomen breather.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chest breathing is inefficient because the\ngreatest amount of blood flow occurs in the lower lobes of the lungs, areas\nthat have limited air expansion in chest breathers. Rapid, shallow, chest\nbreathing results in less oxygen transfer to the blood and subsequent poor\ndelivery of nutrients to the tissues.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With regular practice you will breathe\nfrom the abdomen most of the time, even while asleep. The diaphragm is a large\nmuscle located between the chest and the abdomen. When it contracts it is\nforced downward causing the abdomen to expand. This causes a negative pressure\nwithin the chest forcing air into the lungs. The negative pressure also pulls\nblood into the chest improving the venous return to the heart. This leads to\nimproved stamina in both disease and athletic activity.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Like blood, the flow of\nlymph, which is rich in immune cells, is also improved. By expanding the lung's\nair pockets and improving the flow of blood and lymph, abdominal breathing also\nhelps prevent infection of the lung and other tissues. But most of all it is an\nexcellent tool to stimulate the relaxation response that results in less\ntension and an overall sense of well being.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By getting more oxygen into your\nlungs, and then into your blood stream, your muscles will have more\n\"fuel\" and the heart will need to beat less quickly and with less effort.\nWhen this occurs, the amazing and complex interplay between the brain and the\nvarious hormone-producing parts of the body (like the adrenal cortex) will\nchange and smaller amounts of stress hormones will be released.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The liver and\nkidneys will then be able to \"catch up\" with all of the stress\nhormones in the blood stream and the fight or flight response decreases and\nthen ultimately stops.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yoga increases GABA\nlevels in the brain. &nbsp;Low GABA levels are\nassociated with depression. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Low GABA levels are\nassociated with Alzheimer\u2019s disease.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Vrecbahq5qs/VLHS1lLFNJI/AAAAAAAA0hI/7k9MExVxBys/s1600/imax87ges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"224\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Vrecbahq5qs/VLHS1lLFNJI/AAAAAAAA0hI/7k9MExVxBys/s1600/imax87ges.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Yoga increases GABA, a\nget-calm chemical .&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People who did regular yoga had significantly more GABA,\nand had increased mood and decreased anxiety, than those who didn't do the\npractice and walked instead.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-NUI0ZmmpAq4/VLHTjhdltfI/AAAAAAAA0hQ/anG3CmZmnwI/s1600/gaba-vitadgdmin-reduce-levels.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"300\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-NUI0ZmmpAq4/VLHTjhdltfI/AAAAAAAA0hQ/anG3CmZmnwI/s1600/gaba-vitadgdmin-reduce-levels.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">More than 40% of the\nsynapses in the human brain work with GABA and therefore have GABA receptors. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">GABA is classified as\nan inhibitory neurotransmitter, as opposed to excitatory neurotransmitters. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">GABA slows down neuron\nfiring. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Other neurotransmitters \u2013\nadrenaline, nor-adrenaline, dopamine, serotonin, glutamate \u2013 have an excitatory\nfunction, i.e. they stimulate neuron firing.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; Yoga and meditation helps to calm down the mental chatter and\nfree yourself from the constant loop of thoughts that keeps you awake at night.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mantras still the\nactivity of thought and helps you find a deeper level of consciousness. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><u><span style=\"color: blue;\">Om<o:p></o:p></span></u></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><u><span style=\"color: blue;\">Tat Savitur Varenyam<o:p></o:p></span></u></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><u><span style=\"color: blue;\">Bhargo Devasya Dheemahi<o:p></o:p></span></u></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><u><span style=\"color: blue;\">Dhiyo yonah Prachodayat</span></u><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(OM) OM (Dheemahi) We\nmeditate (Bhargo) upon the Spiritual Effulgence (Varenyam Devasya) of THAT\nAdorable Supreme Divine Reality (Savitur) the Source (Bhur, Bhuva, Svaha) of\nthe Physical, the Astral and the Heavenly Spheres of Existence. (TAT) May THAT\nSupreme Divine Being (Prachodayat) enlighten (Yo) which (Nah) our (Dhi Yo)\nintellect (so that we may realise the Supreme Truth).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During meditation\nthinking is separated from perceiving, so that the individual can stand apart\nfrom the emotional self.&nbsp; The reason why\npeople remain mired in negativity is because of the beliefs they have inherited\nover time. Beliefs are subconscious. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We act in the way we do\nbecause we are not aware of our beliefs and the feelings that these beliefs\ngenerate. That is why it is important to obeserve yourself and look within. We\ncan do it. That is why we are different from animals.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We can use our&nbsp; conscious mind to observe ,to introspect and\ndip into the&nbsp; subconscious where our\nbeliefs are embedded , in order to eliminate it.&nbsp; You can meditate to rewrite these negative\nprogrammes&nbsp; that cause you misery.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To be a mystic or a\nseer is not the same thing as being a spectator on the fence.&nbsp; Mysticism provides an escape from a life of\nuninspired existence. It magnifies man and gives him a hope and destiny to\nfulfill.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the modern era the\nroad to holiness necessarily passes through the world of action. &nbsp;You cant sit in a place , speak very little and call yourself a sage .&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sign of OM is the sign of Hinduism.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">OM is the first and foremost of all\nmantras. Mantra is the sound body of consciousness. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">OM is the\nsound of Cosmic Energy and contains all the sounds in itself. &nbsp; &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">All Hindu Sanskrit\nmantras start with OM and end with OM.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">OM\nsurcharges the innermost being of man with vibrations of the highest reality. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The human ear can discern only a very narrow band between 20\nHz to 20000 Hz. The rest in inaudible. This is why NO cosmic sound can be heard\nby the human ear. These cosmic sounds were heard by rishis in their spiritual\ntrances which broadened their sense spectrums.&nbsp;</span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">The earth vibrates at\n7.83 Hz and so does OM. The primordal vibrations of atoms and molecules is thus\nrepresented by OM. When 2 vibrating systems are in resonance with each other, a\nrise in the amplitude of the waves take place.&nbsp;</span></span><span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In our case, the brain\nand the global electric circuit resonance leads to a rise in amplitude in the\nwaves dancing in our brain. Rise in amplitude causes a rise in our\nconsciousness energy. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chanting OM produces a\nsonorous vibration like the buzz of a mighty transformer. The vibrations\nproduce scalar waves which calms the mind. The MMMM humming boosts the\nproduction of Nitric oxide in the body. This was known to Indians and\ndocumented 7000 years ago.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brihadyogi Yajnavalkya\nSmriti XII.5 portrays Hiranyagarbha as the original teacher of Yoga.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bhishma in the 6000\nyear old Mahabharata (Shanti Parva 300.57) speaks of a Yoga teaching\n\u201cestablished in many Yoga Shastras.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hiranyagabha ( golden\nembryo )&nbsp; Yoga tradition is a Vedic\ntradition.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patanjali in the Yoga\nSutras is only referred to as a compiler, not as an inventor of the Yoga\nteachings. He himself states, \u201cThus is the teaching of Yoga\u201d <b>(Yoga Sutras I.1)</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patanjali lived 5500\nyears ago and NOT 2200 years ago as written by the white invader.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patanjali's Yoga Sutra,\nis composed of a total of 195 sutras or aphorisms ( wisdom packed words ) .</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These sutras are structured around four padas or chapters:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samadhi Pada,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sadhana Pada,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vibhuti Pada and<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kaivalya Pada.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Yoga Sutras are not\na philosophy but a step by step method to become aware of one own being.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Each Sutra is compact\nand needs a great deal explanation as it's nature and depth of psychological\ncontent. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patanjalis Yoga is\nconcerned with liberation through meditation. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first chapter is\n\"Samadhi Pada\" a state of evenness where one is total and centered in\none self without distractions. In this chapter the Yoga, the modifications of\nthe mind, \"Samadhi\" and the concept of \"Isvarah\" God are\nexplained.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The second chapter \"Sadhana\nPada\"&nbsp; is the practice of a Yogi. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The chapter starts with\na the base conditions to start Yoga \" Tapah Svahdyaya Ishvarpranidhanani\nKriyayogah\" Austerity, selfstudy and surrender of the ego is Yoga of\naction. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patanjalis definition\nof Yoga of action is Kriya Yoga. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patanjali Yoga is even\nknown as Raja Yoga, the Yoga of understanding and transcending the mind,\nconsciousness is Raja or the king. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Ashtanga\nYoga\" Eight limbs of yoga is the heart of Patanjalis Yoga system. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are five major\nafflictions of the mind of which \"Avidya\" ignorance of ones own being\nis the root cause of all afflictions. &nbsp;These\nare explained in the second chapter \"Samadhi Pada\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ashtanga\nYoga<o:p></o:p></span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Yama (personal\ndiscipline)<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Niyama (social\ndiscipline)<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Asana (discipline of\nbody posture)<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Pranayama ( rhythmic\nbreathing exercises)<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Pratyahara (inward\nwithdrawal of the senses)<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Dharana (concentration)<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Dhyana (meditation)<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Samadhi (total\nawareness and evenness\"Sama\" of ones true self without conflicts)<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The third chapter, \"Vibhuti\nPada\" is concerned with Yogic Powers. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The fourth chapter \"\nKaivalya Pada\" is the last in the Yoga Sutras . The difference between the\nmind, consciousness and witnessing and the soul are explained.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-f2INNQX82jM/VLJ4J2IqfWI/AAAAAAAA0jM/W_W2msa8hR4/s1600/autonotyrkmic-nervous-system.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"376\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-f2INNQX82jM/VLJ4J2IqfWI/AAAAAAAA0jM/W_W2msa8hR4/s1600/autonotyrkmic-nervous-system.gif\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In swara yoga, prana or\nenergy is circulated in the body through a system of nadis or pathways, of\nwhich the three most important are known as ida, pingala and sushumna. &nbsp;These three flow up the spine, ida and pingala\ncoiling around sushumna at the centre. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ida\nterminates at the upper opening of the left nostril, pingala at the upper\nopening of the right nostril, and sushumna at sahasrara chakra at the crown of\nthe head. Ida is known as the lunar nadi because its activation produces\ncalmness and a feeling of well being. Traditionally, the colour is blue.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pingala is known as the solar nadi because its qualities are heat and dynamism.\nIts colour is red.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sushumna is the synthesis or spiritual nadi which becomes\nactive when ida and pingala are balanced. Its colour is gold.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is a direct\ncorrespondence between the states associated with the activation of ida,\npingala and sushumna nadis and the parasympathetic, sympathetic and central\nnervous systems respectively.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When we breathe in through the left nostril, ida\nnadi or the parasympathetic nervous system as well as the right hemisphere of\nthe brain are stimulated. When we breathe in through the right nostril, pingala\nnadi or the sympathetic nervous system as well as the left hemisphere of the\nbrain are stimulated.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the breath is equalised through both nostrils, the\nbrain and the sympathetic and parasympathetic systems are balanced. Then a\nstate of equilibrium is achieved in the central nervous system and the state of\nmeditation dawns as the sushumna awakens.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/12/awakening-and-raising-kundalini-after.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/12/awakening-and-raising-kundalini-after.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-825dTbA9SZM/VLJ5FfAdIjI/AAAAAAAA0jY/VbxouA9qn_U/s1600/ALL78%2BChakra.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-825dTbA9SZM/VLJ5FfAdIjI/AAAAAAAA0jY/VbxouA9qn_U/s1600/ALL78%2BChakra.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Naveen Periasamy<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">January 12, 2015 at\n12:17 PM<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dear Captain,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Please also explain in\nmore detail the following verse from Sadhana Padha,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0935\u093f\u0924\u0930\u094d\u0915\u092c\u093e\u0927\u0928\u0947</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u094d\u0930\u0924\u093f\u092a\u094d\u0930\u0915\u094d\u0937\u092d\u093e\u0935\u0928\u092e\u094d</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0965\u0969\u0969\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
