, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">people who pray to and\npraise BR Ambedkar , EVR Periyar etc -- God help these ignoramuses.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/08/cnn-ibn-poll-greatest-indian-since.html<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/07/hinduism-in-bali-turn-of-tide-and-hindu.html</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IN EVERY GOVT COLLECTORATE,\nPOLICE STATION AND JUDICIAL COURT IN INDIA , YOU FIND THE PORTRAIT OF BR\nAMBEDKAR&nbsp; -&nbsp; -&nbsp; KEPT\nTHERE BY THE WHITE INVADER&nbsp; DAYS BEFORE HE LEFT INDIA IN 1947 . .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CAN YOU IMAGINE BRITISH\nKEEPING PICTURES OF A MAN WHO IS ALIVE ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AT LEAST THEY KEPT\nSTATUES OF SAI BABA ( SHIRDI ) AFTER HE DIED.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With the 42nd Amendment\nof the Constitution of India enacted in 1976, the Preamble to the Constitution\nasserted that India is a secular nation. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The people of India have freedom of religion,\nand the state treats all individuals as equal citizens regardless of their\nreligion.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;In matters of law in modern India, however,\nthe applicable code of law is unequal, and India's personal laws - on matters\nsuch as marriage, divorce, inheritance, alimony - varies with an individual's\nreligion. &nbsp; Muslim Indians have Sharia-based Muslim Personal Law, while Hindus,\nChristians, Sikhs and other non-Muslim Indians live under common law.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MUSLIMS CAN MARRY 4\nWOMEN, BUT THEIR HANDS WILL NOT BE CHOPPED OFF - THE BEST OF BOTH WORLDS IS\nWHAT THEY GET .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">INDIA WAS DIVIDED TO\nACCOMMODATE INDIAN MUSLIMS -&nbsp; BUT MUSLIMS\nWHO STAYED BACK IN HINDU INDIA NOW WANT THE ENTIRE CAKE.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/09/uniform-civil-code-in-india-capt-ajit.html</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHEN BR AMBEDKARITES &nbsp;( DALITS ) &nbsp;BURN BUSES AND GOVT PROPERTY NOTHING HAPPENS\nTO THEM-- THEY ARE PROTECTED SPECIES, LIKE PENQUINS .&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TODAY\nTHE NE PEOPLE GET DRUNK AND GET INTO FIGHTS. IF YOU GIVE BACK AS GOOD AS YOU\nGOT , YOU WILL BE IN JAIL , FOR YOU HAVE FOUGHT AGAINST A PENQUIN .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>INDIAN CONSTITUTION\nMUST TREAT ALL CHILDREN OF BHARATMATA THE SAME.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">UNELECTED ( CHOSEN BY\nDESH DROHI FOREIGNERS ) RELIGIOUS PERSONALITIES INTERPRET OUR LAWS.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">67 YEARS AFTER\nINDEPENDENCE WE HAVE UNEQUAL CITIZENSHIP .&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WE HAVE NOT BEEN ABLE\nTO SEPARATE RELIGION AND STATE.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">INDIAN RELIGIONS HAVE\nALWAYS CO-EXISTED TILL ISLAM AND CHRISTIANITY CAME.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IF YOU GO TO AJANTA /\nELLORA / ELEPHANTA CAVES YOU CAN SEE MANY DIETIES IN ONE SINGLE CAVE.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Islamic rulers in India\ntreated Hindus as dhimmis in exchange of annual payment of jizya taxes, in a\nsharia-based state jurisprudence. With the arrival of Mughal era, Sharia was\nimposed with continued zeal<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1937 Indian Muslim\nPersonal Law (Shariat) Application Act, instead of separating state and\nreligion , did the reverse -- they established the principle that religious\nlaws of Indian Muslims can be their personal laws. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let them do it in Pakistan\n,why do it in India after 1947 ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Indian Muslim\nPersonal Law (Shariat) Application Act of 1937 continues to be the law of land\nof modern India for Indian Muslims, while parliament-based, non-religious\nuniform civil code passed in mid-1950s applies to Indians who are Hindus (which\nincludes Buddhists, Jains, Sikhs, Parsees), as well as to Indian Christians and\nJews.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The word \u2018secular\u2019 was\nadded to the Preamble of Indian Constitution in 1975.&nbsp; State support to religious schools and\npersonal laws. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>MOST MADRASSAS REFUSE TO HOIST INDIAN FLAG ON 15TH\nAUG AND 26 JAN.&nbsp;</b></span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TILL 2000 SOME OF\nTHESE MADRASSAS HAS JINNAHs PORTRAIT IN THE PRINCIPALS ROOM .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1951 Religious and\nCharitable Endowment Indian law was made which allows state governments to\nforcibly take over, own and operate Hindu temples, and collect revenue from\nofferings and redistribute that revenue to any non-temple purposes including\nmaintenance of religious institutions RABIDLY opposed to the temple .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Forty-second\nAmendment of the Constitution of India, officially known as The Constitution\n(Forty-second Amendment) Act, 1976, was enacted during the Emergency by&nbsp; the&nbsp;\ngovernment headed by Indira Gandhi which kicked into effect on 3 January\n1977, <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">42nd amendment&nbsp; is regarded as the most controversial constitutional\namendment in Indian history. It attempted to reduce the power of the Supreme\nCourt and High Courts to pronounce upon the constitutional validity of laws.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\n42nd Amendment also amended the Preamble and changed the description of India\nfrom \"sovereign democratic&nbsp;\nrepublic\" to a \u201csovereign socialist&nbsp;\nsecular&nbsp; republic\u201d&nbsp; which was never the intention of the founding\nfathers when they drafted and passed the Constitution.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; AGNI at\ndawn, and Indra we invoke at dawn, and Varu\u1e47a and Mitra, and the A\u015bvins twain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bhaga at dawn, P\u016b\u1e63an,\nand Brahma\u1e47aspati, Soma at dawn, Rudra we will invoke at dawn.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">.</span></b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> --Dec 18, 2014,\n02.16 AM IST<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NEW DELHI: The Centre\non Wednesday told the Supreme Court that mere political dissent or criticism\nthrough social networking sites could not be a ground for arrest of the author\nbut maintained that Section 66A of Information and Technology Act was meant to\ndeal with those who threaten to harm others physically and culturally. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This stand would\nprovide much needed relief to the cyber citizens as many in the past had been\nhounded by law enforcing agencies for posting \"objectionable\" posts\nin the social networking sites. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sources in the\ngovernment said the government's stance was prompted by a direct intervention\nby Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Sources said during deliberations, Modi made a\nstrong pitch for complete freedom of expression on social media, saying that\nthe provisions of the IT Act should be read in conformity with the Article\n19(2) of the Constitution which guarantees free speech.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">READ ALSO: 2 girls arrested\nfor harmless online comment <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Internet service\nproviders, through senior advocate K K Venugopal, said that in a democracy the\ngovernment should not have power to order them to take down some material\nposted on their sites as such a provision was prone to be misused for political\npurposes. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Additional solicitor\ngeneral Tushar Mehta, citing the recent case of Twitter handle on which\noffensive messages on behalf of radically fundamental ISIS group were being\nposted, argued that such a provision was needed.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But he said: \"Mere\npolitical dissent or hot discussion cannot be a ground for taking action\nagainst the social networking sites and people who post such message.\"\n\"This is the only media which is censor free. Emergency would have been a\nbig fiasco had there been social media at that time,\" Mehta told a bench\nof Justices Chelameswar and S A Bobde. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ASG also stressed\nthat there were very few cases when the government has asked the service\nprovider to remove such contents, even as he made a case for \"reasonable\"\ncurbs. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"If through a\ntwitter post, people are asked to join terrorist organization, then there is a\nreasonable ground to ask the service provider to remove the material,\"\nMehta said. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He also said that if\nsomeone initiated action against service providers for posting\n\"obscene\" contents then there would be no protection under IT Act and\nthe case would be adjudicated by the court.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">READ ALSO: Online posts\nagainst Narendra Modi spell trouble <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Venugopal said his\nclients should also be given protection under freedom of speech and expression\nas they were also part of dissemination of knowledge and information. He\nquestioned how a government could direct them to remove the material within 36\nhours and said such directions were \"signs of dictatorship\"\nimpermissible in a democracy. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The arrest of two\nMumbai girls for their post in facebook criticizing the bandh call on Shiv Sena\nchief Bal Thackeray's funeral day had led to their arrest. This had spurred a\ncollege girl, Shreya Singhal, to move the apex court challenging the validity\nof Section 66A.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n####################################<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SUBJECT : Dissent on\ncyberspace no offence, Centre says in SC .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">###############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/Dissent-on-cyberspace-no-offence-Centre-says-in-SC/articleshow/45555326.cms\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\">http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/Dissent-on-cyberspace-no-offence-Centre-says-in-SC/articleshow/45555326.cms</span></a><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; I immediately got up and walked out with my shocked wife in tow.</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nWhen I went to the Muslim school, for admission in LKG, &nbsp;I passed a Class 2 &nbsp;class room on the way to the principal's room with Math problems on the black board. &nbsp;My wife told me that my son knows all that &nbsp;as she taught him on the ship &nbsp;. &nbsp;So I told the principal-- my son can do the math on the board of the Class 2 class room. which is three divisions higher &nbsp;.</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nHe immediately called the LKG class teacher and asked him, if she wants to ask my son any math questions based on the black board-- she placed my son on her lap , kissed him and said - NOPE !</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Below: Ever heard of bonny AMUL babies ?</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>We express our shock\nand anger at the stand taken by the Prime Minister Dr. Manmohan Singh in the\nRajya Sabha on the issue of refusal of visa to Mr. Narendra Modi by the\nUSA</b></span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He has said that it is not proper\nfor any agency to form its opinion on the role of Sh. Modi in the 2002 Gujarat\ngenocide based on mere allegations.&nbsp; Sh.\nSingh needs to be reminded that it was the NHRC which had castigated Mr. Modi\nand his state government for having aided and abetted the act of genocide of\nMuslims in Gujarat in 2002, and it was the Supreme Court of India that had\nopined that the Modi government cannot be relied upon to bring about justice to\nthe victims of the carnage. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>More than 50 national\nand international agencies of high credibility with their painstaking investigation\nhad held Mr. Modi directly responsible for the act of genocide.&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Prime\nMinister needs to come clean on this issue. Does he hold a considered opinion\nthat the observations made by the NHRC and the Supreme Court of India are to be\ntreated with contempt as shown by him in his Rajya Sabha speech?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mr. Modi's policies of\nhatred should not be legitimised even by association. Mr. Modi is no ordinary\nelected leader. He has become infamous for his active abetment in the most\nbrutal massacre since India became free, of a segment of the citizens of his\nstate.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: large;\">His notoriety has deepened in the past 3 years because he remains\ncompletely unrepentant for these crimes, including the mass slaughter and rape\nof hundreds of innocent women and children, and instead has openly fought\nelections from a platform of hate.&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He has deliberately subverted the process of\njustice, that have attracted unprecedented structure from the Supreme Court of\nIndia.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We continue - to\nharbour grave disquiet about the militaristic and chauvinistic policies of the\ncurrent US government itself, most notably in Afghanistan and Iraq. George Bush\nand his cohorts cannot be the arbiters of human rights.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We commend the untiring\nefforts of NRIs and human rights activists in the US and in India who mobilized\npublic opinion and pressurized the US administration which led to the denial of\nModi's visa. For those who claim that the international community has no role\nto play in the Gujarat carnage since it is a matter internal to the Indian\nnation, we would like to remind them that by the same logic, the entire world\nshould have remained a mute spectator as millions of Jews were imprisoned and\nexecuted in concentration camps by the Nazi government. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For those who claim\nthat any insult to any elected official is an insult to the entire nation, we\nwould like to remind them that Hitler, who is reviled even today, was also an\nelected official.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">There is nothing more insulting to the Indian nation than the\npogroms that took place in Gujarat, and the fact that their main architect, Sh\nNarendra Modi, still continues to enjoy the powers and privileges of the Chief\nMinister in that state, while the Prime Minister of the country rushes to his\ndefence. </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is a matter of great\nshame that even 10 months after having assumed power the UPA government has\ndone nothing to ensure justice to the victims of Gujarat genocide. It has taken\nno steps to instill a sense of security and confidence among the displaced,\nraped, and maimed minorities of Gujarat who have been left to fend for\nthemselves. No financial and legal aid has been arranged by the Central\ngovernment for them and it is treating the whole Gujarat genocide as a routine\nstate matter.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The statement by Dr.\nManmohan Singh adds insult to the injury suffered by the Genocide victims of\nGujarat, and is an affront to those NRIs and human rights activists in the US\nwhose unflagging pressure on the US administration resulted in the denial of\nMr. Modi's visa. That Dr. Singh should feel compelled to come out openly to\nspeak for an organizer of mass murder who feels no remorse for his role shows\nthat Dr. Singh has lost all sense of propriety. The statement also shows that\nthe government wants to remain neutral on the question of communalism.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We, as people who are\ncommitted to secularism and human rights in India, feel betrayed and would like\nto take this opportunity to express our sense of despair that the political\nformation which is in power at the centre lacks any sense of moral\nresponsibility and moral courage.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">On behalf of the dead\nand living victims of Gujarat genocide and on behalf of the sections of civil\nsociety which have worked for the defeat of the communal forces we demand an\napology from Dr. Manmohan Singh for having humiliated the wronged citizens of\nIndia by issuing a highly insensitive and irresponsible statement defending Mr.\nNarendra Modi.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">March 21, 2005<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Released by<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shabnam Hashmi - ANHAD,\nDelhi &gt;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; Jayarajan did NOT call the judge a fool.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">He used as very restrained word SHUMBHAN -&nbsp; -&nbsp; same\nmeaning in Sanskrit and Malayalam&nbsp; -\nDENSE INSIDE THE HEAD&nbsp;&nbsp; ( not too bright\n).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">QUOTE :&nbsp; if they have\nany self respect they should resign and step down from their office. \u2026\nUnfortunately, what some DENSE IN THE HEAD people occupying our seat of justice\nsay is nothing else. \u2026 :UNQUOTE <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">OUR CONSTITUTION ALLOWS EVERY CHILD OF BHARATMATA TO EXPRESS\nHIS POINT OF VIEW . . .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">IT IS DUE TO THIS FUNDAMENTAL RIGHT,&nbsp; THE PEOPLE OF INDIA WERE ABLE TO REJECT THE\nJUSTICE BANNERJEE RULING THAT A HINDU WOMAN SET THE RAILWAY COMPARTMENT S6 OF\nSABARMATI EXPRESS ON FIRE AT GODHRA&nbsp; --\n-with 4000 witnesses . . .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">THE LAWS PERTAINING TO CONTEMPT OF COURT MUST BE REPEALED .\n.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">THESE LAWS WERE INTRODUCED BY THE&nbsp; OPIUM DRUG RUNNING OWNER OF BRITISH EAST\nINDIA COMPANY GERMAN JEW ROTHSCHILD TO SUBVERT THE SYSTEM USING HIS PET JUDGES\n, WHOM HE KNIGHTED . .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"color: blue;\">are the judges god ? &nbsp;. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">do they not see how much PM narendra modi&nbsp; ( MAUTH KA SAUDAAGAR ) is taking daily ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">YET IF YOU DONT CALL A JUDGE MeLORD&nbsp; - HE WILL TRY TO PUT YOU IN JAIL FOR CONTEMPT\nOF COURT .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">TELLING THE TRUTH, TO SAVE BHARATMATA IS NOW DEFAMATION AND\nHATE SPEECH&nbsp; VIDE </span><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">66A OF THE IT ACT</b></span><span style=\"color: blue;\"> ( BUNTY\nSIBAL TO PROTECT MADAME ) -- MIND YOU WE HAVE JUST COME OUT OF 800 YEARS OF\nSLAVERY . . .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">FOREIGN FUNDED DESH DROHIS ARE RUNNING WILD IN INDIA . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">DESH BHAKTS CANNOT DARE TO EXPOSE DANGERS THE WATAN IS\nFACING . . .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">THE INDIAN JUDICIARY IS GUILT OF SEVERE OVER REACH IN RECENT\nTIMES . . .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">THEY ORDERED INTERLINKING OF RIVERS WITH A DEADLINE -- WHEN\nTHEY ARE JUST ONE PILLAR AMONG FOUR OF INDIAN DEMOCRACY . . .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">OUR CONSTITUTION AND OUR LAWS DO NOT ALLOW THIS . &nbsp;. .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">WE NEED TO PULL DOWN THE PILLAR OF JUDICIARY AND ERECT IT\nAGAIN, USING JURY SYSTEM . . .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">KARUNANIDHI EVEN HAD HIS PET DALIT JUDGE ASHOK KUMAR , WHO\nCRIED WHEN&nbsp; KARUNANIDHI WAS ARRESTED ,\nASKING,&nbsp; IS YOUR HEART MADE OF MUSCLE OR\nMUD !!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">In USA contempt of court , long ago fell foul of the 1st\nAmendment and is dismissed as&nbsp; English\nfoolishness&nbsp;&nbsp; - it was contempt against a\nJEW ROTHSCHILD APPOINTED JUDGE actually . . .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">In UK there is NO contempt of court since the 1930s--&nbsp; and was formally abolished a year ago . . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">Capt ajit vadakayil<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">..</span><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b>##################################</b></span>\n</div>\n<h3 class=\"post-title entry-title\" itemprop=\"name\" style=\"background-color: #fff9ee; color: #222222; font-family: Georgia, Utopia, 'Palatino Linotype', Palatino, serif; font-size: 24px; font-stretch: normal; font-weight: normal; line-height: normal; margin: 0.75em 0px 0px; position: relative;\">\nStudent arrested for Facebook Post</h3>\n<div class=\"post-header\" style=\"background-color: #fff9ee; color: #222222; font-family: Georgia, Utopia, 'Palatino Linotype', Palatino, serif; font-size: 12.6000003814697px; line-height: 1.6; margin: 0px 0px 1.5em;\">\n<div class=\"post-header-line-1\">\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"post-body entry-content\" id=\"post-body-1793193723607774100\" itemprop=\"description articleBody\" style=\"background-color: #fff9ee; color: #222222; font-family: Georgia, Utopia, 'Palatino Linotype', Palatino, serif; font-size: 15.3999996185303px; line-height: 1.4; position: relative; width: 570px;\">\n<div dir=\"ltr\" trbidi=\"on\">\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\nA class 11 student has been arrested for posting on facebook an alleged statement of Mr. Azam Khan, U.P. Minister.</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\nI have perused the post. It is certainly objectionable, and Mr. Azam Kan has denied making such a statement.</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\nThe statement says \" Secularism and love of nation is forbidden in Islam \". This is certainly objectionable, and is likely to incite communal feelings. Even if it has only been shared, that makes no difference. In a country with so much diversity as ours we must take care not to hurt the feelings of any community. To say that love of the &nbsp;nation is forbidden in Islam is bound to hurt the feelings of Muslims, the vast majority of whom are as patriotic as the vast majority ofHindus.</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n&nbsp;However, in my opinion, instead of arresting the boy the better course of action would have been for Mr. Azam Khan &nbsp;to have denied issuing such a statement, and asked for removal of that post from facebook.</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n&nbsp;It may be mentioned that arrest is not a must in every case where an F.I.R. of a cognizable offence is registered with the police. This is obvious from section 157 (1) Criminal Procedure Code. which reads :</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n\" &nbsp;157. Procedure for investigation</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n(1) If, from information received or otherwise, an officer in charge of a police station has reason to suspect the commission of an offence which he is empowered under section 156 to investigate, he shall forthwith send a report of the same to a Magistrate empowered to take cognizance of such offence upon a police report and shall proceed in person, or shall depute one of his subordinate officers not being below such rank as the State Government may, by general or special order, prescribe in this behalf, to proceed, to the spot, to investigate the facts and circumstances of the case, and, if necessary, to take measures for the discovery and arrest of the offender; \"</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\nThe use of the words &nbsp;\"and, if necessary \" &nbsp;in the above provision clearly indicates that it is not incumbent on the police to arrest in every case, rather it is discretionary.</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n&nbsp;In Joginder Kumar vs. State of U. P. A.I.R. 1994 S.C. 1349 ( see online ) the Supreme Court observed : \" No arrest can be made because it is lawful for the police officer to do so. The existence of the power to arrest is one thing. The justification for the exercise of it is quite another.The police officer must be able to justify the arrest apart from his power to do so. Arrest and detention in police lock-up of a person can cause incalculable harm to the reputation and self-esteem of a person. No arrest can be made in a routine manner on a mere allegation of commission of an offence made against a person. It would be prudent for a police officer in the interest of protection of the constitutional rights of a citizen and perhaps in his own interest that no arrest should be made without a reasonable satisfaction reached after some investigation as to the genuineness and &nbsp;bona fides of a complaint and a reasonable belief both as to &nbsp;the person's complicity and even so as to the need to effect arrest. &nbsp;Denying a person of his liberty is a serious matter. \"</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n&nbsp;Thus the Supreme Court has held that arrest is not a must in every case. In the same decision the Supreme Court has noted that the National Police Commission in its Third Report has observed that 60% arrests in India are unnecessary or unjustified, and that arrests are a major source of corruption in the police.</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n&nbsp;In my opinion arrest was unnecessary in this case, and the boy should have been let off with a warning and told to remove the objectionable post.</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/goog_1784971402\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\"><br /></a></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KlbSEwnzajY\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KlbSEwnzajY</a></div>\n</div>\n<div style=\"clear: both;\">\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"post-footer\" style=\"background-color: #eee9dd; border-bottom-color: rgb(238, 238, 238); border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-width: 1px; color: #666555; font-family: Georgia, Utopia, 'Palatino Linotype', Palatino, serif; font-size: 12.6000003814697px; line-height: 1.6; margin: 20px -2px 0px; padding: 5px 10px;\">\n<div class=\"post-footer-line post-footer-line-1\">\n<span class=\"post-author vcard\" style=\"margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 1em;\">Posted by&nbsp;<span class=\"fn\" itemprop=\"author\" itemscope=\"itemscope\" itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Person\"><a class=\"g-profile\" data-gapiattached=\"true\" data-gapiscan=\"true\" data-onload=\"true\" href=\"http://www.blogger.com/profile/00863856244827322851\" rel=\"author\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\" title=\"permanent link\"><abbr class=\"published\" itemprop=\"datePublished\" style=\"border: none;\" title=\"2015-03-18T22:52:00+05:30\">Wednesday, March 18, 2015</abbr></a>&nbsp;</span></div>\n</div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://justicekatju.blogspot.com/2015/03/facebook-post-class-11-student-has-been.html?showComment=1426723767527#c490821960698905516\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">19 March 2015 at 05:39</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_1MC\" style=\"background-color: #fff9ee; color: #222222; font-family: Georgia, Utopia, 'Palatino Linotype', Palatino, serif; font-size: 14px; line-height: 19.6000003814697px; margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nKATJU SAAB,<br />\n<br />\nCELEBRITIES RING UP THEIR FAVOURITE TOP POLICE OFFICERS , TO PUNISH PEOPLE WHO HAVE HURT THEIR EGO . .<br />\n<br />\nSEC 66A , IS ALL ABOUT EGO MASSAGE IN PUBLIC . .<br />\n<br />\nNONE OF THESE POLICE OFFICERS WHO CURRY FAVOUR WITH THESE CELEBRITIES KNOW THE \" MAGISTRATE \" RULE , NOR THE JUDGES OF THE LOWER COURTS WHO GIVE BAIL OR SEND THE ACCUSED TO UNDERTRIAL JAIL .<br />\n<br />\nJUST ONE FIR AND THE POLICE ARREST - WITHOUT THE NEED OF A MAGISTRATE RULING . .<br />\n<br />\nThis is obvious from section 157 (1) Criminal Procedure Code. which reads :<br />\n\" 157. Procedure for investigation<br />\n<br />\n(1) If, from information received or otherwise, an officer in charge of a police station has reason to suspect the commission of an offence which he is empowered under section 156 to investigate, he shall forthwith send a report of the same to a Magistrate empowered to take cognizance of such offence upon a police report and shall proceed in person, or shall depute one of his subordinate officers not being below such rank as the State Government may, by general or special order, prescribe in this behalf, to proceed, to the spot, to investigate the facts and circumstances of the case, and, if necessary, to take measures for the discovery and arrest of the offender; \"<br />\n<br />\nThe use of the words \"and, if necessary \" in the above provision clearly indicates that it is not incumbent on the police to arrest in every case, rather it is discretionary.<br />\n<br />\nIT IS GOOD THAT YOUR BROUGHT THIS GLARING LOOPHOLE, TO THE LIMELIGHT . .<br />\n<br />\nEGO MASSAGE OF CELEBRITIES BY POLICE AND JUDICIARY MUST BE INVESTIGATED . OUR NATION IS GOING TO THE DOGS .<br />\n<br />\nHERE IS A SAMPLE CASE-<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/12/dissent-on-cyber-space-not-offence-modi.html<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_1MN\" kind=\"m\" style=\"background-color: #fff9ee; DISSENT ON CYBER SPACE NOT AN OFFENCE , MODI GOVT VADAKAYIL . . . . .</span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br style=\"background-color: #fff9ee; color: #222222; font-family: Georgia, Utopia, 'Palatino Linotype', Palatino, serif; font-family: Georgia, Utopia, 'Palatino Linotype', Palatino, serif; font-size: 14px; line-height: 19.6000003814697px; text-align: justify;\">..</span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"color: #222222; font-family: Georgia, Utopia, Palatino Linotype, Palatino, serif; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; line-height: 19.6000003814697px;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>EPILOGUE- &nbsp; &nbsp; MARCH 24TH 2015<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>################################################<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>SC quashes Section 66A\nof IT Act: Key points of court verdict<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>The Supreme Court on\nTuesday quashed Section 66A of the Information Technology Act, which provides\nthe government power to arrest a person for posting allegedly\n\"offensive\" content on websites. Here are key points of the SC\njudgment.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>What is Section 66A<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Section 66A reads:\n\"Any person who sends by any means of a computer resource any information\nthat is grossly offensive or has a menacing character; or any information which\nhe knows to be false, but for the purpose of causing annoyance, inconvenience,\ndanger, obstruction, insult shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term\nwhich may extend to three years and with fine.\"<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>3.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Section 66A violates\nArticle 19(1)(a) of Constitution<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>The SC said Section 66A\nof the Information Technology Act was violative of Article 19(1)(a) of the\nConstitution guaranteeing freedom of speech and expression.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>4.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Terming liberty of\nthought and expression as \"cardinal\", a bench of justices J\nChelameswar and R F Nariman said, \"The public's right to know is directly\naffected by section 66A of the Information Technology Act.\"<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>5.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Govt can still block\nwebsites<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>The court, however,\nallowed the government to block websites if their contents had the potential to\ncreate communal disturbance, social disorder or affect India's relationship\nwith other countries.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>6.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>What may be offensive\nto a person may not be offensive to the other<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>\"How is it\npossible for law enforcement agency and others to decide as to what is\noffensive and what is grossly offensive? What may be offensive to a person may\nnot be offensive to the other,\" the SC bench said.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>7.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Terms used in 66A are\nquite vague<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>The court said terms\nlike \"annoying\", \"inconvenient\" and \"grossly\noffensive\", used in the provision are vague as it is difficult for the law\nenforcement agency and the offender to know the ingredients of the offence.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>8.</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>The bench also referred\nto two judgments of separate UK courts which reached different conclusions as\nto whether the material in question was offensive or grossly offensive.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>9.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Govt can't give an\nundertaking about its successor<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>The SC bench rejected\nthe assurance given by NDA government during the hearing that certain\nprocedures may be laid down to ensure that the law in question is not abused.\nThe government had also said that it will not misuse the provision.\n\"Governments come and go but section 66A will remain forever,\" the bench\nsaid, adding the present government cannot give an undertaking about its\nsuccessor that they will not abuse the same.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>10.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Shreya Singhal moved\ncourt for repeal of Section 66A<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>The court was moved by\none Shreya Singhal in 2012 following the arrest of two girls, Shaheen Dhada and\nRinu Shrinivasan, for posting comments critical of the Mumbai shutdown\nfollowing the death of Shiv Sena supremo Bal Thackeray.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"color: #222222; font-family: Georgia, Utopia, Palatino Linotype, Palatino, serif;\"><span style=\"font-size: large; line-height: 19.6000003814697px;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Supreme Court strikes\ndown Section 66A of IT Act which allowed arrests for objectionable content\nonline<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Amit Choudhary &amp;\nDhananjay Mahapatra,TNN | Mar 24, 2015, 10.50 AM IST<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>NEW DELHI: The Supreme\nCourt on Tuesday declared Section 66A of Information Technology Act as\nunconstitutional and struck it down.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>This section had been\nwidely misused by police in various states to arrest innocent persons for\nposting critical comments about social and political issues and political\nleaders on social networking sites.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>The court said such a\nlaw hit at the root of liberty and freedom of expression, two cardinal pillars\nof democracy.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>The court said such a\nlaw hit at the root of liberty and freedom of expression, the two cardinal\npillars of democracy. The court said the section has to be erased from the law\nbooks as it has gone much beyond the reasonable restrictions put by the\nConstitution on freedom of speech. The Supreme Court said section 66A was vaguely\nworded and allowed its misuse by police.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>The court, however,\nupheld the validity of section 69B and the 2011 guidelines for the\nimplementation of the I-T Act that allowed the government to block websites if\ntheir content had the potential to create communal disturbance, social disorder\nor affect India's relationship with other countries.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>However, the court\nwatered down section 79 of the I-T Act making it further difficult for the\npolice to harass innocent for their comments on social network sites.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>The SC delivered its\njudgment on a bunch of petitions filed in the light of misuse of the penal\nprovision by government authorities against persons who allegedly uploaded\noffensive posts on social networking sites.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>The petitioners,\nincluding NGOs, civil rights groups and a law student, had argued that Section\n66A violated citizens' fundamental right to freedom of speech and expression.\nThe first petition was however filed by a law student Shreya Singhal.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>The government had\nopposed the plea for quashing the provision saying it is meant to deter people\nfrom uploading grossly offensive material which can lead to lawlessness by\ninciting public anger and violence.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Justifying the\nretention of the provision, the Centre had told the apex court that the impact\nof the internet is much wider and restriction on this medium should be higher\nin comparison to print and TV.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>It had said, unlike\nprint and electronic media, the internet did not operate in an institutional\nform and there was need for some mechanism to put checks and balances.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>The government had said\nthe provision could not be quashed just because of its potential misuse.\nPosting pictures and comments on social networking sites which hurt religious\nsentiments could not be tolerated and people must be prosecuted, it said.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">Former attorney general\nSoli J Sorabjee, who appeared for one of the petitioners, termed the judgment a\n'glorious vindication' of right to free speech. He spoke to the TOI after SC\nbench of Justices J Chelameswar and R F Nariman struck down section 66A as unconstitutional.\nSorabjee said: \"The judgment is well researched, well reasoned and erudite\nin expression. It is a glorious vindication of freedom of expression.\"</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: #222222; font-family: Georgia, Utopia, Palatino Linotype, Palatino, serif;\"><span style=\"font-size: 14px; line-height: 19.6000003814697px;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b>SINCE THE NUMBER OF COMMENTS HAS EXCEED 200 CLICK ON \"<span style=\"color: blue;\">LOAD MORE</span> \"TO SEE THE BALANCE COMMENTS.</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b>Grace and peace !</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe width=\"320\" height=\"266\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/KO0EN_4ZiXI/0.jpg\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/KO0EN_4ZiXI?feature=player_embedded\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-dXvYjCUp4QE/VJI3EFeYlcI/AAAAAAAAz-w/vt4ao5ZpFZo/s1600/VADAKAYIL3.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"176\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-dXvYjCUp4QE/VJI3EFeYlcI/AAAAAAAAz-w/vt4ao5ZpFZo/s1600/VADAKAYIL3.jpg\" width=\"200\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif;\">CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif;\">..</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt. font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But she had more than\n2000 of those funny extravagant dresses with hilarious frilled collars.&nbsp; The whole idea was to distract attention from\nher repulsive ugliness--one way or the other-- including a jarring red coloured\nwig.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Below: I must ask Shaggy to sing for this woman -- kya style hai !</i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-IAg9lYsn9DE/VI-1i6fVxAI/AAAAAAAAz5g/wCMlKg4nC-s/s1600/imagb8es%2B(7).jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">She filled up the\nhideous deep pox pits on her face, using a compound including white lead, which\nate away her skin.&nbsp; She died a virgin\n,and hence is called the \"Virgin Queen\". &nbsp;She could NOT fool her subjects that her young male lovers used her bottom vaginal orifice . &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">She left a will that\nnobody can see her body even after her death \u2013with a tiny dong and a gaping\nas$hole.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Below: The throne was\nabdicated for King George VI ( his brother ) who was a R stooge- a man who\ncould not utter more than 4 words without stammering -- who would cry loudly often\nin melancholy --&nbsp; yes this was the ruler\nof India . . &nbsp;But his wife in the picture Elizabeth ( present queen\u2019s Elizabeth\nII\u2019s mother ) was very shrewd and managed all affairs with an iron will.&nbsp; &nbsp;She got the great Kohinoor diamond stolen\nfrom India for her own crown , and was most of the time sozzled on leg bucklin'\nZAZA ( this is 30% gin and 70% dubonnet --neat-- with a slice of lime ). &nbsp;Churchill's mother Jennie Jerome a Jewess , was from Jew R family . &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></i></span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Jennie\u2019s father\nfinancier Leonard Jerome ( Jacobsen ) was a race horse owner and the\nRothschilds representative in USA. &nbsp;</span></i></span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Churchill\u2019s father\nRandolph Churchill died of Syphillis, and Winston was born in a toilet on Nov\n30th 1874,</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">prematurely at 7 months, when\nhis pregnant mother got labour pains, in the middle of a dance.
