</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">and obnoxious\nmanic depressive hooked on to intoxicants. &nbsp;For marrying Rothschild girl Jennie,\nRandolph was given a wedding present -- of being a member of the House of\nCommons. &nbsp;R made Winston Churchill a great hero , like how Elizabeth 1 made Sir Francis Drake a hero .</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; line-height: 24px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/07/winston-churchill-henchman-or-hero-capt.html</span></span>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-P7viGsEVgNE/VI-7c403hlI/AAAAAAAAz6I/tyzLDnLA3zc/s1600/article-1dd351257-00BAE4FF00000190-725_468x353.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-P7viGsEVgNE/VI-7c403hlI/AAAAAAAAz6I/tyzLDnLA3zc/s1600/article-1dd351257-00BAE4FF00000190-725_468x353.jpg\" height=\"482\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Above : If some one said </span><b><span style=\"color: red;\">BOOOO</span></b><span style=\"color: blue;\"> to the king ( George VI in the middle ) he would either faint or cry! &nbsp;Obviously he cant do both, right ?</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">She had\na playpen between her legs and NOT a nursery&nbsp;\n.There was no way even a ugly common man would have been sexually\naroused by her. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Her father King Henry\nVIII suffered from congenital syphilis due to rampant sex. Her half sister Queen\nof England Mary Tudor, the Catholic wife of King Phillip of Spain ( Bloody Mary-\nwho also faked her pregnancies &nbsp;) and her\nhalf brother King of England Edward VI ( both children of Henry VIII ) suffered\nfrom congenital syphilis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Elizabeth 1 had Mary\nStuart, the Queen of Scots executed. Though she signed her death warrant,\nElizabeth 1 ,did NOT want it to be known to the public. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Queen of Scots Mary\nStuart , was a very pretty, sensuous, and tall woman, and it is speculated,\nthat it was sheer female jealously , which made Elizabeth imprison her for 19\nyears, and then execute her ( not fear of losing her throne to her, as many\nconsidered that she was the true heir ) .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">She was publicly disrobed in\ndisgrace, by several men, the executioner took three strokes with his axe to\nbehead her, with lot of time in between the strokes. Then her decapitated head\nwas held&nbsp; high by the auburn hair, to\nshow the public, with the executioner shouting , as he was told to \" God,\nsave the Queen\". . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The head fell down ,\nand it turned out to be a wig, with very short grey hair underneath, -- the\nfinal cruel blow, even after death..- All engineered by bald and pox scarred\nfaced Elizabeth 1. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And then the most bizarre thing was her tiny dog, kept\nhidden under her petty coat ( insinuating that this poor dog was always at her\ncrotch )&nbsp; , was let loose, totally\ncovered in blood- with the desperate creature yelping most pitiably, running\nhelter skelter.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WANNA READ HAJAAR ENGLISH\nBULL ? <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE :&nbsp; An English squadron of eight sail manoeuvred\ncoast-wise on the Armada's inner flank, while, unperceived by the Spanish lookout,\nDrake stole away to sea, beat round its outer flank, and then, making the most\nof a westerly slant in the shifting breeze, edged in to starboard. The\nSpaniards saw nothing till it was too late, Drake having given them a berth\njust wide enough to keep them quiet. But when the sun rose, there, only a few\nmiles off to windward, was the whole main body of the English fleet, coming on\nin faultless line-ahead, heeling nicely over on the port tack before the\nfreshening breeze, and, far from waiting for the Great Armada, boldly bearing\ndown to the attack. With this consummate move the victory was won.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The rest was slaughter,\nborne by the Spaniards with a resolution that nothing could surpass. With\ndauntless tenacity they kept their 'eagle formation,' so useful at Lepanto,\nthrough seven dire days of most one-sided fighting. Whenever occasion seemed to\noffer, the Spaniards did their best to close, to grapple, and to board, as had\ntheir heroes at Lepanto. But the English merely laughed, ran in, just out of\nreach, poured in a shattering broadside between wind and water, stood off to\nreload, fired again, with equal advantage, at longer range, caught the slow\ngalleons end-on, raked them from stem to stern, passed to and fro in one, long,\ndeadly line-ahead, concentrating at will on any given target; and did all this\nwith well-nigh perfect safety to themselves.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In quite a different way close-to,\nbut to the same effect at either distance, long or short, the English 'had the\nrange of them,' as sailors say today. Close-to, the little Spanish guns fired\nmuch too high to hull the English vessels, lying low and trim upon the water,\nwith whose changing humors their lines fell in so much more happily than those\nof any lumbering Spaniards could. Far-off, the little Spanish guns did\ncorrespondingly small damage, even when they managed to hit; while the heavy\nmetal of the English, handled by real seamen-gunners, inflicted crushing damage\nin return.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But even more important\nthan the Englishmen's superiority in rig, hull, armament, and expert seamanship\nwas their tactical use of the thoroughly modern line-ahead. Any one who will\ntake the letter T as an illustration can easily understand the advantage of\n'crossing his T.' The upright represents an enemy caught when in column-ahead,\nas he would be, for instance, when issuing from a narrow-necked port. In this\nformation he can only use bow fire, and that only in succession, on a very\nnarrow front. But the fleet represented by the crosspiece, moving across the\npoint of the upright, is in the deadly line-ahead, with all its near broadsides\nturned in one long converging line of fire against the helplessly\nnarrow-fronted enemy. If the enemy, sticking to medieval tactics, had room to\nbroaden his front by forming column-abreast, as galleys always did, that is,\nwith several uprights side by side, he would still be at the same sort of\ndisadvantage; for this would only mean a series of T's with each nearest\nbroadside crossing each opposing upright as before.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The herded soldiers and\nnon-combatants aboard the Great Armada stood by their useless duties to the\nlast. Thousands fell killed or wounded. Several times the Spanish scuppers\nactually ran a horrid red, as if the very ships were bleeding. The priests\nbehaved as bravely as the Jesuits of New France--and who could be braver than\nthose undaunted missionaries were? Soldiers and sailors were alike. 'What shall\nwe do now?' asked Sidonia after the slaughter had gone on for a week. 'Order up\nmore powder,' said Oquendo, as dauntless as before. Even then the eagle\nformation was still kept up. The van ships were the head. The biggest galleons\nformed the body. Lighter vessels formed the wings. A reserve formed the tail.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As the unflinching\nArmada stood slowly up the Channel a sail or two would drop out by the way,\ndead-beat. One night several strange sail passed suddenly by Drake. What should\nhe do? To go about and follow them with all astern of him doing the same in\nsuccession was not to be thought of, as his aftermost vessels were merchantmen,\nwholly untrained to the exact combined maneuvers required in a fighting fleet,\nthough first-rate individually. There was then no night signal equivalent to\nthe modern 'Disregard the flagship's movements.' So Drake dowsed his stern\nlight, went about, overhauled the strangers, and found they were bewildered\nGerman merchantmen. He had just gone about once more to resume his own station\nwhen suddenly a Spanish flagship loomed up beside his own flagship the\n\"Revenge\". Drake immediately had his pinnace lowered away to demand\ninstant surrender.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But the Spanish admiral was Don Pedro de Valdes, a very\ngallant commander and a very proud grandee, who demanded terms; and, though his\nflagship (which had been in collision with a run-amuck) seemed likely to sink,\nhe was quite ready to go down fighting. Yet the moment he heard that his\nsummoner was Drake he surrendered at discretion, feeling it a personal honor,\naccording to the ideas of the age, to yield his sword to the greatest seaman in\nthe world. With forty officers he saluted Drake, complimenting him on 'valour\nand felicity so great that Mars and Neptune seemed to attend him, as also on\nhis generosity towards the fallen foe, a quality often experienced by the\nSpaniards; whereupon,' adds this eyewitness, 'Sir Francis Drake, requiting his\nSpanish compliments with honest English courtesies, placed him at his own table\nand lodged him in his own cabin. UNQUOTE <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>BAAAP RE !</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>I HAVE JUST SPROUTED\nLONG EARS !</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The defeat of the\nSpanish Armada (sic )is one of the most famous events in English history. It\nwas arguably Queen Elizabeth's finest hour. She was first called the English\nDeborah, the saviour of the English people, and then later hailed as Bellona,\nthe goddess of war, for she had led her people to glory, defeating the greatest\npower in the 16th century world \u2013 &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BULLSH#T !&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sir Francis Walsingham,\nElizabeth's spymaster, uncovered the FAKE&nbsp;\nBabington Plot to overthrow Elizabeth in 1586. &nbsp; Mary , queen of Scots , was\nimplicated in the plot, with reams of evidence against her, and was eventually\nexecuted on 8 February 1587--</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">leaving her claim to the English throne, not to her son\nJames VI of Scotland but to King Philip II.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ridiculous part was\nboth Spanish and English ships flew the red cross on a white background; the\nSpanish because Philip II considered the Armada to be a crusade to remove a\nheretic queen and the cross was the crusader emblem; the English because the\ncross of St George was the national emblem.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-q0Cqp4qXlyI/VJFDPjO990I/AAAAAAAAz9Y/FXRq5ZKaiRI/s1600/Armada1dw4_Title.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-q0Cqp4qXlyI/VJFDPjO990I/AAAAAAAAz9Y/FXRq5ZKaiRI/s1600/Armada1dw4_Title.png\" height=\"386\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">William Shakespeare\u2019s &nbsp;Shylock was inspired by a wicked Marrano Jew (\ndaytime Lutheran church Protestant/ Night time jew ) named Rodrigo L\u00f3pez- Queen\nElizabeth 1\u2019s Chief doctor.&nbsp; &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Henry VIII and\nElizabeth 1 knew who the wealthy Jews were - &nbsp;a blind eye was turned to their private\nreligious activities, in return for Hafta .&nbsp;\nThere was no Inquisition in England. Jews became a useful political tool\nfor an English court at odds with Spain and Portugal. The throne found it was\nable to make good use of these exotic merchants with their overseas contacts.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">She had given her doctor\nLopez in 1589 &nbsp;a monopoly on the\nimportation of spices from Kerala .&nbsp; He\ntried his Jewish hand too much and got punished. &nbsp;Lopez was arrested on 1 January 1594, and hanged,\ndrawn and quartered on 7 June 1594. &nbsp;Just\nfew minutes before Lopez was hanged, &nbsp;he\nshouted to the crowd that he loved Jesus as much as he loved Elizabeth. For that\ninsult he was drawn and quartered. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1656, Rabbi Menasseh\nben Israel of Amsterdam, born Manuel Dias Soeiro in Lisbon, the son of a New\nChristian nail vendor, convinced Oliver Cromwell it would be just and\nprofitable to allow Jews to return to England.&nbsp;\n&nbsp;All this was hog wash as Crypto\nJews masquerading as Protestants settled in England during the reigns of King\nHenry VIII and Elizabeth I.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In December 1656 Antonio Fernandes Carvajal,\nthe leader of a small group of settlers, acquired land for a Jewish cemetery, a\npublic statement of existence . In 1657 the private synagogue in Creechurch\nLane had hundreds of Jewish worshippers. &nbsp;Ashkenazi Jews from Germany and Poland founded\ntheir first synagogue in1692 in Broad Street, Mitre Square.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Armada's appointed\ncommander was the highly experienced Admiral \u00c1lvaro de Baz\u00e1n, Marquis of Santa\nCruz, but he died in February 1588, <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Duke of Medina\nSidonia, a high-born courtier, took his place. &nbsp;He did NOT have good relations\nwith General Alexander Farnese , Duke of Parma of Netherlands. who was related\nby blood to King Philip ( nephew ) . &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Duke of Medina Sidonia General Alonzo\nPerez de Guzman was an excellent politician ,soldier and leader , but he was NOT a sailor. &nbsp;But\nSpain had never relied on Admirals in land battles.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The whole idea of taking\nthe Spanish Armada was NOT to have sea battles . Even if the British had more\nship ( faster and smaller ones ) their chutku guns could NOT match the long range Spanish\nguns.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The British historians LIED that Alonzo fell sea sick in rough weather. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nSpanish Armada always maintained a CRESCENT MOON shape to protect the food ,\nwater and ammunition ( in the middle ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While waiting for the\nbarges of the Alexander Farnese , the Duke of Parma to arrive with 30000 men,\nthe weather started getting bad on 27<sup>th</sup> July 1588 and all the buoys\nwere missing ( Gravelines ) as they had been removes a couple of days before.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Two ships ran aground at night . One had the mast broken due to impact. The other carrying\ngunpowder was blown up deliberately as the ship could NOT be refloated and they\ndid NOT want the English to lay their hands on Spanish long range guns , ammunition\nand fast horses ..&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">General Alonzo Perez de Guzman,the Duke of\nMedia Sidonia felt that things are NOT conducive to hang around forever with roaring\ngales blowing the ships north and currents also drifting ships northwards.. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It would NOT be possible to anchor as anchors\nwould drag and cables would snap .&nbsp; A\nmessage was delivered that the Duke of Parma was NOT ready as there was a Dutch\nblockade which had to be dealt with first.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">General Alexander\nFarnese , the Duke of Parma was the Governor of Spanish Netherlands, dealing\nwith the rebels. He was a powerful man .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">General Alexander Farese was the son\nof Duke Ottavio Farnese of Parma, a grandchild of Pope Paul III and Margaret,\nthe illegitimate daughter of the King of Spain and Habsburg Emperor Charles V.&nbsp; &nbsp;His\nmother was the half-sister of Philip II of Spain and John of Austria.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1586,\nAlexander Farnese became Duke of Parma through the death of his father. &nbsp;Alexander wanted to raid London on his own\nusing 30,000 battle hardened soldiers , but his uncle King Philip II over ruled\nhim and asked him to wait for the Armada with additional soldiers. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">King Philip II was right as it was foolhardy\nto rely merely on the hope of a native Catholic insurrection . A huge naval\npresence with long range guns would have ensured easy victory in capturing\nLondon. &nbsp;Alexander continued as Spanish Netherlands Governor &nbsp;from 1578 to 1592.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Duke of Medina\nSidonia General Alonzo Perez de Guzman, despite his lack of sea experience did\nan excellent job . Alonzo performed this overwhelming obligation so well in\nspite of his lack of experience; no doubt due in part to his own character and\nleadership spirit , but also to the dedication and expertise of his senior\ndeputies whom he consulted at every step . &nbsp;King Philip II had chosen his men well. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Contrary to what\nEnglish and Jew historians write , the English ships inflicted NIL damage on\nthe mighty Spanish Armada,despite exhausting all their ammunition-as they dared\nNOT come come close.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In desperation they were reduced to setting their won ships on fire and\nhope that they will set some of the Spanish ships on fire. With string winds\nand currents, these burning ships on a straight line drifting course could be\nplotted and tracked and it was easy to avoid them.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The British historians admit\nthat they burnt 8 of their own ships . The actual number is much more. Reduced to burning own ships and drifting them on the enemy ! -- what a\ndisgrace !!. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-VVJaWEuoP3s/VJK74TpqpCI/AAAAAAAA0Ak/-pll_cGzT8g/s1600/fireshinryps-x.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-VVJaWEuoP3s/VJK74TpqpCI/AAAAAAAA0Ak/-pll_cGzT8g/s1600/fireshinryps-x.jpg\" height=\"236\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unable to retrace his steps\nDUE TO ADVERSE STRONG GALES The Duke of Medina Sidonia General Alonzo Perez de\nGuzman after a conference , was forced to order his fleet to sail for home by\nthe \u201cNorth About\u201d route round the tip of Scotland and down the west coast of\nIreland; a daunting prospect, as the rowing galleys and merchant store ship\nbarges has NO charts for the treacherous Pentland Firth / North of Scotland .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MIND YOU , I AM NOT A\nMERE LAND LUBBING HISTORIAN WHO SPECULATES . &nbsp;I KNOW HOW THINGS TRANSPIRE IN THESE SEA AREAS\nWHERE I HAVE COMMANDED HUGE SHIPS MORE THAN A 100 TIMES OVER 3 DECADES OF SHIP\nCOMMAND.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Alonzo gave his\ncaptains sailing instructions running to just a few lines with the most cursory\nof directions. &nbsp;He gave orders to put the\nhorses over the sides when in sight of close land to conserve water . These\ngood swimming horses mostly swam ashore. The quality of a leader shows up in\ntimes of adversity.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-hTZjEsJo2J8/VJbEMZdWQWI/AAAAAAAA0G0/Hc3kuW7Lp0g/s1600/1715wreck99painting.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-hTZjEsJo2J8/VJbEMZdWQWI/AAAAAAAA0G0/Hc3kuW7Lp0g/s1600/1715wreck99painting.jpg\" height=\"640\" width=\"578\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Today a lot of English,\nScottish horses have Spanish blood. &nbsp;Several\nArmada gallleons and store ships sank around the Orkney Islands, off the north east coast of Scotland.&nbsp; Hundreds of&nbsp;\nSpanish seamen survived the wrecks to settle on the Catholic Islands\nwhere their descendants are to this day known as the 'Dons'. &nbsp; &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Spanish galleons\nwere ocean-going vessels designed with large cargo holds to carry supplies for\na long voyage, plus equipment and horses for land wars once they arrived -\nwhich made them slow and cumbersome. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The English navy, on\nthe other hand, had fast manoeuvrable ships designed to defend their coastal\nwaters. They could go ashore anytime and take food ,water , ammunition and men.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-suMNOBi6jOc/VJK5wWQY9OI/AAAAAAAA0AQ/Uy2emzDuSKk/s1600/shef_msh_vis_1622_large.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-suMNOBi6jOc/VJK5wWQY9OI/AAAAAAAA0AQ/Uy2emzDuSKk/s1600/shef_msh_vis_1622_large.jpg\" height=\"440\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Also\nsurviving the wrecks were a number of chickens, the forbears of an island breed\nstill known as 'Armada chickens'.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">When the armada decided\nto abort the London siege and take off back to Spain via the North sea and\nNorth coast of Scotland , 117 of the original 119 ships remained under Alonzo\u2019s\n&nbsp;command.&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-PgeDWWpMyqI/VJK5_5SR6fI/AAAAAAAA0AY/i-Aucl6KHiQ/s1600/imag09es.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-PgeDWWpMyqI/VJK5_5SR6fI/AAAAAAAA0AY/i-Aucl6KHiQ/s1600/imag09es.jpg\" height=\"237\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These two missing ships has run\naground&nbsp; on the treacherous sand bars\nwhose buoys were removed . Not a single ship was sunk by the English .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After Gravelines the\ncommanders Juan de Martinez Recalde, of Biscay, and Miguel Oquendo, of\nGuipuzcoa.and many others of the Spainsh Armada held a conference on Alonzo\u2019s &nbsp;flagship. Some foolhardy ones proposed a\ncourse for Norway to wait out and return ( when the Duke of Parma was ready ),\nothers for going back to Spain via North of Scotland . &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-XOXCa8roTjE/VJbEaiS5_PI/AAAAAAAA0G8/dy0eXKoCTH8/s1600/San-Felipe-1576_thhhumb%5B3%5D.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-XOXCa8roTjE/VJbEaiS5_PI/AAAAAAAA0G8/dy0eXKoCTH8/s1600/San-Felipe-1576_thhhumb%5B3%5D.jpg\" height=\"263\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Alonzo made his level headed decision \u2013it would\nbe back to Spain and orders were issued to the fleet.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE : The course that\nis first to be held is to the north/north-east until you be found under 61\ndegrees and a half; and then to take great heed lest you fall upon the Island\nof Ireland for fear of the harm that may happen unto you upon that coast. Then,\nparting from those islands and doubling the Cape in 61 degrees and a half, you\nshall run west/south-west until you be found under 58 degrees; and from thence\nto the south-west to the height of 53 degrees; and then to the\nsouth/south-west, making to the Cape Finisterre, and so to procure your\nentrance into The Groyne A Coru\u00f1a or to Ferrol, or to any other port of coast\nof Galicia.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The fleet was to\napproach the coast of Norway, before steering to the meridian of the Shetland\nIslands and on to Rockall. This allowed passage outside the northern tip of\nShetland, clearing the coast of Scotland at a distance of 160 km. Once out in\nthe broad Atlantic, the ships were to steer to a point 645 km beyond the\nShannon estuary on the west coast of Ireland, giving themselves a clear run to\nnorthern Spain. : UNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This plan would have\nworked but for a unseasonal hurricane when the Armada were off the coasts of\nIreland .&nbsp; &nbsp;LEE SHORE happened and there was no way the\nrowing galleys and low sail powered and flat bottomed merchant store ships could\ndeal with this .</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One report reflects the frustration of the navigators:\n\"We sailed without knowing whither through constant fogs, storms and\nsqualls\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-zKSCI8Mah8M/VJK5hUYw1oI/AAAAAAAA0AI/Z5KaAuEItRQ/s1600/imasdge122.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-zKSCI8Mah8M/VJK5hUYw1oI/AAAAAAAA0AI/Z5KaAuEItRQ/s1600/imasdge122.jpg\" height=\"277\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Out of the 117 ships , 73\nstrong naval ships with 12000 men &nbsp;sailed\nback to Spain via North of Scotland .&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>The rest sank off the Scottish , Irish\ncoasts . &nbsp;</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-jXY19Bac9Qo/VJK4hlFOvQI/AAAAAAAAz_4/nFvenlG8Cpg/s1600/Routes_of_the_Spanidsh_Armada.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-jXY19Bac9Qo/VJK4hlFOvQI/AAAAAAAAz_4/nFvenlG8Cpg/s1600/Routes_of_the_Spanidsh_Armada.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The terms \"lee\nshore\" is a&nbsp; nautical term. I was\nasked this question in my Chief Mate\u2019s orals exam.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">A <b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">LEE SHORE </b>&nbsp;is one that is to the lee side of a vessel\n,&nbsp; meaning the wind is blowing towards\nit.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; A weather shore has the wind\nblowing from inland over it out to sea.. &nbsp;If the wind is blowing into shore from the\nsea, the person is on a lee shore.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">A weather shore is potentially\ntreacherous for kitesurfers and windsurfers, who can be blown out to sea if the\nwind is blowing from the land.&nbsp; For them,\na lee shore is safer. For ocean-going vessels during a storm, a lee shore is\ntreacherous because the wind slowly forces the vessel toward the shore, where\nit will beach or break up. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Lee shores are\ndangerous to watercraft because, if left to drift, they will be pushed into\nshore by the wind,&nbsp; possibly running\naground. Sailboats are particularly susceptible to this, as even under sail\nthey are limited to the angle they can travel into the wind. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">It is possible for a\nsailing vessel to become trapped along a lee shore, with the only recourse\nbeing to use an engine ( if they have one ) , or use anchors to kedge out (\nwhich is NOT possible if sea is rough too ). <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The degree of danger\nthat is posed to your vessel by a lee shore is directly proportional to the\nforce of the wind and current that is pushing you toward it. If you misjudge\nthis force and then lose power, you can be on the lee shore faster than you can\nanchor your boat.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As a ship captain I can tell\nyou that it was inevitable and has nothing to do with careless planning by King\nPhilip II or the men he chose to lead .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The naval battle in the\nEnglish Channel had been won by the Spanish Armada and the English ships had\nexhausted their ammunition.&nbsp; But for the\ninability of General Alexander Farese the Duke of Parma to connect his 30000\nsoldiers history would have taken a different turn.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The British never expected\nthat the rowing galleys and merchant store ships of the Spanish Armada would flounder in a hurricane and\nthey expected a battle from the Western side . &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Below: Rowing galleys use oar power , with limited sail power . When the ship rolls in a hurricane rowing is impossible.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-OSwSfExSYg0/VJK5IZjgqYI/AAAAAAAA0AA/ppzk8CNP5tI/s1600/imtrhages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-OSwSfExSYg0/VJK5IZjgqYI/AAAAAAAA0AA/ppzk8CNP5tI/s1600/imtrhages.jpg\" height=\"341\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rumours spread that the Spanish Armada had\nreplenished water and food from Catholic Ireland and the the entire fleet with\nenough ammunition would soon attack again .</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The degree of alarm among the\nEnglish at Dublin was extreme, and Fitzwilliam put out false reports that\nreinforcements from England were due to arrive with 10,000 troops. &nbsp;&nbsp;Rumors were rife that the Spanish landed in\ndisciplined formations, with the Catholic Irish rising out to join them from\nterritories that were almost beyond the control of the government.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The English\nwere very happy when thousands of dead bodies of Spanish sailors started washing\non to the beaches of Ireland </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fitzwilliam\nordered that all Spaniards be captured and hanged summarily; and that anyone\naiding them be tortured and charged as a traitor to the Crown. But a lot of Spanish\nmen swam ashore and just merged into the public .</span></div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was on a Saturday,\nthe 20th of July, that Lord Effingham came in sight of the mighty Spanish\nArmada. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Armada was drawn up in form\nof a moon crescent, which from horn to horn measured 13 kilometers&nbsp; .The formation at a slow speed of 3 knots\njust sailed on confident on taking on whoever came close. &nbsp;The speed of the slowest rowing galleys\ndetermined the speed of the fleet. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-A0hYuGZFtfs/VJLDC0u78FI/AAAAAAAA0A0/aEjLaCBdGHE/s1600/imag6es.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-A0hYuGZFtfs/VJLDC0u78FI/AAAAAAAA0A0/aEjLaCBdGHE/s1600/imag6es.jpg\" height=\"211\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nEnglish ships did NOT dare to come in front of this deadly formation . &nbsp;After they passed by they followed behind without daring to overtake &nbsp;.\nThe English ships were smaller and faster and could have attacked them anytime.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Spanish Armada did NOT bother to turn back and attack the English ships and\norders from King Philip was very clear. Do NOT engage the enemy ( unless to\ndefend ) till you pick up the 30000 soldiers from Holland. &nbsp;They had orders to be closer to the French\ncoast than the English coast at all times.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">King Philip had ordered\nhis Armada to attack the English fleet only after making it possible for the\nhuge army of the Duke of Parma to cross in safety from France to England\n.Horses had to be landed on firm ground. Only then would the Spanish Armada pulverize\nthe English fleet.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-CPwRUYEFx3s/VJbDqSwctSI/AAAAAAAA0Gs/o4s-Pm6K92U/s1600/im52g8.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-CPwRUYEFx3s/VJbDqSwctSI/AAAAAAAA0Gs/o4s-Pm6K92U/s1600/im52g8.jpg\" height=\"400\" width=\"285\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wanna swallow some\nEnglish bull ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE : Just after\nmidnight on July 29 1588, the English sent eight burning ships into the crowded\nharbor at Calais. The panicked Spanish ships were forced to cut their anchors\nand sail out to sea to avoid catching fire. The disorganized fleet, completely\nout of formation, was attacked by the English off Gravelines at dawn. In a\ndecisive battle, the superior English guns won the day, and the devastated\nArmada was forced to retreat north to Scotland. The English navy pursued the\nSpanish as far as Scotland and then turned back for want of supplies \u201cUNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHERE IS MY BANANA ?<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Below: Sorry Shaggy, I cant allow you to sing twice !</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-cosAnqXrdPg/VJMEEGKumTI/AAAAAAAA0BQ/xoCLlPCa-fc/s1600/Portrait-of-Elizabet4h-I-s-011.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-cosAnqXrdPg/VJMEEGKumTI/AAAAAAAA0BQ/xoCLlPCa-fc/s1600/Portrait-of-Elizabet4h-I-s-011.jpg\" height=\"384\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ten days after the\nSpanish Armada has sailed north from Holland and the coast was clear Queen\nElizabeth I suddenly became very brave.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In true Hollywood style she wore her best\nclothes , put a fresh coat of white lead on manful face \u2013and on 8 August she\nwent to Tilbury to \u201cencourage\u201d her\nforces, and gave to them a pathetic pep speech -</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Below: &nbsp;Oh yeah\u2014a valiant image,\nshe arrived on a white steed, wearing a silver cuirass and hajaar jewels &nbsp;. Hey what about her ugly face sans eyebrows\nand eyelashes ,&nbsp; her Manchester with fried\neggs for tits , and her bald head with a ridiculous orange wig ? Only John Bulls can get\nimpressed by this sight !</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-j1ovKfGBY7g/VJMN3lxkxII/AAAAAAAA0Bo/bHHBgEYWWq8/s1600/Elizabeth-I-addressieng-the-Troops-at-Tilbury-before-trrhe-arrival-of-the-Spanish-Armada-1588..jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-j1ovKfGBY7g/VJMN3lxkxII/AAAAAAAA0Bo/bHHBgEYWWq8/s1600/Elizabeth-I-addressieng-the-Troops-at-Tilbury-before-trrhe-arrival-of-the-Spanish-Armada-1588..jpg\" height=\"328\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE : &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">My loving people, we\nhave been persuaded by some that are careful of our safety, to take heed how we\ncommit ourselves to armed multitudes for fear of treachery; but, I do assure\nyou, I do not desire to live to distrust my faithful and loving people. Let\ntyrants fear, I have always so behaved myself, that under God I have placed my\nchiefest strength and safeguard in the loyal hearts and goodwill of my\nsubjects; and, therefore, I am come amongst you as you see at this time, not\nfor my recreation and disport, but being resolved, in the midst and heat of\nbattle, to live or die amongst you all \u2013 to lay down for my God, and for my\nkingdoms, and for my people, my honour and my blood even in the dust. I know I\nhave the body of a weak and feeble woman; but I have the heart and stomach of a\nking \u2013 and of a King of England too, and think foul scorn that Parma or Spain,\nor any prince of Europe, should dare to invade the borders of my realm; to\nwhich, rather than any dishonour should grow by me, I myself will take up arms\n\u2013 I myself will be your general, judge, and rewarder of every one of your\nvirtues in the field. I know already, for your forwardness, you have deserved\nrewards and crowns, and, we do assure you, on the word of a prince, they shall\nbe duly paid you. In the mean time, my lieutenant general shall be in my stead,\nthan whom never prince commanded a more noble or worthy subject; not doubting\nbut by your obedience to my general, by your concord in the camp, and your\nvalour in the field, we shall shortly have a famous victory over those enemies\nof my God, of my kingdom, and of my people UNQUOTE .</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; It is\nrecorded that Cornish fishermen fishing off the Lizard watched the Armada pass!</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Lord High Admiral\nof England, Howard of Effingham, though he had NIL experience in battle, took\nthe command of a squadron with pirate Francis Drake used to sneaking up from\nbehind , as his immediate subordinate- what do you expect ..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-auOkDsKodh4/VJP-qldZYoI/AAAAAAAA0CQ/6LvFhvRC6f4/s1600/ima9lges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-auOkDsKodh4/VJP-qldZYoI/AAAAAAAA0CQ/6LvFhvRC6f4/s1600/ima9lges.jpg\" height=\"268\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">To celebrate the defeat\nof the Armada, a number of medals were issued. The most famous of these is the\none with the legend: \"1588. Flavit Jehovah et Dissipati Sunt\" (with\nthe word \"Jehovah\" in Hebrew letters \u2013 marking Jewish covert\nsupport ) = \"God blew, and they were scattered\".&nbsp;&nbsp; The obverse displays a church building,\nsymbolizing the Protestant Church, remaining unmoved in a storm (symbolizing\nthe Armada invasion).</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The persecution of\nEnglish Jews dated back to the era of King Edward I. &nbsp;&nbsp;In 1255 a number of Jews were imprisoned in\nthe Tower of London awaiting execution for the alleged murder of Hugh of\nLincoln. &nbsp;Eighteen Jews were hanged.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In\n1270 anti-semitic feeling grew, until King Edward I decreed that the Jews were\na threat to the country, decreed that all Jews must wear a yellow star to\nidentify them in public.&nbsp; All the heads\nof Jewish households were arrested, many taken to the Tower and executed.&nbsp; Finally, in 1290 King Edward banished all\nJews from England.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The exile of Jews lasted until 1655, when Jewish scholar\nManasseh ben Israel bribed Oliver Cromwell and got his assent for Jews to return to\nLondon.&nbsp;&nbsp; In 1517, Martin Luther\nchallenged the Church by nailing to the door of the Cathedral at Wittenberg his\nnow famous \u201c95 Theses,\u201d i.e. questions regarding the Church \u2013 none of whi</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">h was\nvery revolutionary at the time.&nbsp;\nNevertheless, the overreaction of the establishment guaranteed the\nsuccess of the revolution.&nbsp; Had the\nChurch chosen to ignore it, people would have thought Luther was just another\ncrazy monk.&nbsp; However, they did not let it\ngo, and gave fuel to his movement.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The local bishop\nimmediately relieved him of his duties and sent a report to Rome, demanding\nthat Martin Luther be excommunicated.&nbsp;\nLuther, who had as sharp mouth as he did a pen, traveled throughout the\ntowns of Germany stirring up controversy, one the established Church could not\nback down from.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Holy Roman Emperor\nCharles V called Luther to trial at the Diet of Worms, where the parliament\nmet. He was allowed to defend himself, which was a mistake because his\narticulate defense of his ideas damaged the Church as much as anything.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thus, the schism began.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All of the malcontents,\nincluding the peasants and lower classes, who had nothing to lose, joined in\nthe revolution. It started in Germany but spread throughout Europe. Luther\nhimself became much more radical, including abolishing the institution of\ncelibacy for the clergy and marrying a former nun.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In short, he founded a\nnew religion.
