font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">X-ray diffraction,\nstereo microscopy, metallurgical analysis.,gamma-ray absorption tests etc )</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">. They even faked the spelling .</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-uuA_G5H9Ez8/VJQH979MM3I/AAAAAAAA0DI/nTY56-tJYbg/s1600/DRAKE_1erer577-1580.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-uuA_G5H9Ez8/VJQH979MM3I/AAAAAAAA0DI/nTY56-tJYbg/s1600/DRAKE_1erer577-1580.png\" height=\"268\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BEE IT KNOWNE VN TO ALL\nMEN BY THESE PRESENTS.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IVNE.17.1579<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BY THE GRACE OF GOD AND\nIN THE NAME OF HERR MAIESTYQVEEN ELIZABETH OF ENGLAND AND HERR SVCCESSORS\nFOREVER, I TAKE POSSESSION OF THIS KINGDOME WHOSE KING AND PEOPLE FREELY\nRESIGNE THEIR RIGHT AND TITLE IN THE WHOLE LAND VNTO HERR MAIESTIEES KEEPEING.\nNOW NAMED BY ME AN TO BEE KNOWNE V(N) TO ALL MEN AS NOVA ALBION.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">G. FRANCIS DRAKE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">(Hole for sixpence)</span><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-9sWvllHH1_c/VJQImOUcZBI/AAAAAAAA0DQ/tFM6RFvPmnY/s1600/do23wnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-9sWvllHH1_c/VJQImOUcZBI/AAAAAAAA0DQ/tFM6RFvPmnY/s1600/do23wnload.jpg\" height=\"400\" width=\"299\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We in India know how R\nfaked all the Askoka edicts ! &nbsp;&nbsp;Emperor\nAshoka who converted from BAAAD BAAAAAD Hindusim to GOODIE GOOD Buddhism ,\nnever existed . &nbsp;We the oldest and the best record\nkeepers on this planet never heard of Ashoka till the white invader came to\nIndia .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/08/chanakya-taxila-university-professor.html\" style=\"background-color: yellow;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/08/chanakya-taxila-university-professor.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">On his voyage to\ninterfere with Spanish treasure fleets, Drake had several quarrels with his co-commander\nThomas Doughty . Drake accused him of witchcraft and charged him with mutiny\nand treason in a shipboard trial.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">The whole idea was to\nallow no one else know about his FAKE log keeping . &nbsp;</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Drake claimed to have\na&nbsp; commission from the Queen ( FAKE\n)&nbsp; to carry out such acts and denied\nDoughty a trial in England. &nbsp;The main pieces\nof evidence against Doughty were the testimony of the ship's carpenter, Edward\nBright, who after the trial was promoted to master of the ship Marigold.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Francis Drake had\nThomas Doughty beheaded . This thing of a fleet commander beheading his\nco-commander is NOT allowed. &nbsp;When the\nship's chaplain Francis Fletcher in a sermon suggested that the woes of the\nvoyage in January 1580 were connected to the unjust demise of Doughty, &nbsp;Drake chained the clergyman to a hatch cover\nand pronounced him excommunicated.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Drake led the second\nexpedition to sail around the world in a voyage lasting from 1577 to 1580\n(Magellan led the first voyage around the world). Queen Elizabeth I comissioned\nDrake to command the expedition together with Thomas Doughty. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They left Plymouth,\nEngland, on December 13, 1577, with six ships (including the Golden Hind). &nbsp;&nbsp;They sailed to Brazil, and through the\nperilous Strait of Magellan . I have been through this straits several times\nand I know Drake\u2019s accounts are bullsh#t .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Upon his return, the\nQueen rewarded Drake with a large sum of money (\u00a310,000).</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-nK0BnPKkkXc/VJQOO64kWRI/AAAAAAAA0D4/1gYPNuVMW9o/s1600/36433762_orig.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-nK0BnPKkkXc/VJQOO64kWRI/AAAAAAAA0D4/1gYPNuVMW9o/s1600/36433762_orig.jpg\" height=\"460\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sir John Hawkins was\nboth a slave trader AND the Treasurer of Queen Elizabeth\u2019s Navy. &nbsp;In 1567 the &nbsp;Francis Drake sailed to Sierra Leone in a\nfleet commanded by his cousin, John Hawkins.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-a_yZ2N0yqjU/VJQNw40llWI/AAAAAAAA0Ds/E3M6epFgNT8/s1600/image-341089-p9anoV9-yeca.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Here they bought, stole and captured thousands of black African slaves\nwhich they transported and sold for profit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-IGTS9bSnJKU/VJQNcdbasBI/AAAAAAAA0Dk/NPzndhX7bxE/s1600/bra-slave5r01s.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/05/black-african-slave-trade-and-jews-capt.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/05/black-african-slave-trade-and-jews-capt.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/04/indentured-coolie-slavery-reinvented.html\" style=\"background-color: yellow;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/04/indentured-coolie-slavery-reinvented.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Below: &nbsp; The brave Don Alonso\nP\u00e9rez de Guzm\u00e1n, 7th Duke of Medina Sidonia . &nbsp;Lying English historian and Jew accounts claimed\nthat the Duke of Medina Sidonia was a fool and a coward who hid below decks in\na specially reinforced room and kept vomiting into a barrel as he was always seasick ..</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-NFPq0qt-8qk/VJWg2JyK-VI/AAAAAAAA0Ew/ghgPax3b-PA/s1600/220px-Alonso_P%C3%A9rez_de_G54uzm%C3%A1n.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-NFPq0qt-8qk/VJWg2JyK-VI/AAAAAAAA0Ew/ghgPax3b-PA/s1600/220px-Alonso_P%C3%A9rez_de_G54uzm%C3%A1n.jpg\" height=\"400\" width=\"394\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The British historian lied\nwhen they wrote that the Spanish feared Francis Drake and even went so far as\nto nickname him \"El Draque\" ( the dragon ).&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nliars praised the accomplishments of the stellar commander Elizabeth had chosen\nto head her fleet, her cousin Charles Howard, 2nd Baron Howard of Effingham, Earl of\nNottingham ( below ). And how &nbsp;Lord and high Admiral Effingham had HAJAAAR\nknowledge of sea battles ( when he had none ) and had wisely chosen Sir Francis Drake, an\nexperienced privateer, as one of his principal advisors .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Q5PNTNTnMds/VJWicuUX0UI/AAAAAAAA0E8/mSHcyn2sb2c/s1600/downlofffad.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Q5PNTNTnMds/VJWicuUX0UI/AAAAAAAA0E8/mSHcyn2sb2c/s1600/downlofffad.jpg\" height=\"640\" width=\"502\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He was ridiculed for\ntrying to capture one of the ships which ran aground and whose mast was broken.\nHoward served at sea under his father's command as a youth. Howard was knighted\nin 1572 and became Lord Howard of Effingham following his father's death in\n1573. He was named as one of the commissioners to try Mary, Queen of Scots.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-vQ3eMae2g5s/VJbCv76Mr2I/AAAAAAAA0Gc/y3Qe9KJTCwg/s1600/7482663627.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-vQ3eMae2g5s/VJbCv76Mr2I/AAAAAAAA0Gc/y3Qe9KJTCwg/s1600/7482663627.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On 19 July Howard\nreceived the news that the Armada had been seen off Lizard Point, Cornwall. Two\ndays after he wrote to Walsingham-&nbsp; BULLSH#T\nOF THE FIRST ORDER :<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE:&nbsp; ...whereupon, although the wind was very scant,\nwe first warped out of harbour that night, and upon Saturday turned out very\nhardly, the wind being at South-West; and about three of the clock in the\nafternoon, descried the Spanish fleet, and did what we could to work for the\nwind, which [by this] morning we had recovered, descrying their f[leet to]\nconsist of 120 sail, whereof there are 4 g[alleasses] and many ships of great\nburden. At nine of the [clock] we gave them fight, which continued until one.\n[In this] fight we made some of them to bear room to stop their leaks;\nnotwithstanding we durst not adventure to put in among them, their fleet being\nso strong. But there shall be nothing either neglected or unhazarded, that may\nwork their overthrow. Sir, the captains in her Majesty's ships have behaved\nthemselves most bravely and like me :UNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On 7 August he updated\nWalsingham:&nbsp;&nbsp; BULLSH#T OF THE HIGHEST\nORDER , YET AGAIN !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE :&nbsp; In our last fight with the enemy before\nGravelines, the 29th July, we sank three of their ships and made four to go\nroom with the shore so leak as they were not able to live at sea. After that\nfight, notwithstanding that our powder and shot was well near all spent, we set\non a brag countenance and have them chase, as though we had wanted nothing,\nuntil we had cleared our own coast and some part of Scotland of them. And\nthen...we made for the Frith, and sent certain pinnaces to dog the fleet until\nthey should be past the Isles of Scotland, which I verily believe they are left\nat their sterns ere this...I must thank you for your favourable using of my\nbrother Hoby. He telleth me how forwards you were to further all things for our\nwants. I would some were of your mind. If we had had that which had been sent,\nEngland and her Majesty had had the most honour that ever any nation had. But\nGod be thanked; it is well. :&nbsp; UNQUOTE <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On 9 August Howard\nwrote that he believed the Armada would return because \"they dare not go\nback with this dishonour and shame; for we have marvellously plucked them\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>BAAAP &nbsp;RE !</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Np6yIIe7htY/VJbCbLTmkkI/AAAAAAAA0GU/esvwv4ewKJI/s1600/BIG54.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Np6yIIe7htY/VJbCbLTmkkI/AAAAAAAA0GU/esvwv4ewKJI/s1600/BIG54.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The lying white\nhistorian write that Duke of Parma's fleet was unable to reach the place of\nrendezvous by the time the Armada arrived due to the interference of Dutch\nforces under Captain Justin of Nassau.&nbsp;\nJustin's fleet of thirty Dutch cromsters (small war ships) successfully\nhemmed in Parma's ships for the entire Battle of Gravelines . That Parma's\nships were ill-prepared and were certainly no match for Justin's small, quick\nships&nbsp; --ALL BULL.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Duke of Pharma did\nNOT want to release 30000 of his best soldiers and get his own ass fried back\nhome .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Below: Alexander\nFarnese , Duke of Parma</span> , </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Governor of the Spanish Netherlands\nfrom 1578 to 1592</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-bzPDrJDa3oY/VJWoMUakW1I/AAAAAAAA0FM/LzmBnHQ63Ns/s1600/down65load.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-bzPDrJDa3oY/VJWoMUakW1I/AAAAAAAA0FM/LzmBnHQ63Ns/s1600/down65load.jpg\" height=\"400\" width=\"330\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Below:&nbsp;&nbsp; King Philip II of Spain-&nbsp; Philip's father arranged his marriage to\n37-year old Queen Mary I of England. In order to elevate Philip to Mary's rank,\nhis father ceded the crown of Naples, as well as his claim to the Kingdom of\nJerusalem, to him.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Ld5qHAU5Mlc/VJWpjjmPFoI/AAAAAAAA0FY/wj1re7xIWxk/s1600/imagj8es.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Ld5qHAU5Mlc/VJWpjjmPFoI/AAAAAAAA0FY/wj1re7xIWxk/s1600/imagj8es.jpg\" height=\"400\" width=\"231\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Jew historian\nscrewed him in death . &nbsp;&nbsp;They LIED \u2013 \u201cHis\ndeath, which was very painful, involved a severe attack of gout, fever, and\ndropsy (edema). For 52 horrific days the King deteriorated. He could no longer\nbe moved to be washed because of the pain; thus a hole was cut in his mattress\nfor the release of bodily fluids.\u201d &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-POj7qeYTA-Y/VJbCE9XVb2I/AAAAAAAA0GM/RNowxoM6mY8/s1600/732788998.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Philip\nII ruled a vast empire ( below \u2013 as of 1598 AD ). &nbsp;They even reduced the size of his empire in N America.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-_u93XgiiOac/VJWq9qCQnkI/AAAAAAAA0Fo/s3jTWE_qjQ8/s1600/large-sphhanish-empire.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Below: Present day USA - today the English speaking Hilly Billy white man treat Hispanics as third class citizens .- -and original inhabitants Red Indians are aliens.</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-CXIv4VRyoTY/VJWr8lB1JVI/AAAAAAAA0F0/2l4QH6bA-nE/s1600/down34load.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">76-year-old one-legged\nGiraud de Mauleon was Governor of Calais in 1588. &nbsp;A Catholic hostile to the English, he lost his\nleg during fighting to recover Calais from the English in 1558.&nbsp;&nbsp; Store ships of the Armada quickly replenished\nfood and water at Calais.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The English fleet had a\nhuge &nbsp;advantage of home turf \u2013 close to\nEnglish shores where stores, water , ammunition , man power could be\nreplenished quickly. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The English has a\ncrypto \u2013Jew Hector Nunes as a spy.&nbsp;&nbsp; The\nJews of Spain wanted &nbsp;revenge on the Catholic\nInquisition and the Catholic king of Spain .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hector Nu\u00f1ez, was able to provide\nthe British spymaster Francis Walsingham with foreknowledge and inside\ninformation of the Armada\u2019s position and intentions. &nbsp;&nbsp;He was\nfriendly with King Philip 11 by virtue of being a physician . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hector Nunez was a\nsuccessful merchant and physician. He ran a hufe spy network of crypto-Jews .\nTheir crypted messages came inside figs. The wife of Hector Nu\u00f1ez, Leonara\nFreire, was in charge of the upkeep of a secret synagogue in Antwerp. . &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nunes' large scale trading was a perfect\ncover for his espionage activities. &nbsp;His\nspy network was exposed after the Spanish Armada went back to Spain. His spy\nbrother-in-law in Madrid was later arrested.&nbsp;&nbsp;\n&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On the day the Armada\nset sail, Elizabeth's ambassador in the Netherlands, Valentine Dale, met Duke\nof Parma's representatives in peace negotiations- in vain .&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The English made a vain\neffort to intercept the Armada in the Bay of Biscay and lost all their ships in\nbattle .</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The English fleet\noutnumbered the Spanish, 200 ships to 119 while the Spanish fleet outgunned the\nEnglish\u2014its available firepower was 50% more than that of the English and of\nlonger range .</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The English fleet\nconsisted of the 35 ships of the Royal Fleet (21 of which were galleons of 200\nto 400 tons) and 164 other ships (30 of which were of 200 to 400 tons and\ncarried up to 42 guns each), 12 of these were privateers owned by Lord Howard\nof Effingham, Sir John Hawkins and Sir Francis Drake.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Below:The mighty Spanish Armada .&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">At </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">Calais\nshore batteries offered protection from English attack.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Spanish Armada had more\nthan 2500 long range cannons on board their ships . </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">More than &nbsp;95% of these these shipboard</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">guns reached back Spain .</span></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-iCSoh9vFSAQ/VJbBUwtwS_I/AAAAAAAA0GE/mBiZ1x4_olo/s1600/SpanishArmada_Isle_o563f_Wight.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-iCSoh9vFSAQ/VJbBUwtwS_I/AAAAAAAA0GE/mBiZ1x4_olo/s1600/SpanishArmada_Isle_o563f_Wight.jpg\" height=\"247\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The COUNTER Armada (\nEnglish Armada of 1589 )had weakened the English Navy&nbsp; . &nbsp;Finally Elizabeths successor &nbsp;James I (son of Mary Queen of Scots) opened\nnegotiations in 1604, and secured a peace treaty - which gave Spain ALL &nbsp;the concessions for which King Philip II had\nsent the Spanish Armada in 1588.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The failure of the\nSpanish Armada to invade London in 1588 did not represent a decisive Spanish\ndefeat, nor did it in itself pose any challenge to Spanish naval power or King\nPhilip\u2019s war aims (which were principally directed against the Netherlands,\nFrance, and other theaters of combat on the European Continent).&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To truly inflict a decisive blow against\nSpain, England had to follow up the Armada\u2019s repulse with an offensive of its\nown, and thus it was a little-known encounter in 1589 ( COUNTER Armada or the\nEnglish Armada ) which got pulverized by Spain. Their previous year\u2019s hero Sir\nFrancis Drake again in a repeat cowardly manner did NOT risk his hide.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The lying English\nhistorian does NOT write allthis.&nbsp; In\nJune 1589 , the defeated English fleet limped back to Plymouth having suffered\nheavy casualties . They lost almost all their ships with 12000 loss of life.\nThis was real combat and no English ship was lost in storms. The English Armada\nof 1589 &nbsp;had cost over \u00a3160,000.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This was\nfar more that what Spain lost the previous year in the hurricane off Ireland\n.&nbsp; The English definitely did not rule\nthe seas in the aftermath of the Spanish Armada, in large part due to the\nfailure of its own Armada in 1589.&nbsp; The\nSpaniards would remain the dominant sea power well into the 17th century, and\nwhen another nation assumed preeminence on the oceans, it would be the Dutch\nsupplanting them in the late 1600s, not the English.&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The repulsing of the\nSpanish naval force may have given heart to the Protestant cause across Europe\nand the belief that God was behind the Protestant cause. This was shown by the\nstriking of commemorative medals that bore variations on the inscription,\n\"1588. Flavit Jehovah et Dissipati Sunt\" - with \"Jehovah\"\nin Hebrew letters (\"God blew, and they are scattered\"), or He blew\nwith His winds, and they were scattered.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-dd3sixtcFGI/VJbfIyDYrqI/AAAAAAAA0HM/JhhAIs8DNts/s1600/spanischearm45ada1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-dd3sixtcFGI/VJbfIyDYrqI/AAAAAAAA0HM/JhhAIs8DNts/s1600/spanischearm45ada1.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Above :&nbsp; Jehovah blew with His winds, and they were\nscattered is a famous phrase on the aftermath of the defeat of the Spanish\nArmada in 1588, when the Spanish fleet was broken up by a storm, which was also\ncalled the Protestant Wind. &nbsp;&nbsp;The Jew\nspies got their rewards by &nbsp;\"Jehovah\"\nin Hebrew letters, the Tetragrammaton \u05d9\u05d4\u05d5\u05d4). The obverse displayed a church\nbuilding, symbolizing the Protestant Church, remaining unmoved in a storm\n(symbolizing the Armada invasion).</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These Spanish Armada\nships carried amongst other items; 180 priests; 728 servants; 11 million pounds\n(in weight) of ships biscuits; 40,000 gallons of olive oil; 14,000 barrels of\nwine; 600,000 pounds of salted pork; 11,000 pairs of sandals and 5,000 pairs of\nshoes\u2014for their land campaign in London..&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They lost all of it off Ireland when\ntheir store ships sank . &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">These store ships were\nlarge , broad , flat bottomed and heavy, and could not maneuver quickly under\nsail.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\nThe ships which sank in the hurricane off Ireland west coast\ndid not intend to engage the English in a sea battle. &nbsp;They were primarily troop transport for the\n30, 000 soldiers of the Duke of Parma\u2019s soldiers .&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\nTheir major task was simply\nto carry armed men to a designated landing point up the Thames river and unload\nthem to march on to London on foot and on horses.<o:p></o:p></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Spanish store ship\nRosario lost her foremast ( lost rudder ) due to the impact of &nbsp;grounding on a sand bank and was crippled .&nbsp; &nbsp;The\ncrew escaped at night in life boats.&nbsp; The\nfollowing morning Francis Drake and the crew of Revenge captured the crippled\nRosario. &nbsp;The escaping Spanish crew from\nRosario left behind 55,000 gold ducats on board, which Francis Drake took\npossession of.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Spanish store ship\nSan Salvador also ran aground due to loss of rudder but was intact . &nbsp;When Francis Drake sailed towards the grounded\nship San Salvador to capture the prize, a tremendous explosion tore out its\nstern castle ( powder store ) and the Spanish crew escaped in life boats to the\nrest of the Armada.&nbsp; The badly damaged\nSan Salvador was captured by the English and towed to Weymouth. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are the only two Spanish ships lost in\nthe battle ground and NOT sunk by the hurricane of Ireland.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the Spanish Armada\nwas NOT hit by the hurricane off the coast of north Scotland and west Ireland ,\nthe entire Spanish Armada would have attacked England again &nbsp;. Their store ships were hugging the coast\nonly to land ashore in Catholic Ireland where water and &nbsp;food were arranged in secret . &nbsp;&nbsp;Ireland was still Catholic and were ready to\nhelp the Catholic Spanish sailors . &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Queen's government\nin Ireland feared nothing so much as an alliance between the Catholic Irish and\nthe Catholic Spaniards.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the scattered\nships of the Armada began to appear off the west coast in the first week of\nSeptember the Lord Deputy and Council issued most stringent orders to all\nofficers and loyal gentlemen that any Spaniard who landed on the soil of\nIreland must be killed forthwith without mercy.</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sir Richard Bingham, who was Governor of\nConnacht at the time, slaughtered all survivors on the Connacht coast except\n'persons of rank' in the hope of securing ransom money. When the Lord Deputy of\nIreland heard this he sent peremptory orders that these too must be killed, and\nthis was done. Thus the stage was set for the slaughter that followed.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even the English knew\nthat Francis Drake and his men did NIL damage to the Spanish Armada as it\npassed up the English Channel. What the English did do was waste a lot of\nammunition firing at the Armada and not having much of an impact as the Spanish\nships had well built hulls that proved to be solid and long range guns.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All lived the LIE and fell flat on their\nfaces the next year during the counter attack. This was the reason why Francis\nDrake FAKED his death at Panama . The English public got to know what this dirty\npirate sans character was up to and they were ready to give him a hostile treatment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Drake was a coward\nbecause he preferred NOT to come in front of the Spanish Armada and preferred\nto be in the wake.&nbsp; As the Armada sailed\nvery very slowly at 3 knots up the English Channel, the attacks by Drake\u2019s Plymouth\nfleet proved to be very totally ineffective.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With the exception of two store\ngalleons which ran aground due to loss of rudder the Spanish Armada retained\n117 of their original 119 ships.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Irish know that\nbefore the hurricane really hit the Spanish Armada few store ships went to what\nis &nbsp;now called Armada Bay, south of\nGalway. &nbsp;&nbsp;Those sailors who went ashore and\npicked up food and water. &nbsp;&nbsp;But after\nthey sailed out they were sunk by rough seas .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On 15th September 1588 ,&nbsp; 4 Spanish store ships were wrecked on the\nSligo coast, more than 600 bloated bodies were counted on the single stretch of\nbeach.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\">Much later Hieronymus\nKarl Friedrich Baron von M\u00fcnchhausen would spin bullshit and far fetched tales\nof his FAKE adventures like Sir Francis Drake. &nbsp; &nbsp;M\u00fcnchhausen's reputation as a storyteller has been exaggerated by\nwriters, giving birth to a fully fictionalized literary character usually\ncalled simply Baron Munchausen. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">M\u00fcnchausen\nsyndrome is a term coined for such pathetic people. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-wFRLP5qloj4/VJbt56X6dGI/AAAAAAAA0IE/BFqSm54SnvA/s1600/baron-muenchh6ausen.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mother Teresa was one \u2013she\nsuffered from a variation of this syndrome called MUNCHAUSEN SYNDROME BY PROXY. &nbsp; Such a syndrome is usual to a woman who is sexually repressed, and received\nzero love in childhood.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">M\u00fcnchausen\nsyndrome by proxy (MSbP) is when a mother deliberately causes injury or illness\nto her own child to gain attention, sympathy or other psychological benefit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; &nbsp;They showed a picture of her, and she really looks like a man behind all that thick white makeup and false orange hair.</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">&nbsp; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">In the book Steve Berry\ntraces the idea of Elizabeth as a man to the legend of the Bisley Boy, which he\nheard in 2010 when he was in the village of Ely, north of London.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">The legend says\nPrincess Elizabeth died when she was 12 or 13 while living in the village of\nBisley in Gloucestershire. &nbsp;&nbsp;Her\ngoverness was so afraid of the girl's father, Henry VIII, </span><span style=\"color: red;\"><b>she quietly buried\nthe princess and substituted a boy </b></span><span style=\"color: blue;\">from the village.</span></span><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">\"For 300 years, up\nuntil the early part of the 20th century, the village of Bisley paraded a\nlittle boy dressed up as a girl. Why would they do that?\" &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Berry asked. \"I was intrigued by this\nstory. I knew there was a novel here, a great adventure for Malone.\"<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><i style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">\"All her life she\nwore heavy face paint and wigs. &nbsp; She wore clothing that hid her body and </span><b><span style=\"color: red;\">refused\nto allow doctors to examine her below the neck</span></b><span style=\"color: blue;\">. Her No. 1 job was to have a\nchild, but she refused. </span><b><span style=\"color: red;\">When she died (in 1603), her body could not be viewed\nor autopsied.</span></b><span style=\"color: blue;\">\"</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\">Sir Francis Drake died\nof dysentery on January 27, 1596, aged 55 while anchored off the coast of\nPuerto Bello, Panama after an unsuccessful campaign as per official history. &nbsp;&nbsp;What happened he just escaped with his\ntreasure and melted away .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;;
