font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On the replica of Sir\nFrancis Drake's ring, it says the co-ordinates are \"9-32-79\".</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nring was supposedly made on the 29th of January in the year 1596, which is the\ndate engraved on it.&nbsp; &nbsp;After traveling around the world, Francis\nDrake was knighted and given the ring by Queen Elizabeth ( all bull !) .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-lQxkbQb03ek/VJb8Qby6kII/AAAAAAAA0I4/UnQeBALEhpo/s1600/ima51ges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-lQxkbQb03ek/VJb8Qby6kII/AAAAAAAA0I4/UnQeBALEhpo/s1600/ima51ges.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The main inscription on\nthe ring is \"Sic Parvis Magna\". &nbsp;According to Nathan Drake, this was Francis\nDrake's motto, which means \"Greatness From Small Beginnings\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The date inscribed on\nthe ring is the 29th of January 1596, the day after Francis Drake supposedly\ndied. &nbsp;This is 100% proof that Francis Drake faked his death.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Also inscribed on the\nring are the coordinates of Francis Drake's empty coffin, &nbsp;found just off the coast of Panama, which\ncontained his diary. &nbsp;T</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">hey have found two of\nhis ships which were scuttled off the coast of Panama over 400 years ago\nfollowing Drake\u2019s death.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/--A2Hq4xfFZc/VJb80XLzoVI/AAAAAAAA0JA/hYSuGHjri_I/s1600/ima7ges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/--A2Hq4xfFZc/VJb80XLzoVI/AAAAAAAA0JA/hYSuGHjri_I/s1600/ima7ges.jpg\" height=\"320\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Here is the bullsh#t\nofficial version.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE:&nbsp; The Spanish gunners from El Morro Castle shot\na cannonball through the cabin of Drake's flagship, and he survived; but a few\nweeks later, in January 1596, he died of dysentery when he was about 55, while\nanchored off the coast of Portobelo, Panama.&nbsp;\nBefore dying, he asked to be dressed in his full armour. He was buried\nat sea in a lead coffin, near Portobelo. Divers continue to search for the\ncoffin: &nbsp;UNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wanna hear some English\nbull mixed with Jewish bull ? <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Potent mix really ! <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE:&nbsp; Examination of Spanish canon balls recovered\nfrom wrecks showed the Armada\u2019s ammunition to be badly cast, the iron lacking\nthe correct composition and too brittle, causing the balls to disintegrate on\nimpact, rather than penetrating the hull. Several guns were found to have been\nbadly cast and of inadequate composition, increasing the danger of bursting and\nkilling or injuring the gun crews . Much of the ammunition recovered from the\nwrecks proved to be of the wrong calibre for the guns carried in the ships&nbsp; UNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is how losers\nwrite history !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As part of the\nmobilisation of the South of England, the Earl of Leicester,&nbsp; Elizabeth\u2019s favourite and erstwhile English\ncommander in the Netherlands, gathered 5,000 troops at Tilbury in the Thames\nEstuary after the Spanish Armada had crossed the North coast of Scotland and\nwas on way back to Spain&nbsp; ..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Queen\nreviewed Leicester\u2019s force and spAke&nbsp; \u201c\u2026\nI may have the body of a weak and feeble woman,&nbsp;\nbut I have the heart of a King of England.\u201d ( Hey , are you sure about\nthe body of a woman?)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-gZYOX-o7P3Y/VJcBy5nWqJI/AAAAAAAA0JQ/SrvpyOpKbDc/s1600/article-233787774-1A2FCFB2000005DC-161_634x844.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-gZYOX-o7P3Y/VJcBy5nWqJI/AAAAAAAA0JQ/SrvpyOpKbDc/s1600/article-233787774-1A2FCFB2000005DC-161_634x844.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What follows is a LIFT\nfrom the DAILY MAIL article before. &nbsp;Today\nin this Internet age, the English cannot be fooled . &nbsp;John Bull is sick and tired of LIES about the\nroyals.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2337774/Is-proof-Virgin-Queen-imposter-drag-Shocking-new-theory-Elizabeth-I-unearthed-historic-manuscripts.html\">http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2337774/Is-proof-Virgin-Queen-imposter-drag-Shocking-new-theory-Elizabeth-I-unearthed-historic-manuscripts.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>WAS &nbsp;QUEEN ELIZABETH 1 &nbsp;A &nbsp;MAN ?</b></span><br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bones of\nElizabeth I, Good Queen Bess, lie mingled with those of her sister, Bloody\nMary, in a single tomb at Westminster Abbey</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">. &nbsp; &nbsp;But are they really royal remains \u2014 or\nevidence of the greatest conspiracy in English history?<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>If that is not the\nskeleton of Elizabeth Tudor, the past four centuries of British history have\nbeen founded on a lie.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>And according to a\ncontroversial new book, the lie began on an autumn morning 470 years ago, when\npanic swept through a little group of courtiers in a manor house in the\nCotswold village of Bisley in Gloucestershire.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Could the virgin queen be a\npart of the biggest deception in British history?<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>The king, Henry VIII,\nwas due at any hour. He was travelling from London, in great discomfort \u2014 for\nthe 52-year-old monarch was grossly overweight and crippled by festering sores\n\u2014 to visit his daughter, Elizabeth.</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>The young princess had\nbeen sent there that summer from the capital to avoid an outbreak of plague.\nBut she had fallen sick with a fever and, after weeks of bleeding, leeches and\nvomiting, her body was too weak to keep fighting. The night before the king\u2019s\narrival, his favourite daughter, the only child of his marriage to Anne Boleyn,\nhad been dangerously ill. In the morning, Elizabeth lay dead. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Elizabeth\u2019s governess,\nLady Kat Ashley, and her guardian, Thomas Parry, had good reason to fear\ntelling the king this awful news. It would cost them their lives. Four of Henry\u2019s\nchildren had died in infancy and, of the survivors, one \u2014 Edward \u2014 was a sickly\nboy of five and the other an embittered, unmarried woman in her late 20s.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>The ten-year-old\nElizabeth was Tudor England\u2019s most valuable child in many ways. She could\nsurely be married to a French or Spanish prince to seal an international\nalliance \u2014 and her own children would secure the Tudor dynasty Henry so\ndesperately craved. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Now she was dead, and\nwhen the king discovered it, Parry and Lady Ashley would surely be executed.\nTheir sole duty had been to keep the princess safe: failure was treason. The\npenalty would not even be beheading, but death by the most gruesome torture\nimaginable.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>They would be bound and\ndragged through the mud for a mile to the scaffold. There they would be hanged,\ncut down and disembowelled. Their entrails would be hauled from their bodies\nand held in front of their faces as they died, and then their limbs would be\nhacked off and displayed on spikes, to be picked bare by the birds.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Their only chance of\nconcealing the truth, and perhaps buying themselves a few days to flee the\ncountry, was to trick the king.</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Kat Ashley\u2019s first\nthought was to find a village girl and dress her up in the princess\u2019s robe,\nwith a mantle, to fool the king. Bisley was a tiny hamlet, however, and there\nwere no female children of Elizabeth\u2019s age.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>But there was a boy,\nfrom a local family called Neville. He was a gawky, angular youth a year or so\nyounger than Elizabeth, who had been the princess\u2019s companion and fellow pupil\nfor the past few weeks. &nbsp; &nbsp;And with no time to look further afield for a stand-in,\nParry and Lady Ashley took the desperate measure of forcing the boy to don his\ndead friend\u2019s clothes.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Remarkably, the\ndeception worked. Henry saw his daughter rarely, and was used to hearing her\nsay nothing.&nbsp; The last time she had been\npresented in court, meeting the new Queen Catherine Parr, she had been\ntrembling with terror. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>The princess was known\nas a gentle, studious child, and painfully shy \u2014 not a girl to speak up in\nfront of the king who had beheaded her mother.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>So when \u2018she\u2019 stood at\nBisley manor, in the dimness of an oak-beamed hall lit by latticed windows, it\nwas not so surprising that the king failed to realise he was being duped. &nbsp;He\nhad no reason to suspect his daughter had been ill, after all, and he himself\nwas tired and in pain.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>But after he left later\nthat afternoon, the hoax began in earnest. Parry and Lady Ashley realised that\nif they ever admitted what they had done, the king\u2019s fury would be boundless.\nThey might get out of the country to safety, but their families would surely be\nkilled.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>On the other hand, few\npeople had known the princess well enough to be certain of recognising her,\nespecially after an interval of many months. This boy had already fooled the\nking, the most important deception.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Meanwhile, there was no\neasy way to find a female lookalike, and replace the replacement. As the\ncourtiers buried the real Elizabeth Tudor in a stone coffin in the manor\ngrounds, they decided their best hope of protecting themselves and their\nfamilies was to teach this Bisley boy how to be a princess.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Of course this entire\ntheory sounds absurd, given that every child grows up with tales of our\nglorious Virgin Queen, celebrated by Shakespeare and venerated in innumerable\nplays, songs and films over the centuries.</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>And yet the many\ncorroborating details around this extraordinary tale about the Bisley boy were\nenough to convince the 19th-century writer Bram Stoker, most famous as the\nauthor of Dracula. He included the story as the final chapter in his&nbsp; book, Imposters.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Stoker had heard\npersistent stories that a coffin had been discovered by a clergyman at Bisley\nduring the early 1800s, with the skeleton of a girl dressed in Tudor finery,\neven with gems sewn onto the cloth.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>It seemed to chime with\nlocal legends persisting for centuries that an English monarch had been, in\nreality, a child from the village.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Above all, Stoker\nbelieved, it was the most plausible explanation&nbsp;\nwhy Elizabeth, who succeeded to&nbsp;\nthe throne in 1558, aged 25,&nbsp;\nnever married. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Her most urgent duty,\nas the last of the Tudor line, was to provide an heir \u2014 yet she described\nherself as a Virgin Queen, and vowed she would never take a husband, even if\nthe Emperor of Spain offered her an alliance with his oldest son.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>She stayed true to that\noath, provoking a war which almost ended in Spanish invasion in 1588. But\nElizabeth did not waver \u2014 and never even took an acknowledged lover. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>She was fond of\nproclaiming that she was more of a king than a queen. \u2018I have the heart of a\nman, not a woman, and I am not afraid of anything,\u2019 she declared. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Her most famous speech,\nto her troops at Tilbury as the Spanish Armada approached, was cheered to the\nskies as she roared: \u2018I have the heart and stomach of a king, and of a king of\nEngland, too.\u2019<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>American author Steve\nBerry believes Elizabeth could have been telling the literal truth \u2014 that she\nhad the heart of a man, because her body was male. He has spent 18 months\nresearching the conspiracy for his novel The King\u2019s Deception, a Dan\nBrown-style thriller set in 21st-century London.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Could the real reason\nthe 'Virgin Queen' never married was that she was secretly a man?<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>For Berry, who has\nwritten 12 thrillers, the trail began with a chance question during a tour of\nEly Cathedral in Cambridgeshire three years ago. \u2018I always ask if there are any\nsecrets or mysteries, and the guide told me: \u201cThere\u2019s nothing at Ely but I\u2019ve\nheard an incredible rumour in the Cotswolds.\u201d\u2009\u2019</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Sceptical at first,\nBerry uncovered tantalising hints and references in books and ancient manuscripts.\n<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>When the \u2018princess\u2019\nreached her teens, for instance, she was assigned a tutor named Roger Ascham,\nwho was puzzled by her behaviour.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>\u2018The constitution of\nher mind,\u2019 he wrote, \u2018is exempt from female weakness, and she is embued with a\nmasculine power of application\u2009\u2026\u2009In the whole manner of her life she rather\nresembles Hippolyte than Phaedra.\u2019<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>That last, classical\nallusion was quite venomous: Phaedra was an ancient princess driven mad by her\nlust for men, while Hippolyte was queen of the Amazons, who lived without any\nneed for men at all. Most convincing to Berry were the contemporary portraits,\nwhich are reproduced in his novel. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>One picture exists of\nElizabeth as a child, attributed to the court painter William Scrots. She had\nslender shoulders, a delicate neck and a heart-shaped face with ginger hair and\neyebrows.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>In the next known\nportrait, shortly after she was crowned queen, her broad shoulders and neck are\ndisguised with heavy furs. She is wearing a wig, and her eyebrows are plucked\nbare. Her jaw is heavy and square.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><i>All subsequent pictures\nof the queen were painted to an ideal, showing Elizabeth as she wished to be\nseen, not as she was. <o:p></o:p></i></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Even the official\nportrait commissioned after her death by her chief adviser, Sir Robert Cecil,\nconformed to what was known as \u2018The Mask Of Youth\u2019 \u2014 the idealised face of the\nmonarch, which never aged.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Many Tudor courtiers\nsuspected that Elizabeth had a deep secret. Lord Somerset was the power behind\nthe boy king Edward VI\u2019s throne, after Henry VIII died in 1547 when Elizabeth\nwas just 13. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>One of his spies, Sir\nRobert Tyrwhitt, wrote to him: \u2018I do verily believe that there hath been some\nsecret promise between my Lady, Mistress Ashley, and the Cofferer [Thomas\nParry, the principal officer of the court] never to confess to death, and if it\nbe so, it will be never gotten of her, unless by the King\u2019s Majesty or else by\nyour Grace.\u2019<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>In modern English: \u2018I\nam certain Lady Ashley and Thomas Parry have a secret, and that there is a pact\nbetween them to take it to the grave. If that\u2019s the case, the only people who\ncould force them to divulge this secret are you and the King.\u2019<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Those were ominous\nwords: only Somerset and the King had the right to put a suspect to the rack,\nusing torture to extract information.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Bram Stoker believed it\nwas the sheer scale of the deception that made it possible. When Elizabeth\nreturned to London from Bisley, more than a year after she first left the\ncourt, it would have been treason for any sceptics to suggest \u2018she\u2019 was not the\nking\u2019s daughter.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>\u2018It is conceivable,\u2019\nStoker remarked drily, \u2018that in the case of a few individuals, there might have\nbeen stray fragmentary clouds of suspicion. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>\u2018After a time, even\nsuspicion became an impossibility. Here was a young woman growing into\nwomanhood whom all around her had known all her life \u2014 or, what was equivalent,\nbelieved they had.\u2019</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Any differences in her\nappearance were dismissed as the natural effects of growing up. Elizabeth had\nbeen a timid child \u2014 now she was a bold and imperious adolescent. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>As a little girl, she\nwas exceptionally bright, poring over her books and learning as quickly as her\ntutors could teach her; now she was slower at her lessons and, though far from\nstupid, more academic plodder than prodigy.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Her tutor was warned to\nmake her lessons shorter. Roger Ascham commented that the girl who had been\nsaid to soak up facts like a sponge was now more like a shallow cup \u2014 if wine\nwas poured in too quickly, it would simply splash out again.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Kat Ashley and Thomas\nParry \u2014 the pair who are suspected of carrying out the deception \u2014 remained\nloyal to the sovereign throughout their lives, as England\u2019s political pendulum\nswung wildly after the death of Henry VIII.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>During Edward VI\u2019s\nreign, they were Elizabeth\u2019s closest friends, and they stood by \u2018her\u2019 during\nher years of imprisonment in the Tower when her Catholic sister Mary was queen\nand decided the safest place for Elizabeth was under lock and key, where she\ncould not threaten the throne.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>When Mary died at the\nage of 42, one of Elizabeth\u2019s first acts as queen was to make Lady Ashley her\nFirst Lady of the Bedchamber. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>For the next seven\nyears, she controlled all access to the young monarch. Elizabeth was devastated\nwhen Ashley died in 1565, and went into heavy mourning. Thomas Parry was\nknighted, and made a Privy Counsellor and Comptroller of the Household \u2014 the\nrichest rewards Elizabeth could bestow. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>He was a bad-tempered\nman who made many enemies, and few at court grieved when he died in 1560 \u2014 one\nwag said he expired \u2018from mere ill-humour\u2019.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Steve Berry believes\nthe queen must have confessed her secret to her chief minister, William Cecil.\nThe politician had a reputation for an almost supernatural ability to read\npeople and discover facts: she needed Cecil to understand that a marriage would\nnot just have&nbsp; been pointless, it would\nhave&nbsp; been ruinous.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>If her secret was\nbetrayed, the country could be plunged into civil war. There was no obvious\nheir, and Mary\u2019s former husband was now Britain\u2019s greatest enemy, Philip II of\nSpain. Certainly, Cecil was surprisingly stoic about the queen\u2019s determination\nnever to wed.</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Publicly, Elizabeth\nsometimes claimed that people needed to feel their monarch was wedded to the\nwhole country, rather than one man. On other occasions, she hinted that the\ndebacle of her father\u2019s six wives, and her mother\u2019s death at the block, had put\nher off marriage for life.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>If those reasons sound\nflimsy, the queen\u2019s determination to control her image was iron. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; color: blue; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/08/secret-excavations-at-jerusalem-by.html\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/08/secret-excavations-at-jerusalem-by.html</span></a><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At the height of the\nAnglo-Spanish War the Spanish landed 3,500 troops in the south of Ireland to\nassist the Ulster rebel leader Hugh O'Neill, during the Nine Years' War\n(1594\u20131603). &nbsp;Spain and England concluded\na peace in 1604. &nbsp;The treaty happened\nafter a &nbsp;nineteen-year Anglo-Spanish War .\n&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Anglo\u2013Spanish War (1585\u20131604) was an\nintermittent conflict between the kingdoms of Spain and England that was never\nformally declared. &nbsp;&nbsp;England was utterly\nrouted in the naval wars of English Armada( Counter Armada ) &nbsp;in 1589 and the Drake-Hawkins and\nEssex-Raleigh expeditions in 1595 and 1597 respectively.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The negotiations took\nplace at Somerset House in London and are sometimes known as the Somerset House\nConference. &nbsp;&nbsp;After the death of Queen\nElizabeth in 1603, her successor, James I, quickly sought to end the long and\ndraining conflict. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;King James was the &nbsp;son and successor to Mary, Queen of Scots,\nwhose execution had been a proximate cause of the conflict. &nbsp;Philip III of Spain, who also had inherited the\nwar from his predecessor, Philip II, &nbsp;welcomed the offer .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SHIVA symbolizes\nconsciousness, the masculine principle. SHAKTI symbolizes the feminine\nprinciple, the activating energy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The cosmos in all its\nmanifestations, as an act of love. The relationship between Shakti and Shiva is\nthe dance of consciousness and energy experienced within each of us, regardless\nof gender.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shiva resides in the\nhighest Sahasr\u0101ra Chakra and Shakti in the lowest M\u016bl\u0101dh\u0101ra Chakra. &nbsp;&nbsp;When Prakriti and Purusha unite in the\nSahasr\u0101ra Chakra ( raising of Kundalini ) , knowledge, knower and the object of\nknowledge become one.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sankhya philosophy\nunified the Advaita and Dvaita forms of Hinduism in a most interesting\nmanner.&nbsp;&nbsp; Here when the insentient\nPrakriti ( female \u2013Dvaita ) comes in contact with the sentient Purusha (male\n\u2013Advaita ) , the universe evolves.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tantric system borrows\nthe abstract dualism of Sankhya and modifies it into a personified male\u2013female\ndualism. Prakriti functions by borrowing conscioussness from Purusha.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shiva represents the\nconstitutive elements of the universe, while Shakti is the dynamic potency,\nwhich makes these elements come to life and act. The Samkhya philosophy\npromulgates a primordial cosmic duality.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">From the Tantric perspective, this\n\"scheme\" of creation is transformed, in the sense that the two cosmic\nprinciples are considered united, not separated. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tantrism confers to\nShiva and Shakti the qualities of the feminine and masculine principles from\nthe Samkhya philosophy. The eternal and indestructible union between Shiva and\nShakti gives birth to the whole Macrocosm, in its stable, static aspect as well\nas in its dynamic one.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Can any Jew every think\nin such a profound manner ? &nbsp;&nbsp;How do\nthese mentally blunt people corner all the Nobel prizes ?<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Both Shiva and Shakti\nare Consciousness---- Shiva is the changeless static aspect of Consciousness,\nand Shakti is the kinetic, active aspect of the same Consciousness.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shakti\nis manifested by Shiva only during creation and is withdrawn into himself at\nthe end of creation.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Modern science repeats\nfrom our Vedas that matter and energy are interchangeable.&nbsp; So does consciousness and energy .&nbsp; In the highest planes they are interchangeable,\nwhich is why we see a great incongruence between our spiritual experiences and\nthe external reality.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the higher metaphysical realms and subtle planes of\nour consciousness the physical laws of our universe lose their validity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tayor yad yamalam rupam\nsa samghatta iti smrtah---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ananda-saktih saivokta\nyato visvam visrjyati,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Na Sivah Saktirahito na\nSaktih Sivavarjita.&nbsp;\n---(<b>Tantraloka-Ahnika, 3.</b>)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"The coupled form\nof these two (Shiva-Shakti) is called junction.&nbsp;\nThat is called the blissful Shakti from which creation arises. There is\nno Shiva without Shakti, nor Shakti without Shiva.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now let us proceed to\nsome poison injected by the immoral white invader--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE Ardhanarishwara -\noften referred to as a hermaphrodite or androgynous deity, is one of the\nprincipal forms of Shiva.&nbsp; Homosexuals,\nhermaphrodites and transvestites can be considered sacred beings -\n\"images\" of Ardhanarishwara.UNQUOTE ( sic ).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shakti awakens, goes up\nsushumna nadi and unites with Shiva in sahasrara chakra. Shiva represents the\nhigher cosmic consciousness and Shakti represents evolution of energy.\nKundalini yoga is based on this concept.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The union of Shakti\nwith Shiva is the liberation of seeker from the cycle of endless birth and\ndeath.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Ardha-Nari, which\nliterally means, \"half-woman\", is the Soul of the tiny atom to the\nvast cosmos.&nbsp;&nbsp; All creation starts from\nHim.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Though Shakti is not\nco-existent with Purusha, ( Shiva ), she requires his presence to keep the\ncosmos functioning smoothly.&nbsp;&nbsp; Shiva (\nPurusha/ brahmAn ) , though he wields unlimited power, he cannot create the\nuniverse without the Eternal Life Force of Shakti to back him.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The concept of\nArdhanarishvara clearly brings out the fact that Prakriti (Shakti) and Purusha\n(Shiva) are nothing without each other and one cannot exist and function in the\nabsence of the other.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Purusha ( Brahman /\nmorphogenetic consciousness field / Shiva ) is static .&nbsp; Shakti ( pragati) is the dynamic side of\nBrahman.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In each cycle of\ncreation, Para Brahman enters into Prakriti and this union unfolds as the\ncosmos.&nbsp; In the pralaya or dissolution at\nthe end of the cosmic cycle or kalpa all creation withdraws into the now\nformless Prakriti.&nbsp;&nbsp; Prakriti expresses\nHerself through the three gunas ( tamas/ sattva / rajas--&nbsp; - creator/ preserver / destroyer ) , the\nthreads or qualities of all creation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unlike Prakriti, the\nPurusha is only a Drashta or Sakshi (witness) of events in this universe. It\nmerely plays the role of a spectator and does not create anything. This aspect\ncould be compared to a prism, which emits myriad colors only when light is\npassed through it.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unlike Prakriti,&nbsp; Purusha is not material in nature.&nbsp; It does not depend on anything, nor does\nanything depend on it.&nbsp; Purusha, hence,\nis far beyond Prakriti and is totally separate from it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prakriti cannot create\nanything by itself.&nbsp; Let us be very clear\nabout this.&nbsp; Its true power can only be\nactivated in union with Purusha.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Purusha is always\nunchanging in nature and hence, it is Achala or static.&nbsp; Prakriti, on the contrary, constantly creates\nchanges in this universe, hence is the dynamic one.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">None of these trolls\nwill have Jewish names.&nbsp; They will speak\nas innocent net-surfers without a sinister agenda .&nbsp; They and will write responses that will look\npersonal but will be based on a carefully prepared list of messages that\npsychologists in the foreign ministry developed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These Internet shills\nare selected through a careful screening process, which includes psychometric\nevaluation.&nbsp; The Hasbara idea requires\nthat Israel\u2019s role in Internet Goebbelism is not highlighted . The troll must\nNOT be projected to have any Jewish link or political affiliation.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once democracy yields\nto kleptocracy, good governance is given a silent burial. The vacuum thus\ncreated is filled by a vicious nexus among politicians, bureaucrats and the\ncorporate who companioning together change the laws of the land to serve their\nrespective interests.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Over a course of time,\nthe corporate interests take over the other interests and corporate start dictating\nterms to the politicians and the bureaucrats. For this they take recourse to\ngreasing their palm or taking the help of lobbyists who, acting on behalf of\ncorporates, influence the policy decisions of the governments, even trying to\ninfluence the appointment of ministers to the ministries which are of\nparticular interests to them. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Revelations by Neera\nRadia tapes are clear pointers to this direction.
