color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>WANNA KNOW TO WHAT GREAT\nEXTENT THE IMMORAL WHITE INVADER HAS LABORED TO INJECT POISON INTO THE RIG\nVEDA ( NOT KNOWING THAT RIG VEDA IS NOT MEANT TO CONTAIN SUCH STUFF ) <o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>CHECK THIS BULLSH#T OUT &nbsp; -</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"There was a time\nin this very India when, without eating beef, no Brahmin could remain a\nBrahmin;\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aitareya Brahman of the\nRigveda as follows:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"6. \u2026Turn the\nanimal's feet northwards. Make its eyes go to the Sun, dismiss its breath to\nthe wond, its life to the space, its hearing to the directions, its body to the\nearth. In this way the Hotar (priest) connets it with these world. Take of the\nentire skin without cutting it. Before opening the navel tear out the omentum.\nStop its breathing within (by stopping its mouth). Thus the Hotar puts breath\nin the animals. Make of its breast a piece like an eagle, of its arms (two\npieces like) two hatchets, of its forearms (two pieces like) two spikes, of its\nshoulders (two pieces like) two kashyapas (tortoises), its loins should be\nunbroken (entire); make of its thigs (two pieces like) two shields, of the two\nkneepans (two pieces like) two oleander leaves; take out its twenty-six ribs\naccording to their order; preserve every limb of its in its integrity. Thus he\nbenefits all its limbs. Dig a ditch in the earth to hide its excrements.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">7. Present the evil\nspirits with the blood.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">[Aitareya Brahman, Book\n2, para 6 and 7]<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Subsequently, the same\nAitareya Brahman instructing on how to distribute different parts of the\nsacrificial animal says,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Now follows the\ndivision of the different parts of the sacrificial animal (among the priests).\nWe shall describe it. The two jawbones with the tongue are to be given to the\nPrastotar; the breast in the form of an eagle to the Udgatar; the throat with\nthe palate to the Pratihartar; the lower part of the right loins to the Hotar;\nthe left to the Brahma; the right thigh to the Maitravaruna; the left to the\nBrahmanuchhamsi; the right side with the shoulder to the Adhvaryu; the left\nside to those who accompany the chants; the left shoulder to the\nPratipasthatar; the lower part of the right arm to the Neshtar; the lower part\nof the left arm to the Potar; the upper part of the right thigh to the\nAchhavaka; the left to the Agnidhra; the upper part of the right arm to the\nAitreya; the left to the Sadasya; the back bone and the urinal bladder to the\nGrihapati (sacrificer); the right feet to the Grihapati who gives a feasting;\nthe left feet to the wife of that Grihapati who gives a feasting; the upper lip\nis common to both, which is to be divided by the Grihapati. They offer the tail\nof the animal to wives, but they should give it to a Brahmana; the fleshy\nprocesses (maanihah) on the neck and three gristles (kikasaah) to the\nGrahvastut; three other gristles and one half of the fleshy part on the back\n(vaikartta) to the Unnetar; the other half of the fleshy part on the neck and\nthe left lobe (Kloma) to the Slaughterer (Shamita), who should present it to a\nBrahmana, if he himself would not happen to be a Brahmana. The head is to be\ngiven to the Subrahmanya, the skin belongs to him (the Subrahmanya), who spoke,\nSvaah Sutyam (to morrow at the Soma Sacriice); that part of the sacrificial\nanimal at a Soma sacrifice which beloings to Ilaa (sacrificial food) is common\nto all the priests; only for the Hotar it is optional.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All these portions of\nthe sacrificial animal amount to thirty-six single pieces, each of which\nrepresents the paada (foot) of a verse by which the sacrifice is carried\nup\u2026\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"To those who\ndivide the sacrificial animal in the way mentioned, it becomes the guide to\nheaven (Swarga). But those who make the division otherwise are like scoundrels\nand miscreants who kill an animal merely.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"This division of\nthe sacrificial animal was invented by Rishi Devabhaaga, a son of Srauta. &nbsp;When he was departing from this life, he did\nnot entrust (the secret to anyone).&nbsp; &nbsp;But a supernatural being communicated it to\nGirija,the son of Babhru. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Since his\ntime men study it.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">[Aitareya Brahman, Book\n7, Para 1, Translated by Martin Haug]<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br />TEE HEEEE !&nbsp;</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">WHAT A WASTE OF TIME AND EFFORT !!</span></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yajna never meant\nanimal sacrifice in the sense popularly understood. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Yajna in the Vedas meant a noble deed or the\nhighest purifying action.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However in The 'Practical Sanskrit\nEnglish Dictionary' by Chitpavan Jew nay Brahmin V. S. Apte (1890) gives the following meaning of\n'Ashwa-medha'<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"A Yajna in which\na Horse is primarily sacrificed is called Ashwamedha. [Horse Sacrifice]\"( <span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>SIC !</b></span> )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\nCheck out the extent to which the white invader laboured over brandy and cigars !<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE: &nbsp;Vaisampayana said,\n'Having cooked, according to due rites, the other excellent animals that were\nsacrificed, the priests then sacrificed, agreeably to the injunctions of the\nscriptures, that steed (which had wandered over the whole world). After cutting\nthat horse into pieces, conformably to scriptural directions, they caused\nDraupadi of great intelligence, who was possessed of the three requisites of\nmantras, things, and devotion, to sit near the divided animal. The Brahmanas\nthen with cool minds, taking up the marrow of that steed, cooked it duly, O\nchief of Bharata's race. King Yudhishthira the just, with all his younger\nbrothers, then smelled, agreeably to the scriptures, the smoke, capable of\ncleansing one from every sin, of the <span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">marrow</span> that was thus cooked. The remaining\nlimbs, O king, of that horse, were poured into the fire by the sixteen\nsacrificial priests possessed of great wisdom. &nbsp;BLAH &nbsp; &nbsp;BLAH &nbsp; FU#KIN' BLAH &nbsp;- UNQUOTE&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thus guests in ancient\nIndia were called 'goghna', because on their coming a cow was slaughtered to be\nserved to them ( SIC !) .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"If a man wishes\nthat a son should be born to him who will be a famous scholar, frequenting\nassemblies and speaking delightful words, a student of all the Vedas and an\nenjoyer of the full term of life, he should have rice cooked with the meat of a\nyoung bull or of one more advanced in years and he and his wife should eat it\nwith clarified butter. Then they should be able to beget such a son.\"</span>\n&nbsp;POISON INJECTED BY THE IMMORAL WHITE\nINVADER IN&nbsp; <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brihadaranyak Upanishad\n6/4/18&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Here is a verse\nattributed by the immoral white invader to Adi Shankarachrya :- \"Odan'\n(rice) mixed with meat is called 'Mansodan'. &nbsp;On being asked whose meat it should be, he\nanswers 'Uksha'. &nbsp;'Uksha' is used for an\nox, which is capable to produce semen. &nbsp;Or\nthe meat should be of a 'Rishabh'. &nbsp;'Rishabh'\nis a bull more advanced in years than an 'Uksha'.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The white invader did\nNOT spare the Pitru Paksha Shraadh .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE Bhishma said,\n\"With fishes offered at Sraddhas, the Pitris remain gratified for a period\nof two months. &nbsp;With mutton they remain\ngratified for three months and with the flesh of the hare for four. &nbsp;With the flesh of the goat, O king, they\nremain gratified for five months, with bacon for six months, and with the flesh\nof birds for seven. &nbsp;With venison\nobtained from those deer that are called Prishata, they remain gratified for\neight months, and with that obtained from the Ruru for nine months, and with\nthe meat of the Gavaya for ten months. &nbsp;With\nthe meat of the buffalo their gratification lasts for eleven months. &nbsp;With beef presented at the Sraddha, their\ngratification, it is said, lasts for a full year. &nbsp;Payasa mixed with ghee is as much acceptable\nto the Pitris as beef. With the meat of the Vadhrinasa the gratification of the\nPitris lasts for twelve years. The flesh of the rhinoceros, offered to the\nPitris on the anniversaries of the lunar days on which they died, becomes\ninexhaustible. BLAH&nbsp;&nbsp; BLAH&nbsp; FU#KIN\u201d BLAH&nbsp;&nbsp;\n-UNQUOTE&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE: &nbsp;\"And in days of\nyore, O Brahmana, two thousand animals used to be killed every day in the\nkitchen of king Rantideva; and in the same manner two thousand cows were killed\nevery day; and, O best of regenerate beings, king Rantideva acquired unrivalled\nreputation by distributing food with meat every day. BLAH BLAH FU#KIN' BLAH \"- UNQUOTE&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE : &nbsp;Manu Smriti 5/35\nmentions, &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"But a man who, being\nduly engaged (to officiate or to dine at a sacred rite),<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"> refuses to eat meat,\nbecomes after death an animal during twenty-one existences.</span> BLAH BLAH FU#KIN' BLAH \" UNQUOTE -- &nbsp; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE : \"A person of\nmagnanimous heart who eats meat along with a wine named as 'Maadhveek', is\nquickly relieved of tuberculosis BLAH BLAH FU#KIN' BLAH .&nbsp; BLAH BLAH FU#KIN BLAH \" </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Charak Samhita Sutra 158 :UNQUOTE&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Quote : Acharya\nRamanuja also has written a very famed commentary on the Brahma Sutras called\n'Sri Bhasya'. &nbsp;&nbsp;Commenting on the same\nSutra 25 he writes,&nbsp; \"Scripture\ndeclares that the killing of sacrificial animals makes them to go up to the\nheavenly world, and therefore is not of the nature of harm. This is declared in\nthe text, 'The animal killed at the sacrifice having assumed a divine body goes\nto the heavenly world'; 'with a golden body it ascends to the heavenly world.' An\naction which is the means of supreme exaltation is not of the nature of harm,\neven if it involves some little pain; it rather is of beneficial nature.\" BLAH\nBLAH FU#KIN\u2019 BLAH : UNQUOTE</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE : &nbsp;\"Yajna is good for\neveryone, and no one is injured. The animals who are sacrificed, also gain\nultimate good. The ancestors say, \"the animals that are sacrificed in the\nYajna, obtain the higher worlds &nbsp;BLAH BLAH FU#KIN' BLAH \"</span> &nbsp;:&nbsp;&nbsp; <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rigveda\n1/1/4 :UNQUOTE&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE In the Ashwamedha\nYagna 600 animals were killed, and its final\u00e9 was the sacrifice of 21 cows. (\nsome bullshit Gopatha Brahma 1.5.7) UNQUOTE</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE: &nbsp;\u201cHe (the priest)\nconsecrates him (the sacrificer) by sprinkling him with the fat gravy of the\nsacrificial animals, for the gravy of the animals means excellence \u2026 But that\ngravy is also the highest kind of food: with the highest kind of food he thus\nsprinkles him. There are hoof-cups (of gravy) for on hoofs cattle support themselves:\nhe thus causes him to obtain such a support\u2026BLAH BLAH FU#KIN' BLAH \u201d:UNQUOTE&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE :&nbsp; Animal sacrifice in the Soma ceremony. We\njoin the sacrificer\u2019s wife and the adhvaryu priest after the animal has\nbeen\"quietened\" : \u201cThey turn the victim over so it lies on its back \u2026\nthe animal is then cut and when the omentum is pulled out it is heated on the\ncooking fire \u2026 then after the basting of the heart of the animal with clotted\nghee \u2026 then portions are made from various parts of the body BLAH BLAH FU#KIN\u2019 &nbsp;BLAH &nbsp;\u2026UNQUOTE\n\u201d (B 3.8.2-4)&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE : &nbsp;At the ancient\nsacrifices of seers and the Soma offerings \u2026 the sacrificial cakes were\nprepared with the meat of permitted animals and birds. (Manu Smriti 5.22-23)\n\u201cHe may eat meat when it is sacrificially consecrated, at the behest of\nBrahmins, when he is ritually commissioned according to rule\u2026\u201d (5.27).&nbsp; And \u201cThere is no fault in eating meat \u2026 that\nis the natural activity of creatures.\u201d (5.56). BLAH BLAH FU#KIN' BLAH : &nbsp;UNQUOTE&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE : &nbsp;\u201cHe who desires food\nand wishes to grow fat ought to make his Yupa of Bilva wood. For the Bilva tree\nbears fruits every year; it is the symbol of fertility; for it increases (every\nyear) in size from the roots up to the branches, therefore it is a symbol of\nfatness. He who having such a knowledge makes his Yupa of Bilva wood, makes fat\nhis children and cattle.BLAH BLAH FU#KIN' BLAH : UNQUOTE - <b>BR Ambedkar ( Modi's god )&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">( Yupa is NOT a sacrificial animal tether post - it is a Yagam flag post for Lord Vishnu's Garuda )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: x-large;\"><b>TEE HEEEE !!</b></span></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Imam ma himsirekashafam\npashum kanikradam vaajinam vaajineshu</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Do not slaughter this\none hoofed animal that neighs and who goes with a speed faster than most of the\nanimals.-&nbsp; <b>Yajurveda 13.48 &nbsp;5000 BC&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Ghrtam duhaanaamaditim\njanaayaagne maa himsiheeh</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Do not kill cows and\nbulls who always deserve to be protected. <b>Yajurveda\n13.49<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"O Agni, don't\nharm this our cow, the giver of thousands of comforts, the source of immense\nmilk, yielding butter for the people.&nbsp;&nbsp; Let\nthe enemy whom we hate be harmed by you<b>.\"</b></span><b> &nbsp;</b><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yajurveda 13/48&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></b></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">\u201cFor the brahmin, everyday\nwas a beef-stake day.\u201d (From Dr. B.R Ambedkar\u2019s 1948 work \u201cThe\nUntouchables\u2026</span></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">) &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-4XPzlgjs7K8/VHtL1R0GAmI/AAAAAAAAzfU/H849ka8fdJY/s1600/doYLK7Ywnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"289\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-4XPzlgjs7K8/VHtL1R0GAmI/AAAAAAAAzfU/H849ka8fdJY/s1600/doYLK7Ywnload.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">THIS QUOTE IS TRUE- &nbsp; THIS &nbsp;IS THE MAN OUR HINDU MESSIAH &nbsp;NARENDRA MODI STARTS PRAYING TO, &nbsp;AS SOON AS HE SEES A CAMERA !&nbsp;</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE \u201c&nbsp; That the Aryans of the Rig Veda did kill cows\nfor purposes of food and ate beef is abundantly clear from the Rig Veda itself.\n&nbsp;&nbsp;In\nRig Veda (X. 86.14) Indra says: \u201cThey cook for one 15 plus twenty oxen\u201d. &nbsp;&nbsp;The Rig Veda (X.91.14) says that for Agni\nwere sacrificed horses, bulls, oxen, barren cows and rams. &nbsp;&nbsp;From the Rig Veda (X.72.6) it appears that\nthe cow was killed with a sword or axe &nbsp;.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">That the Hindus at one\ntime did kill cows and did eat beef is proved abundantly by the description of\nthe Yajnas given in the Buddhist Sutras which relate to periods much later than\nthe Vedas and the Brahmanas. The scale on which the slaughter of cows and\nanimals took place was colossal. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Samyuta Nikaya\n(111,1-9) we have another description of a Yajna performed by Pasenadi, king of\nKosala. &nbsp;It is said that five hundred bulls, five hundred calves and many\nheifers, goats and rams were led to the pillar to be sacrificed.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">With this evidence no one can doubt that there\nwas a time when Hindus-both Brahmins and non-Brahmins ate not only flesh but\nalso beef. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Coming to Manu there is\nno doubt that he too did. not prohibit the slaughter of the cow. On the other\nhand he made the eating of cow's flesh on certain occasions obligatory. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">---UNQUOTE . </span><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;NARENDRA &nbsp;MODIs GOD AND R STOOGE&nbsp;</span><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>BR AMBEDKAR&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Manu Smriti V. 42.</b> A twice-born man\nwho, knowing the true meaning of the Veda, slays an animal for these purposes,\ncauses both himself and the animal to enter a most blessed state.- <b>BR Ambedkar invention .</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Manu Smriti V. 39</b>. Swayambhu (the\nself-existent) himself created animals for the sake of sacrifices; sacrifices\n(have been instituted) for the good of this whole (world); hence the\nslaughtering (of beasts) for sacrifice is not slaughtering (in the ordinary\nsense of the word).&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><b style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 150%;\">BR Ambedkar invention .</b></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Manu did not regard the\ncow as a sacred animal. On the other hand, he regarded it as an impure animal\nwhose touch caused ceremonial pollution.- &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><b style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 150%;\">BR Ambedkar invention .</b></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Manu had no objection\nto the eating of the cow's flesh.&nbsp; Manu\ndid not make the killing of the cow an offence. Manu divides sins into two\nclasses (i) mortal sins and (ii) minor sins. Among the minor sins Manu\nincludes:&nbsp; XI. 60. Killing the cow- &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><b style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 150%;\">BR Ambedkar invention .</b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to Manu\ncow-killing was only a minor sin. It was reprehensible only if the cow was\nkilled without good and sufficient reason. Even if it was otherwise, it was not\nheinous or inexplicable. The same was the attitude of Yajnavalkya.&nbsp;&nbsp; All this proves that for generations the\nBrahmins had been eating beef. - &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><b style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 150%;\">BR Ambedkar invention .</b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vedanta Sutra which\nproclaims the doctrine of oneness of life does not prohibit the killing of\nanimals for sacrificial purposes as is evident from 11.1.28. &nbsp;In the second place, if the transformation was\ndue to the desire to realise the ideal of Advaita then there is no reason why\nit should have stopped with the cow. &nbsp;It\nshould have extended to all other animals.--&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><b style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 150%;\">BR Ambedkar invention&nbsp;</b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The Brahadamyaka Upanishad upholds the\ndoctrine of transmigration (vi.2) and yet recommends that if a man desires to\nhave a learned son born to him he should prepare a mass of the flesh of the\nbull or ox or of other flesh with rice and ghee. -&nbsp;</span><b style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 150%;\">BR Ambedkar invention&nbsp;</b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Buddhism was at one\ntime the religion of the majority of the people of India. It continued to be\nthe religion of the masses for hundreds of years. It attacked Brahmanism on all\nsides as no religion had done before.&nbsp; Brahmanism\nwas on the wane and if not on the wane, it was certainly on the defensive. As a\nresult of the spread of Buddhism, the Brahmins had lost all power and prestige\nat the Royal Court and among the people. They were smarting under the defeat\nthey had suffered at the hands of Buddhism and were making all possible efforts\nto regain their power and prestige. Buddhism had made so deep an impression on\nthe minds of the masses and had taken such a hold of them that it was\nabsolutely impossible for the Brahmins to fight the Buddhists except by\naccepting their ways and means and practising the Buddhist creed in its extreme\nform. After the death of Buddha his followers started setting up the images of\nthe Buddha and building stupas. The Brahmins followed it. They, in their turn,\nbuilt temples and installed in them images of Shiva, Vishnu and Ram and Krishna\netc \u2013 all with the object of drawing away the crowd that was attracted by the\nimage worship of Buddha. That is how temples and images which had no place in\nBrahmanism came into Hinduism.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Buddhists rejected\nthe Brahmanic religion which consisted of Yajna and animal sacrifice,\nparticularly of the cow. The objection to the sacrifice of the cow had taken a\nstrong hold of the minds of the masses especially as they were an agricultural\npopulation and the cow was a very useful animal. The Brahmins in all\nprobability had come to be hated as the killer of cows in the same way as the\nguest had come to be hated as Gognha, the killer of the cow by the householder,\nbecause whenever he came a cow had to be killed in his honour. That being the\ncase, the Brahmins could do nothing to improve their position against the\nBuddhists except by giving up the Yajna as a form of worship and the sacrifice\nof the cow.<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><b style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 150%;\">BR Ambedkar invention -nay- uska rangeen sapne !</b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">That the object of the\nBrahmins in giving up beef-eating was to snatch away from the Buddhist Bhikshus\nthe supremacy they had acquired is evidenced by the adoption of vegetarianism\nby Brahmins. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Why did the Brahmins\nbecome vegetarian? The answer is that without becoming vegetarian the Brahmins\ncould not have recovered the ground they had lost to their rival namely\nBuddhism. In this connection it must be remembered that there was one aspect in\nwhich Brahmanism suffered in public esteem as compared to Buddhism. That was\nthe practice of animal sacrifice which was the essence of Brahmanism and to\nwhich Buddhism was deadly opposed. That in an agricultural population there\nshould be respect for Buddhism and revulsion against Brahmanism which involved\nslaughter of animals including cows and bullocks is only natural. What could\nthe Brahmins do to recover the lost ground?&nbsp;\nTo go one better than the Buddhist Bhikshus not only to give up\nmeat-eating but to become vegetarians- which they did.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span><b style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 150%;\">BR Ambedkar invention -nay- uska rangeen sapne !&nbsp;</b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As the Buddhist\nBhikshus did eat meat the Brahmins had no reason to give it up. Why then did\nthe Brahmins give up meat-eating and become vegetarians? It was because they\ndid not want to put themselves merely on the same footing in the eyes of the\npublic as the Buddhist Bhikshus.----<b>BR Ambedkar's delusions&nbsp;</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The brahmins wanted to\noust the Buddhists from the place of honour and respect which they had acquired\nin the minds of the masses by their opposition to the killing of the cow for\nsacrificial purposes. To achieve their purpose the Brahmins had to adopt the\nusual tactics of a reckless adventurer. It is to beat extremism with extremism.\nIt is the strategy which all rightists use to overcome the leftists. The only\nway to beat the Buddhists was to go a step further and be vegetarians.--&nbsp;</span><b style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 150%;\">BR Ambedkar's delusions&nbsp;</b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: red;\">If you want to destroy\na society, destroy its history and the society will get destroyed\nautomatically.</span></i> \u2013 Dr. B.R. Ambedkar<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dr. B.R.Ambedkar\u2019s\nviews on the Vedas:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cNow the Brahmins have\nleft no room for doubt, for they have propounded a most mischievous dogma which\nthe Brahmins have spread among the masses, is the dogma of the infallibility of\nthe Vedas. The Vedas are a worthless set of books. There is no reason either to\ncall them sacred or infallible. &nbsp;Nobody has had the courage to ask why these\nworthless books which contain nothing but invocation to tribal gods to destroy\nthe enemies, loot their property and give it to their followers, have been made\nsacred and infallible. But the time has come when the Hindu mind must be freed\nfrom the hold which the silly ideas propagated by the Brahmins, are on them.\nWithout this liberation India has no future. I have undertaken this task\nknowing full well what risk it involves. I am not afraid of consequences. I\nshall be happy if I succeed in stirring the masses\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SIR Ambedkar &nbsp;had found out the hard way that Hinduism is so\ndeeply rooted that it cannot be destroyed.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-bzgAtuO9TcY/VHtZJCjcASI/AAAAAAAAzfs/S885uL3J7VA/s1600/Arthur-Schopenfbh%2Bhauer2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"300\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-bzgAtuO9TcY/VHtZJCjcASI/AAAAAAAAzfs/S885uL3J7VA/s1600/Arthur-Schopenfbh%2Bhauer2.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch -<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">CNN-IBN POLL, THE GREATEST\nINDIAN SINCE MAHATMA GANDHI &nbsp;VADAKAYIL<o:p></o:p></span></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Os5VuOlRVEc/VHtYur3xfHI/AAAAAAAAzfk/b7-vUTk6aQU/s1600/downlffoad.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Os5VuOlRVEc/VHtYur3xfHI/AAAAAAAAzfk/b7-vUTk6aQU/s1600/downlffoad.jpg\" width=\"369\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">YAJURVEDA HAS BEEN IN KERALA FROM 4000 BC WHEN LORD PARASHURAMA BROUGHT IT WITH HIM . &nbsp;IN 2000 BC YAJURVEDA WAS TRANSFERRED TO SRINGERI MUTT . &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE KERALA NAMBOODIRIS HAVE BEEN YAJURVEDIS &nbsp;ADEPT IN ALL VEDIC RITUALS .</span><br />\n<br />\nWE IN KERALA KNOW BETTER !<br />\n<br />\nGONE ARE THE DAYS WHEN A WHITE SKINNED INDOPHILE ( WOLF IN SHEEP'S CLOTHING ) CAN FLY IN TO CALICUT ( MY HOMETOWN ) , &nbsp;STAY AT TAJ HOTEL, &nbsp;TAKE A CHEAP LOCAL TOURIST GUIDE FOR TWO DAYS &nbsp;TO SCOUT AROUND , FLY OUT AND THEN BECOME AN EXPERT ON CALICUT &nbsp;- &nbsp;BETTER THAN CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL WHO WAS BORN THERE .<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Aghnyaa yajamaanasya\npashoonpahi</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cO human! animals are\nAghnya \u2013 not to be killed. Protect the animals\u201d&nbsp;&nbsp; <b>Yajurveda\n1.1<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sattva food ( devoid of\nmeat ) increases the duration of life, purifies one\u2019s existence and gives\nstrength, health, happiness and satisfaction\u2026 Such foods are wholesome and\npleasing to the heart&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; \u2013 <b>Bhagavad Gita, &nbsp;17.8<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://ytimg.googleusercontent.com/vi/RIzUSLRtvcs/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/RIzUSLRtvcs&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/RIzUSLRtvcs&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vedic society was a\nstrictly vegetarian society because a vegetarian diet is conducive to higher\nspiritual realization. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Meat eating is THE\nthe greatest obstacles on the path of spiritual progress. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">White tourists come to\nIndia for liberation. They convert to vegans for a couple of weeks . &nbsp;It is then they realize that bondage and\nliberation are states of mind. &nbsp;&nbsp;They realize\nthe state that liberates the spirit from the illusion of bondage and suffering.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beyond the intellect is\na subtler level from which our power of will arises. Human consciousness and\nhuman behavior are nothing but the states and activities of these various\nbodies of vibrating energy. &nbsp;Toxic\nenergies can also manifest as physical illnesses or defects. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meat is &nbsp;toxic to the body. Their ingestion creates negative\nenergies. On the other hand, fruits, vegetables, and grains are reservoirs of\npure, basic life energies which are very light and malleable.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These energies\nare easily assimilated into all our bodies and made to take on our specific,\nunique life vibrations and karmic patterns.&nbsp;\nBeing vegan facilitates spiritual growth and the expansion of\nconsciousness.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is a true\ncorrelation between our food choices and violence in the world. &nbsp;The only person who would disagree with that\nis a meat-eater. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since\nthese meat eating, single holy book, &nbsp;burial religions came , has this planet known\nany peace ? &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No chemical carcinogen is nearly so important\nin causing human cancer as animal protein. &nbsp;Meat brings out negative qualities such as\nfear, anger, ingratitude , anxiety, aggressiveness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cMind consists of food.\nThat which is the subtle part of milk moves upward when the milk is churned and\nbecomes butter. In the same manner, the subtle part of the food that is eaten\nmoves upward and becomes mind. Thus, mind consists of food\u201d (<b>Chandogya\nUpanishad 6.5.4, 6.6.1,2,5</b>). - <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/--I-UYCqTbt0/VHxbS2oXGwI/AAAAAAAAzgI/A09dIihsQgQ/s1600/imhtrages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/--I-UYCqTbt0/VHxbS2oXGwI/AAAAAAAAzgI/A09dIihsQgQ/s1600/imhtrages.jpg\" width=\"285\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ahimsa&nbsp; means kindness and non-violence towards all\nliving things including animals;&nbsp; it\nrespects living beings as a unity, and includes the belief that all living\nthings are connected.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is very different\nfrom Illuminati agent &nbsp;Gandhi\u2019s ahimsa\nwhere he recruited 13 lakh Indian soldiers for the first World War ( to create\nthe state of Israel ) and reminded his recruits to kill only the Germans and\nNOT the white invader who robbed India blind.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-uBRZQjo0BAE/VHxanPNzXmI/AAAAAAAAzgA/vTvXVFzmrWA/s1600/lionlddamb.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-uBRZQjo0BAE/VHxanPNzXmI/AAAAAAAAzgA/vTvXVFzmrWA/s1600/lionlddamb.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"What need there\nbe said of those innocent and healthy creatures endued with love of life, when\nthey are sought to be slain by sinful wretches subsisting by slaughter? For\nthis reason, O monarch, know that the discarding of meat is the highest refuge\nof religion, of heaven, and of happiness. Abstention from injury is the highest\nreligion. It is, again, the highest penance. It is also the highest truths from\nwhich all duty proceeds. Flesh cannot be had from grass or wood or stone. Unless\na living creature is slain, it cannot be had. Hence is the fault in eating\nflesh... That man who abstains from meat, is never put in fear, O king, by any\ncreature. All creatures seek his protection. He never causes any anxiety in\nothers, and himself has never to become anxious. If there were nobody who ate\nflesh there would then be nobody to kill living creatures. The man who kills\nliving creatures kill them for the sake of the person who eats flesh. If flesh\nwere regarded as inedible, there would then be no slaughter of living\ncreatures. It is for the sake of the eater that the slaughter of living\ncreatures goes on in the world. Since, O thou of great splendour, the period of\nlife is shortened of persons who slaughter living creatures or cause them to be\nslaughtered, it is clear that the person who wishes his own good should give up\nmeat entirely... The purchaser of flesh performs himsa [violence] by his\nwealth; he who eats flesh does so by enjoying its taste; the killer does himsa\nby actually tying and killing the animal. Thus, there are three forms of\nkilling. He who brings flesh or sends for it, he who cuts off the limbs of an\nanimal, and he who purchases, sells, or cooks flesh and eats it\u2014all of these\nare to be considered meat-eaters.\" <b>(Mahabharata\n13.115-4000 BC )<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Those sinful\npersons who are ignorant of actual religious principles, yet consider\nthemselves to be completely pious, without compunction commit violence against\ninnocent animals who are fully trusting in them. In their next lives, such\nsinful persons will be eaten by the same creatures they have killed in this\nworld.\" (<b>Bhagavata Purana 11.5.14)</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"A person fully\naware of religious principles should never offer anything like meat, eggs or\nfish , and even if one is a Kshatriya (warrior), he himself should not eat such\nthings.\" (<b>Bhagavata Purana 7.15.7)</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u091a\u093f\u0924\u094d\u0924</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0928</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0927\u0930\u0908</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br />\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0939\u0928\u0941\u092e\u0924</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0938\u0947\u0907</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0938\u0930\u094d\u092c</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0938\u0941\u0916</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0915\u0930\u0908</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0965\u0969\u096b\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br />\n<br />\nI will not keep any other God in my heart, except Hanuman.<br />\nSo I will not even remember Ram/Vishnu (even though Hanuman himself worships\nRam)?<br />\n<br />\nThis never felt right.<br />\n<br />\nAs soon as Ajit ji wrote this, it was a Eureka moment.<br />\n<br />\nMany thanks, Ajit ji.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; O Lord, make my heart your abode.<br />\n-- CHOOT TULSIDAS NEVER EXISTED<br />\n<br />\npavantanaya sankata harana mangala m\u016brati r\u016bpa</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> r\u0101ma lakhan s\u012bt\u0101 sahita hridaya basahu sura bh\u016bpa</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br />\n<br />\nO Son of V\u0101yu, remover of adversities, one with an auspicious form, and the\nchief among all Devas, may you reside in our hearts along with Rama, Lakshman\nand Sita-- BALLS HANUMAN IS CHIEF AMONG DEVAS--HE IS JUST A MONKEY IN RAMAYANA.\nRAMA IS THE GOD.. WE HAVE RAMA IDOLS IN TEMPLES<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<ol id=\"top-ra\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"c2727712857677526907\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img alt=\"\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-6VOqqm-hCbM/XCa06XjAUxI/AAAAAAABfL4/E3K2A6jHNG0XTf7_mZb9kjj9WxD3GwmzQCK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/01/god-code-by-timothy-paul-smith-damning.html?showComment=1546585871684#c2727712857677526907\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">January 4, 2019 at 12:41 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nATHEIST COMMIE CM PINARAYI VIJAYAN MUST KNOW THIS..<br />\n<br />\nTHE CHIEF TANTRI SHUT DOWN THE SANCTUM FOR ONE HOUR AFTER TWO MENSTRUATING AGE WOMEN BINDU AND KANAKA DURGA WERE SMUGGLED IN AS TRANSGENDERS BY THE POLICE INSIDE AN AMBULANCE..<br />\n<br />\nTHE SABARIMALA INNER SANCTUM WAS CLEANED AND UNDERWENT A PURIFICATION PROCESS.<br />\n<br />\nONE DROP OF BLOOD CANNOT FALL IN THE TEMPLE INNER SANCTUM..<br />\n<br />\nIF THE CHIEF TANTRI HAS A CUT ON HIS BODY AND ONE DROP OF HIS BLOOD SHOWS - IT DOES NOT HAVE TO FALL ON THE GROUND.. THE SAME PURIFICATION RITUAL IS UNDERTAKEN..<br />\n<br />\nIT DOES NOT MATTER IF THE BLOOD BELONGS TO MAN OR WOMAN..<br />\n<br />\nIT WAS THE WHITE INVADER WHO CREATED THAT LIE THAT BLOOD IS COMPULSORY IN TANTRIC TEMPLES..<br />\n<br />\nEVERY SACRIFICE IN A HINDU TEMPLE IS A BLOODLESS SACRIFICE.. THE SACRIFICE IS GHEE AND ELECTROLYTIC PLASMA OF COCONUT WATER..<br />\n<br />\nTHIS IS WHY IN THE IDUMUKETTU THERE IS ONE COCONUT FILLED WITH DESI GHEE AND ANOTHER COCONUT UNBROKEN WHICH HAS THE LIQUID INSIDE..<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2014/11/all-animal-sacrifices-in-hindu-temples.html<br />\n<br />\nTHE COCONUT WITH GHEE IS USED FOR NEY ABHISHEKAM..<br />\n<br />\nTHE INTACT COCONUT WITH WATER INSIDE IS BROKEN WITH INTENTION..<br />\n<br />\nhttps://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/11/5900-year-old-sabarimala-this-planets.html<br />\n<br />\nBBC IS GUILTY OF BLASPHEMY ..THEY HAVE WRITTEN FOUL LIES ABOUT SABARIMALA..<br />\n<br />\nIT WAS NO COINCIDENCE THAT BBCs MARK TULLY WITNESSED INDIRA GANDHIs MURDER.. THEY KNEW IT WOULD HAPPEN .. They are indeed the same, just as musk and its scent are inseparable, or as fire and its heat are nondifferent. Thus Radha and Lord Krsna are one, yet They have taken two forms to enjoy the mellows of pastimes. (Cc. Adi 4.96-98)<br />\n<br />\nisvarera sakti haya e-tina prakara<br />\neka laksmi-gana, pure mahisi-gana ara<br />\nvraje gopi-gana ara sabhate pradhana<br />\nvrajendra-nandana ya'te svayam bhagavan<br />\n<br />\nThe energies (consorts) of the Supreme Lord are of three kinds: the Laksmis in Vaikuntha, the queens in Dvaraka, and the gopis in Vrndavana. The gopis are the best of all, for they have the privilege of serving Sri Krsna, the primeval Lord, the son of the King of Vraja (Cc. Adi 1.79,80)<br />\n<br />\nSORRY -- All this bull about Radha being a mistress of Lord Krishna and all his thousands of Gopikas whom he flirted with , are all poisons injected into Hinduism by the white Christian invader. SORRY, SHIVA IS A COMIC ALLEGORY<br />\n<br />\nNOW HE GIVES HAJJAR BULL ABOUT HEAVEN, HELL AND CHITRAGUPTA..<br />\n<br />\nSORRY --THERE IS NO HEAVEN AND HELL IN HINDUISM.. WE NEVER HEARD OF CHITRAGUPTA ( AND MISSING LINK KAYASTHAS ) TILL THE WHITE INVADER CAME TO INDIA..<br />\n<br />\nIN SANATANA DHARMA HEAVEN IS THE SEVENTH ASTRAL LAYER ( BRAHMAN THE FIELD ) WHO SHEARED OFF A SMALL BIT OF HIS BODY AND SEND YOU AS A SOUL ( BALL OF ENERGY ) AT ITS LOWEST FREQUENCY TO GAIN LIFE EXPERIENCE..<br />\n<br />\nYOU ( YOUR SOUL EVOLVED ) FROM BACTERIA, TO BIRD, TO ANIMAL TO HUMAN WITH LOW FREQUENCY SOULD TO MOKSHA SOUL OF HIGHEST FREQUENCY , SAME AS BRAHMAN --AFTER WHICH YOUR SOUL MERGED BACK WITH MOTHER FIELD OF BRAHMAN TO SHARE LIFE EXPERIENCES WITH ITS MOTHER ..<br />\n<br />\nWHEN THE FEED BACK STOPS IN THIS CLOSED LOOP --PRALAYA ( DISSOLUTION ) HAPPENS ..<br />\n<br />\nFIRST ASTRAL LATER IS MEANT FOR ALL SPECIES OF LIVES --EXCEPT HUMAN .. THE SOULS OF CRIMINALS/ HOMOSEXUALS WHO HAVE NO CONSCIENCE ARE IN THE LAYER..<br />\n<br />\nSECOND TO SIXTH LAYERS ARE MEANT ONLY FOR CONSCIOUS HUMANS..<br />\n<br />\nTHE SECOND ASTRAL LAYER MEANT FOR SOULS WITH LOWEST FREQUENCY ( HIGH NEGATIVE KARMIC BAGGAGE ) AND THE SIXTH ASTRAL HAVING PARKING SPACE FOR SOULS OF HIGHER FREQUENCY ( LOW NEGATIVE KARMIC BAGGAGE ).<br />\n<br />\nYAMA IS IN CHARGE OF LAYERS TWO TO SIX..<br />\n<br />\nALL SOULS IN FIRST TO SIXTH ASTRAL LAYERS --AWAIT RE-BIRTH.<br />\n<br />\nSEVENTH ASTRAL LAYER IS THE FIELD OF BRAHMAN ( VAIKUNTA ).. HERE ONLY MOKSHA SOULS -- NIL EGO, NIL KRAMIC BAGGAGE AND HIGHEST SOULD FREQUENCY ( SAME AS MOTHER FIELD BRAHMAN ) CAN ENTER --TO BE MERGED WITH BRAHMAN ( GOD )..<br />\n<br />\nONLY SOULS CAN ENTER ALL SEVEN ASTRAL LAYERS --NOT THE PHYSICAL BODY ..<br />\n<br />\nTHE RASCAL SADUGU JAGGI VASUDEV LIES ABOUT PLENTY FOOD TO EAT AND APSARAS FOR SEX IN SEVENTH LAYER .. BALLS !<br />\n<br />\nWHEN THE 5 PANDAVA BROTHERS AND DRAUPADI DECIDE TO CLIMB MOUNT MERU --IT IS AN ALLEGORY FOR DEATH AND SOULS PARKING AT ONE OF THE SEVEN ASTRAL LAYERS<br />\n<br />\nYAMA ( DHARMA ) IN THE FORM OF A DOG JOINS THIS GROUP ..<br />\n<br />\nYAMA USHERS IN --<br />\nDRAUPADI INTO THE SECOND ASTRAL LAYER<br />\nNAKULA INTO THE THIRD ASTRAL LAYER<br />\nSAHADEVA INTO THE FOURTH ASTRAL LAYER<br />\nBHIMA INTO THE FIFTH ASTRAL LAYER<br />\nARJUNA INTO THE SIXTH ASTRAL LAYER<br />\n<br />\nAND THEN YUDHISTRA LOOKS BACK AND SEES THE DOG.. HE KNOWS THAT NO DOG CAN GET PAST THE FIRST ASTRAL LAYER --AND HE IS PUZZLED..<br />\n<br />\nAT THE SEVENT ASTRAL LAYER ( EQUIVALENT OF HEAVEN ) YUDDHISTRA SEES ALL HUNDRED KAURAVAS ALREADY THERE -- ALONG WITH THE STALWARTS LIKE BHISHMA/ DRONA /KARNA ETC<br />\n<br />\nHE IS SHOCKED AND ANGRY<br />\n<br />\nAT THAT TIME YAMA ( THE DOORKEEPER OF ASTRAL LAYERS 2 TO 6 ) DECLARES THAT HE IS YUDDHISTRAs FATHER WITH KUNTI .. AND THAT YUDDHISTRA STILL HAS SEEDS OF EGO WITHIN HIMS WHICH MAKES HIM UNFIT FOR MOKSHA ..<br />\n<br />\nYAMAs EXPLANATION: WHOEVER KRISHNA KILLED --ALL GOT MOKSHA .. Luke says, \u201cAnd the Holy Spirit came down in a bodily shape, like a dove on Him.\u201d Because the Holy Spirit is just that\u2014spirit\u2014He is not visible to us. On this occasion, however, the Spirit took on a visible appearance and was doubtless seen by the people. Once, Sati asked Shiva to give her food. When Shiva declines, the goddess eats him to satisfy her extreme hunger. When Shiva requests her to disgorge him, she obliges. Shiva then rejects her and curses her to assume the form of a widow.UNQUOTE<br />\n<br />\nTEE HEEEEE<br />\n<br />\nDhumavati is astute and deviant \u2013 she initiates quarrels and invokes fear. HE WENT AROUND BOASTING.. OUR COLEGIUM JUDICIARY CRIED \u201c FREEDOM OF EXPRESSION\u201d.<br />\n<br />\nBUT WITHIN A WEEK UC ANANTHAMURTHY HAD KIDNEY PROBLEMS AND TO DEFRAY THE EXPENSES OF EXPENSIVE DIALYSIS THE ITALIAN WAITRESS MADE HIM VC OF AN UNIVERSITY..<br />\n<br />\nOF COURSE UC ANATHAMURTHY WOULD NEVER PISS ON A STATUE OF JESUS / MARY OR THE HOLY KORAN TO BRAND THEM POWERLESS TO STRIKE BACK..<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">ATHEIST RATIONALISTS MUST KNOW THAT SANATANA DHARMA HAS ZERO SUPERSTITION..</span></b></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_34MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><b><br /></b></span>THE DAY MODERN SCIENCE CAN TIDE UP AND BREACH THE LAST FRONTIER TO MEET SANATANA DHARMA AND SEE EYE TO EYE , THERE WILL BE PRALAYA ( COSMIC DISSOLUTION ) DUE TO STAGNATION..<br />\n<br />\nFOR EXAMPLE -- ALBERT EINSTEIN STOLE ALL HIS AWARD WINNING THEORIES FROM VEDANTA..<br />\n<br />\nEINSTEIN JUST PUT SOME MATH AND MADE SUBJECTIVE ANCIENT VEDANTA LOOK LIKE OBJECTIVE MODERN SCIENCE.. THE BEST PART IS THAT HE OUTSOURCED HIS MATH TO INDIA AND HE WAS POOR IN MATH..<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2014/08/yellapragada-subbarow-nobel-prize-and.html</span><br />\n<br />\nVISHNU IS A COSMIC ALLEGORY ..AN ENERGY FIELD --JUST LIKE BRAHMA AND SHIVA ON A MACRO AND MICRO SCALE..<br />\n<br />\nA BLOGGER NAMED CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL WAS THE FIRST TO REVEAL THIS.. SHE IS NOT A MORTAL WOMAN..<br />\n<br />\nTHE SPOT ADI SHANKARACHARYA LOOKED BACK, DEVI DISAPPEARED AND HE CONSECRATED THE POWERFUL MOOKAMBIKA TEMPLE THERE ..<br />\n<br />\nTHOUGH THE TEMPLE IS IN KOLOOR KARNATAKA, ONLY MALAYALIS DEVOTEES GO THERE ..WE KNOW WHAT IT IS..<br />\n<br />\nTHERE ARE UNDERGROUND WATER CHANNELS FROM THE TOP OF KUDAJADRI MOUNTAIN TO THE INNER SANCTUM OF MOOKAMBIKA TEMPLE..<br />\n<br />\nDURING THESE RECENT FLOODS THE TEMPLE WAS PARTIALLY SUBERGED..<br />\n<br />\nSAME IN GIZA PYRAMIDS.. />\n\u092a\u094d\u0930\u0935\u0943\u0924\u094d\u0924\u0947 \u0936\u0938\u094d\u0924\u094d\u0930\u0938\u092e\u094d\u092a\u093e\u0924\u0947 \u0927\u0928\u0941\u0930\u0941\u0926\u094d\u092f\u092e\u094d\u092f \u092a\u093e\u0923\u094d\u0921\u0935: || 20||<br />\n\u0939\u0943\u0937\u0940\u0915\u0947\u0936\u0902 \u0924\u0926\u093e \u0935\u093e\u0915\u094d\u092f\u092e\u093f\u0926\u092e\u093e\u0939 \u092e\u0939\u0940\u092a\u0924\u0947 |<br />\n<br />\natha vyavasthit\u0101n d\u1e5bi\u1e63h\u1e6dv\u0101 dh\u0101rtar\u0101\u1e63h\u1e6dr\u0101n&nbsp;<span style=\"color: red;\">kapih</span>-dhwaja\u1e25<br />\nprav\u1e5bitte \u015bhastra-samp\u0101te dhanurudyamya p\u0101\u1e47\u1e0dava\u1e25<br />\nh\u1e5bi\u1e63h\u012bke\u015bha\u1e41 tad\u0101 v\u0101kyam idam \u0101ha mah\u012b-pate<br />\n<br />\natha\u2014thereupon; vyavasthit\u0101n\u2014arrayed; d\u1e5bi\u1e63h\u1e6dv\u0101\u2014seeing; dh\u0101rtar\u0101\u1e63h\u1e6dr\u0101n\u2014Dhritarashtra\u2019s sons; kapih-dwaja\u1e25\u2014the Monkey Bannered (&nbsp;<b><span style=\"color: red;\">MY LEFT BALL</span></b>&nbsp;) ; prav\u1e5bitte\u2014about to commence; \u015bhastra-samp\u0101te\u2014to use the weapons; dhanu\u1e25\u2014bow; udyamya\u2014taking up; p\u0101\u1e47\u1e0dava\u1e25\u2014Arjun, the son of Pandu; h\u1e5bi\u1e63h\u012bke\u015bham\u2014to Shree Krishna; tad\u0101\u2014at that time; v\u0101kyam\u2014words; idam\u2014these; \u0101ha\u2014said; mah\u012b-pate\u2014King<br />\nTranslation<br />\nBG 1.20: At that time, the son of Pandu, Arjun, who had the insignia of Hanuman (&nbsp;<b><span style=\"color: red;\">MY LEFT BALL</span></b>&nbsp;) on the flag of his chariot, took up his bow. Seeing your sons arrayed against him, O King, Arjun then spoke the following words to Shree Krishna.<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">KAPIH DWAJAH IS NOT MONKEY FLAG</span><br /><span style=\"color: blue;\">KAPIH MEANS VISHNU\u2014</span><br /><span style=\"color: blue;\">\u201cKAPIH DWAJAH\u201d MEANS VISHNUs BANNER \u2013 GARUDA</span><br /><span style=\"color: red;\">KAPIH&nbsp;</span><span style=\"color: blue;\">( sun ) is one of the 1008 names of Vishnu in Vishnu Sahasranamah</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: purple;\">IN SANSKRIT AND MALAYALAM KAPI MEANS BROWN.<br />IN MALAYALAM WE CALL IT COFFEE COLOUR.<br />KAPI DOES NOT MEAN MONKEY IN MALAYALAM AND SANSKRIT</span></b><br />\n<br />\n###################3<br />\n<br />\nONLY CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL HAS THE CEREBRAL WHEREWITHAL TO TELL ALL THIS..<br />\n<br />\nJEW ROTHCHILD NEVER EXPECTED A BLOGGER CAPTAIN IN TOWN !<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n<div style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; IT IS ABOUT HYGEINE<br />\n<br />\nMANY TIMES PEOPLE HAVE ASKED ME-- WHY DO HINDU MALE DEVOTEES GO BARE CHEST IN KERALA TEMPLE-- SAY GURUVAYUR.<br />\n<br />\nIN HINDU TEMPLES BLOOD OUTSIDE THE SKIN IS CONSIDERED IMPURE --IN THIS AIDS ERA WE KNOW WHY.. THIS APPLIES TO HUMANS AND ANIMALS..<br />\n<br />\nIF A COW OR AN ELEPHANT BLEEDS IT IS TAKEN OUT OF THE TEMPLE. IF A PUJARI BLEEDS HE HAS TO STOP IMMEDIATELY --ND THEN THERE IS A RITUAL TO PURIFY.. THIS CAN HAPPEN EVEN IF A SMALL BABY PISSES ON THE TEMPLE FLOOR..<br />\n<br />\nA DROP OF BLOOD OUTSIDE THE BODYs LEATHER BAG ( SKIN COVER ) IS CONSIDERED IMPURE..<br />\n<br />\nYET--AFTER THE WHITE INVADER CAME TO INDIA, HE CREATED MORE THAN A THOUSAND FAKE MUTTS..AND THEY INTRODUCED BLOOD SACRIFICE INSIDE TEMPLES..
